translation: व्यापारवीर्यधैर्यै in effort, strength and courage, पराक्रमैः in prowess as well, परिक्षीणं deterioration, तम् Vali, दुन्दुभिम् Dundubhi, उद्यम्य having lifted, धरण्याम् on the ground, अभ्यपातयत् hit down, तदा then, प्राणहरे in the deadly, तस्मिन् in that, युद्धे fight, दुन्दुभिः Dundubhi, निष्पिष्ट: crushed, पातयतः thrown down, तस्य his, महाकायः of huge body, पञ्चत्वम् resolved into the five elements (dead), आगतः go, क्षितौ on the ground, पपात fell down.
explanation: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.

shloka_text: तं तोलयित्वा बाहुभ्यां गतसत्त्वमचेतनम्। चिक्षेप बलवान्वाली वेगेनैकेन योजनम्4.11.47।।
translation: बलवान् powerful, वाली Vali, गतसत्त्वम् life drained, अचेतनम् lost consciousness, तम् him, बाहुभ्याम् with both shoulders, तोलयित्वा after lifting, एकेन in one piece, वेगेन with speed, योजनम् distance of a yojana (eight miles), चिक्षेप hurled.
explanation: 'Mighty Vali lifted on both shoulders the insensate body drained of life and hurled it speedily to a distance of a yojana.

shloka_text: तस्य वेगप्रविद्धस्य वक्त्रात्क्षतजबिन्दवः। प्रपेतुर्मारुतोत्क्षिप्ता मतङ्गप्याश्रमं प्रति4.11.48।।
translation: वेगप्रविद्धस्य flung, तस्य his, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, क्षतजबिन्दवः drops of blood, मारुतोत्क्षिप्ताः scattered by the wind, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, आश्रमं प्रति at the hermitage of, प्रपेतुः fell.
explanation: 'Scattered by the wind, drops of blood fell at the hermitage of Matanga from the mouth of the deadbody flung.

shloka_text: तान्दृष्ट्वा पतितांस्तस्य मुनिश्शोणितविप्रुषः। क्रुद्धस्तत्र महाभागश्चिन्तयामास कोन्वयम्4.11.49।।
translation: महाभागः venerable one, मुनिः sage, तत्र there, पतितान् fallen, शोणितविप्रुषः drops of blood, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तस्य his, क्रुद्धः became angry, अयम् this, को नु who can  he be, चिन्तयामास started thinking.
explanation: 'The venerable sage became furious to see drops of blood fallen there. He started thinking who could he be?

shloka_text: येनाहं सहसा स्पृष्टश्शोणितेन दुरात्मना। कोऽयं दुरात्मा दुर्भुदि्घरकृतात्मा च बालिशः4.11.50।।
translation: दुरात्मना wicked self, येन by whom, अहम् I, सहसा instantly, शोणितेन with blood, स्पृष्टः touched, दुरात्मा a villain, दुर्भुद्धि: evilminded, अयम् he, बालिशः a petty man, कः who?
explanation: 'Who is that petty, wicked, evil minded one who caused the drops of blood to touch (fall on) me suddenly?

shloka_text: इत्युक्त्वाऽथ विनिष्क्रम्य ददर्श मुनिसत्तमः। महिषं पर्वताकारं गतासुं पतितं भुवि4.11.51।।
translation: सः he, मुनिसत्तमः venerable sage, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, विनिष्क्रम्य having come out, गतासुम् a dead one, भुवि on the floor, पतितम् fallen, पर्वताकारम् with a mountaneous form, महिषम् buffalo, ददृशे saw.
explanation: 'The venerable sage came out of the hermitage and saw a mountaneous buffalo fallen dead on the floor.

shloka_text: स तु विज्ञाय तपसा वानरेण कृतं हि तत्। उत्ससर्ज महाशापं क्षेप्तारं वालिनं प्रति4.11.52।।
translation: सः he, तत् that, वानरेण by the monkey, कृतम् done, तपसा by ascetic vision, विज्ञाय having known, क्षेप्तारम् who hurled, वालिनं प्रति at that Vali, महाशापम् great curse, उत्ससर्ज pronounced.
explanation: 'Having known through his ascetic vision that it was the act of a monkey, he pronounced a curse on Vali who had hurled (the body):

shloka_text: इह तेनाप्रवेष्टव्यं प्रविष्टस्य वधो भवेत्। वनं मत्संश्रयं येन दूषितं रुधिरस्रवैः4.11.53।।
translation: मत्संश्रयम् under my protection, वनम् forest, येन by whom, रुधिरस्रवैः with drops of blood, दूषितम् is violated, तेन by him, इह here, न प्रवेष्टव्यम्  should not enter, प्रविष्टस्य of him who enters, वधः death, भवेत् will take place.
explanation: 'Whoever has desecrated this forest, protected by me, with drops of blood is forbidden to enter this place. Once he does it, he will die.

shloka_text: सम्भग्नाः पादपाश्चैमेक्षिपतेहासुरीं तनुम्। समन्तादाद्योजनं पूर्णमाश्रमं मामकं यदि4.11.54।। आगमिष्यति दुर्बुद्धिर्व्यक्तं स न भविष्यति।
translation: आसुरीम् demon's, तनुम् body, क्षिपता  hurled, इमे those, पादपाश्च trees also, सम्भग्नाः are broken, समन्तात् all over, पूर्णम् entire, योजनम् yojana, मामकम् mine, आश्रमम् hermitage, आगमिष्यति if he comes, दुर्बुद्धिः wicked  one, सः he, न भविष्यति will not survive.
explanation: 'Whoever has broken the trees all over this forest and has thrown the demon's body will not survive if he enters within a radius of one yojana  of my hermitage.

shloka_text: ये चापि सचिवाः स्तस्य संश्रिता मामकं वनम्4.11.55।। न च तैरिह वस्तव्यं श्रुत्वा यान्तु यथासुखम्।
translation: मामकम् my, वनम् forest, संश्रिताः taking refuge, ये (केचित्) indeed, अस्य सचिवाः his counsellors, तैः च by them also, इह here, न वस्तव्यम् should not stay, श्रुत्वा on hearing, यथासुखम् safely, यान्तु depart.
explanation: 'Indeed his counsellors who are here must leave this forest. Let them depart safely.

shloka_text: यदि तेऽपी ह तिष्ठन्ति शपिष्ये तानपि ध्रुवम्4.11.56।। वनेऽस्मिन्मामके नित्यं पुत्रवत्परिरक्षिते। पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय फलमूलाभवाय च4.11.57।।
translation: नित्यम् always, पुत्रवत् like a son, परिरक्षिते protected, मामके my, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, तेऽपि they also, पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय for destroying shoots, फलमूलाभवाय च and for the loss of fruits and roots etc, तिष्ठन्ति यदि if they stay back, तानपि them also, ध्रुवम् certainly, शपिष्ये I will curse.
explanation: 'If the monkeys stay back to destroy the leaves and shoots and plunder the fruits and roots of this forest which I have protected just like my son will also certainly invite my curse.

shloka_text: यदि तेऽपी ह तिष्ठन्ति शपिष्ये तानपि ध्रुवम्4.11.56।। वनेऽस्मिन्मामके नित्यं पुत्रवत्परिरक्षिते। पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय फलमूलाभवाय च4.11.57।।
translation: नित्यम् always, पुत्रवत् like a son, परिरक्षिते protected, मामके my, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, तेऽपि they also, पत्राङ्कुरविनाशाय for destroying shoots, फलमूलाभवाय च and for the loss of fruits and roots etc, तिष्ठन्ति यदि if they stay back, तानपि them also, ध्रुवम् certainly, शपिष्ये I will curse.
explanation: 'If the monkeys stay back to destroy the leaves and shoots and plunder the fruits and roots of this forest which I have protected just like my son will also certainly invite my curse.

shloka_text: दिवसश्चास्य मर्यादा यं द्रष्टा श्वोऽस्मि वानरम्। बहुवर्षसहस्राणि स वै शैलो भविष्यति4.11.58।।
translation: अस्य for him, दिवसः one day, मर्यादा time limit, श्वः tomorrow, यम् whosoever, वानरम् monkey, द्रष्टास्मि I will see, सः he, बहुवर्षसहस्राणि for many thousands of years, शैलः mountain, भविष्यति will become.
explanation: 'I give one day's time for the monkeys (to leave). Whomsoever, I see tomorrow will get transformed into a mountain for many thousands of years'

shloka_text: ततस्ते वानराश्श्रुत्वा गिरं मुनिसमीरिताम्। निश्चक्रमुर्वनात्तस्मात्तान्दृष्ट्वा वालिरब्रवीत्4.11.59।।
translation: ततः then, ते those, वानराः monkeys, मुनिसमीरिताम् spoken by the sage, गिरम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, तस्मात् वनात् from that forest, निश्चक्रमुः went away, तान् the, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, वालिः Vali, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: 'The monkeys fled on hearing the words spoken by the sage. Said Vali:

shloka_text: किं भवन्तस्समस्ताश्च मतङ्गवनवासिनः। मत्समीपमनुप्राप्ता अपि स्वस्ति वनौकसाम्4.11.60।।
translation: मतङ्गवनवासिनः residents of the groves of Matanga, भवन्तः you, समस्ताः all, किम् why, मत्समीपम् to me, अनुप्राप्ताः came here, वनौकसाम् for all the monkeys, अपि स्वस्ति hope all are safe.
explanation: 'Why have you, residents of the groves of Matanga, come to me? Hope all are safe'

shloka_text: ततस्ते कारणं सर्वं तदा शापं च वालिनः। शशंसुर्वानरास्सर्वे वालिने हेममालिने4.11.61।।
translation: ततः then, सर्वे all, ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वम् everything, कारणम् reason, तदा then, वालिनः of Vali, शापं च curse also, हेममालिने to him wearing golden necklace, वालिने to Vali, शशंसुः narrated.
explanation: 'Then all the monkeys collected together and narrated everything about the curse given to Vali , adorned with a golden chain(on his neck).

shloka_text: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तदा वाली वचनं वानरेरितम्। स महर्षिंतदाऽसाद्य याचते स्म कृताञ्जलिः4.11.62।।
translation: तदा then, सः वाली that Vali, वानरेरितम् spoken by monkeys, एतत् all that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands, महर्षिम् to the sage, (सम्) आसाद्य having approached, याचते स्म begged.
explanation: 'On hearing the monkeys, Vali went to the sage and begged forgiveness with folded hands.

shloka_text: महर्षिस्तमनादृत्य प्रविवेशाश्रमं तदा। शापधारणभीतस्तु वाली विह्वलतां गतः4.11.63।।
translation: महर्षिः great sage, तम् him, अनादृत्य without obliging, आश्रमं to the hermitage, तदा then, प्रविवेश entered, वाली Vali, शापधारणभीतः with the fear of hearing the curse, विह्वलताम् agrieved, गतः became.
explanation: 'The sage went into the hermitage without obliging Vali who became apprehensive of the curse of the sage.

shloka_text: ततश्शापभयाद्भीत ऋश्यमूकं महागिरिम्। प्रवेष्टुं नेच्छति हरिर्द्रष्टुं वापि नरेश्वर4.11.64।।
translation: नरेश्वर O Lord Rama, ततः then onwards, हरिः monkeys, शापभयात् for fear of the curse, भीतः frightened, महागिरिम् great mountain, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, द्रष्टुं वापि even to see, नेच्छति does not like.
explanation: 'O Lord Rama because of the fear of the curse, Vali will not enter the great Rishyamuka mountain nor will he like to see it.

shloka_text: तस्याप्रवेशं ज्ञात्वाऽहमिदं राम महावनम्। विचरामि सहामात्यो विषादेन विवर्जितः4.11.65।।
translation: राम O Rama, अहम् I, तस्य his, अप्रवेशम् entry prohibited, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, विषादेन apprehension, विवर्जितः without, सहामात्यः accompanied by ministers, इदम् this, महावनम् great forest, विचरामि I am roaming about.
explanation: 'O Rama aware of the prohibition of Vali from entering the place, I roam about this great forest  accompanied by my ministers without any apprehension.

shloka_text: एषोऽस्थिनिचयस्तस्य दुन्दुभेस्सम्प्रकाशते। वीर्योत्सेकान्निरस्तस्य गिरिकूटोपमो महान्4.11.66।।
translation: वीर्योत्सेकात् with pride of prowess, निरस्तस्य thrown away, तस्य दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, गिरिकूटोपमो as the mountain peak, महान् huge, एषः this, अस्थिनिचयः heap of bones, सम्प्रकाशते is shining
explanation: 'Hurled with the pride of his(Vali's) prowess is this heap of bones of Dundubhi here, which shines like a huge mountain peak.

shloka_text: इमे च विपुलास्सालास्सप्त शाखावलम्बिनः। यत्रैकं घटते वाली निष्पत्रयितुमोजसा4.11.67।।
translation: शाखावलम्बिनः  branches overlapping one another, इमे these, सप्त seven, विपुलाः sturdy, सालाः Sala trees, यत्र there, एकम् one, वाली Vali, ओजसा his own, निष्पत्रयितुम् to remove its leaves, घटते he is competent.
explanation: 'Look at these seven sturdy Sala trees with branches  of one overlapping the other.  Vali was able to remove all the leaves of one Sala tree with just one arrow.

shloka_text: एतदस्यासमं वीर्यं मया राम प्रकीर्तितम्। कथं तं वालिनं हन्तुं समरे शक्ष्यसे नृप4.11.68।।
translation: राम O Rama, अस्य his, असमम् unequalled, एतत् this, वीर्यम् strength, प्रकीर्तितम् is narrated, नृप king, समरे in a combat, तं वालिनम् that Vali's, हन्तुम् to kill, कथम् how is it, शक्ष्यसे it is possible for you?
explanation: 'O Rama Vali's strength and fame related by me is unequalled. O king how is it possible for you to kill him in a combat?'

shloka_text: तथा ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं प्रहसन् लक्ष्मणोऽब्रवीत्। कस्मिन्कर्मणि निर्वृत्ते श्रद्दध्या वालिनो वधम्4.11.69।।
translation: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तथा that way, ब्रुवाणम् while he spoke, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, प्रहसन् with a smile, अब्रवीत् said, कस्मिन् in which, कर्मणि in action, निवृत्ते when carried out, वालिनः Vali's, वधम् killing, श्रद्दध्याः trust
explanation: Smiling, Lakshmana asked Sugriva, 'By what action will you trust?. By the fulfilment of which task (by Rama) will you have faith?'

shloka_text: तमुवाचाथ सुग्रीवस्सप्त सालानिमान्पुरा। एवमेकैकशो वाली विव्याथाथ स चासकृत्। 4.11.70।।
translation: अथ then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तम् him, उवाच said, पुरा earlier, सः वाली that Vali, इमान् these, सप्तसालान् seven sala trees, एवम् in this way, एकैकशः one after the other, अथ then, असकृत् several times, विव्याध struck.
explanation: Then Sugriva told Lakshmana that earlier Vali had split through these seven Sala trees one after the other, several times.

shloka_text: रामोऽपिदारयेदेषां बाणेनैकेन च द्रुमम्। वालिनं निहतं मन्ये दृष्ट्वा रामस्य विक्रमम्4.11.71।।
translation: रामः Rama, अपि also, एषाम् these, द्रुमम् trees, एकेन with one, बाणेन with arrow, दारयेत् pierce through(split), रामस्य Rama's, विक्रमम् prowess, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, वालिनम् Vali, निहतम् killing, मन्ये I think, अपि also.
explanation: 'If I see Rama splitting these trees with one arrow, I will believe he can kill Vali with his prowess.

shloka_text: हतस्य महिषस्यास्थि पादेनैकेन लक्ष्मण। उद्यम्याथ प्रक्षिपेच्चेत्तरसा द्वे धनुश्शते4.11.72।।
translation: लक्ष्मण  Lakshmana, हतस्य of the dead, महिषस्य buffalo's, अस्थि skeleton, एकेन by one, पादेन by the foot, उद्यम्य lifted, तरसा with his strength, द्वेधनुः शते a distance of eight hundred hands (distance of two hundred bows), प्रक्षिपेच्चापि if he can also hurl.
explanation: 'O Lakshmana and if Rama can also lift the dead buffalo's (Dundubhi's) skeleton and hurl it to a distance  of two hundred bows with one of his feet.

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवो रामं रक्तान्तलोचनम्। ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं काकुत्स्थं पुनरेव वचोऽब्रवीत्4.11.73।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रक्तान्तलोचनम् with reddened eyes, रामम् Rama, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, मुहूर्तम् for a moment after, ध्यात्वा thinking, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, पुनरेव again, वचः these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Having said this and thinking for a moment, Sugriva again said to the heroic Rama whose eyes had turned red.

shloka_text: शूरश्च शूरघाती च प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः। बलवान्वानरो वाली संयुगेष्वपराजितः4.11.74।।
translation: शूरश्च hero, शूरघाती च killer of heroes, प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः wellknown for prowess and valour, बलवान् powerful, वानरः वाली monkey Vali, संयुगेषु in combat, अपराजितः unconquered.
explanation: 'Powerful Vali is valiant and has killed brave fighters. He is wellknown for his prowess and valour. He has not faced defeat in war.

shloka_text: दृश्यन्ते चास्य कर्माणि दुष्कराणि सुरैरपि। यानि सञ्चिन्त्य भीतोऽहमृश्यमूकं समाश्रितः4.11.75।।
translation: सुरैरपि even by gods, दुष्कराणि difficult, तस्य his, कर्माणि tasks, दृश्यन्ते are seen(all over), यानि all those, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking of, भीतः fear, अहम् I, ऋष्यमूकम् at Rishyamuka, उपाश्रितः I have taken refuge.
explanation: 'Even gods cannot do what he has done. Thinking of all this and being afraid of him, I have taken refuge at Rishyamuka.

shloka_text: तमजय्यमधृष्यं च वानरेन्द्रममर्षणम्। विचिन्तयन्न मुञ्चामि ऋश्यमूकमहन्विमम्4.11.76।।
translation: तम् him, वानरेन्द्रम् lord of monkeys, अजय्यम् invincible, अधृष्यम् one who can not be overpowered, अमर्षणम् indignant, विचिन्तयन् while thinking over, अहम् I, ऋष्यमूकम् Rishyamuka, न मुञ्चामि I have not left, इयम this.
explanation: 'Thinking that this indignant, invincible lord of the monkeys, cannot be overpowered, I have not stepped out of Rishyamuka.

shloka_text: उपलब्धं च मे श्लाघ्यं सन्मित्रं मित्रवत्सल। त्वामहं पुरुषव्याघ्र हिमवन्तमिवाश्रितः4.11.78।।
translation: श्लाघ्यम् praiseworthy, सन्मित्रम् a good friend, मे to me, उपलब्धम् Is obtained, मित्रवत्सल O loyal to friends, पुरुषव्याघ्र tiger among men, अहम् I am, हिमवन्तमिव like the Himalaya, त्वाम् you, आश्रितः seek your protection.
explanation: 'I have discovered in you a faithful friend. O tiger among men, O venerable one, you are to me like the Himalayas.

shloka_text: किं तु तस्य बलज्ञोऽहं दुर्भ्रातुर्बलशालिनः। अप्रत्यक्षं तु मे वीर्यं समरे तव राघव4.11.79।।
translation: किं तु but, अहम् I, बलशालिनः  mighty, दुर्भ्रातुः bad brother's, तस्य his, बलज्ञः know his strength, राघव Rama, समरे in war, तव your, वीर्यं तु power also, मे I, अप्रत्यक्षम् not see.
explanation: 'What to do? I know the strength of my mighty bad brother. But so far I have not seen your power in a battle.

shloka_text: न खल्वहं त्वां तुलये नावमन्ये न भीषये। कर्मभिस्तस्य भीमैस्तु कातर्यं जनितं मम4.11.80।।
translation: अहम् I am, त्वाम् your, न खलु तुलये indeed do not compare, नावमन्ये I do not insult you, न भीषये  not to scare , तस्य his, भीमैः by dreadful, कर्मभिः by his actions, मम  in me, कातर्यम् cowardice, जनितम् is created.
explanation: 'The dreadful acts of Vali have made me feel timid. This is not to compare you with him or your strength with his or insult you and scare you.

shloka_text: कामं राघव ते वाणी प्रमाणं धैर्यमाकृतिः। सूचयन्ति परं तेजो भस्मच्छन्नमिवानलम्4.11.81।।
translation: राघव Rama, ते you, वाणी word, प्रमाणम् evidence, धैर्यम् courage, आकृतिः appearance, भस्मच्छन्नम् covered with ashes, आनलम् इव like fire, परम् supreme, तेजः strength, सूचयन्ति indicate, कामम् no doubt.
explanation: 'Rama  your word and your courage indicate your supreme strength which is like fire covered with ashes.'

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः। स्मितपूर्वमथो रामः प्रत्युवाच हरिं प्रभुः4.11.82।।
translation: रामः Rama, महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य that Sugriva's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अथ then, हरिं प्रति seeing Sugriva, स्मितपूर्वम् smiling gently, प्रत्युवाच  replied.
explanation: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:

shloka_text: यदि न प्रत्ययोऽस्मासु विक्रमे तव वानर। प्रत्ययं समरे श्लाघ्यमहमुत्पादयामि ते4.11.83।।
translation: वानर monkey, विक्रमे in valour, अस्मासु in us, तव to you, प्रत्ययः faith, न यदि if not, अहम् I, समरे in combat, श्लाघ्यम् praiseworthy, प्रत्ययम् confidence, ते to you, उत्पादयामि create.
explanation: 'If you have no confidence in my strength in fight, O monkey, I will create it in you so much so that you will admire it.'

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवं सान्त्वं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः। राघवो दुन्दुभेः कायं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन लीलया4.11.84।। तोलयित्वा महाबाहुश्चिक्षेप दशयोजनम्। असुरस्य तनुं शुष्कं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन वीर्यवान्4.11.85।।
translation: लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, महाबाहुः longarmed one, वीर्यवान् mighty, राघवः Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, सान्त्वं In a pleasing way, दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, कायम् body, लीलया easily, पादाङ्गुष्ठेन with the toe, तोलयित्वा lifting, असुरस्य demon's, शुष्काम् dried, तनुम् body, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, चिक्षेप flung
explanation: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा तु सुग्रीवं सान्त्वं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः। राघवो दुन्दुभेः कायं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन लीलया4.11.84।। तोलयित्वा महाबाहुश्चिक्षेप दशयोजनम्। असुरस्य तनुं शुष्कं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन वीर्यवान्4.11.85।।
translation: लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, महाबाहुः longarmed one, वीर्यवान् mighty, राघवः Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, सान्त्वं In a pleasing way, दुन्दुभेः Dundubhi's, कायम् body, लीलया easily, पादाङ्गुष्ठेन with the toe, तोलयित्वा lifting, असुरस्य demon's, शुष्काम् dried, तनुम् body, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, चिक्षेप flung
explanation: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.

shloka_text: क्षिप्तं दृष्ट्वा ततः कायं सुग्रीवः पुनरब्रवीत्। लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमर्थवत्4.11.86।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्षिप्तम् the thrown, कायम् body, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, ततः then, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, अर्थवत्  meaningful, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रतः In the presence.
explanation: Having seen Rama flinging the body, Sugriva said to him again in the presence of Lakshmanameaningfully:

shloka_text: आर्द्रस्समांसः प्रत्यग्रः क्षिप्तः कायः पुरा सखे4.11.87।। लघुस्सम्प्रति निर्मांस स्तृणभूतश्च राघव। परिश्रान्तेन मत्तेन भ्रात्रा मे वालिना तदा4.11.88।। क्षिप्तमेवं प्रहर्षेण भवता रघुनन्दन।
translation: सखे friend, तदा that time, परिश्रान्तेन by the tired, मत्तेन by the intoxicated, मे भ्रात्रा  by my brother, वालिना by Vali, पुरा earlier, आर्द्रः wet, समांसः with flesh, प्रत्यग्रः fresh, कायः body, क्षिप्तः flung, रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu race, राघव Raghava, सम्प्रति now, लघुः light, निर्मांसः without flesh, तृणभूतश्च like a bunch of grass, प्रहर्षेण playfully, भवता by you, एवम् this, क्षिप्तम् flung.
explanation: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.

shloka_text: आर्द्रस्समांसः प्रत्यग्रः क्षिप्तः कायः पुरा सखे4.11.87।। लघुस्सम्प्रति निर्मांस स्तृणभूतश्च राघव। परिश्रान्तेन मत्तेन भ्रात्रा मे वालिना तदा4.11.88।। क्षिप्तमेवं प्रहर्षेण भवता रघुनन्दन।
translation: सखे friend, तदा that time, परिश्रान्तेन by the tired, मत्तेन by the intoxicated, मे भ्रात्रा  by my brother, वालिना by Vali, पुरा earlier, आर्द्रः wet, समांसः with flesh, प्रत्यग्रः fresh, कायः body, क्षिप्तः flung, रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu race, राघव Raghava, सम्प्रति now, लघुः light, निर्मांसः without flesh, तृणभूतश्च like a bunch of grass, प्रहर्षेण playfully, भवता by you, एवम् this, क्षिप्तम् flung.
explanation: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.

shloka_text: नात्र शक्यं बलं ज्ञातुं तव वा तस्य वाऽधिकम्। आर्द्रं शुष्कमिति ह्येतत्सुमहद्राघवान्तरम्4.11.89।।
translation: अत्र here (in this case), तव your, बलम् strength, अधिकं वा is more  or, तस्य वा or his, ज्ञातुम् to know, न शक्यम् not able, राघव Rama, आर्द्रम् wet, शुष्कमिति dried, एतत् this, सुमहत् great, अन्तरं हि difference.
explanation: 'I was unable to gauge whether your strength is more  than his (Vali's) since there is a great difference between a dry body and a wet one.

shloka_text: स एव संशयस्तात तव तस्य च यद्बले4.11.90।। सालमेकं तु निर्भिद्या भवेद्व्यक्तिर्बलाबले।
translation: तात O dear, तव your, तस्य च and his, यत् such, बले strength, स एव that alone, संशयः  doubt, एकम् one, सालम् Sala tree, निर्भिद्य after splitling through, व्यक्तिः demonstrated, भवेत् will be known, बलाबले strength or otherwise.
explanation: 'O Dear, therefore, I have my doubt about your relative strength. If you can split a sala tree with a single arrow then can your strength or weakness be demonstrated.

shloka_text: कृत्वेदं कार्मुकं सज्यं हस्तिहस्त मिवाततम्4.11.91।। आकर्णपूर्णमायम्य विसृजस्व महाशरम्।
translation: आततम् stretched, हस्तिहस्तमिव like the elephant's trunk, एतत् that, कार्मुकम् bow, सज्यम् strung(tie it with string), कृत्वा after doing, आकर्णपूर्णम् drawing it (the string) to the ear, आयम्य after stretching, महाशरम् great arrow, विसृजस्व release.
explanation: 'Now string your bow, draw it like the trunk of an elephant up to your ear and release the great arrow.

shloka_text: इमं हि सालं सहित स्त्वया शरो न संशयोऽत्रास्ति विदारयिष्यति। अलं विमर्शेन मम प्रियं ध्रुवं कुरुष्व राजात्मज शापितो मया4.11.92।।
translation: राजन् king, त्वया your, प्रहितः good, शरः arrow, इमं सालम् this sala tree, विदारयिष्यति will pierce through, अत्र then, संशयः doubt, नास्ति will not be there, विमर्शेन clear, अलम् enough, ध्रुवम् certainly, मम to me, प्रियम् gladden, कुरुष्व do, मया my, प्रतिशापितः not to test you.
explanation: 'It will be enough and my doubt will be cleared. If you can pierce the sala tree with your arrow it will be my pleasure and not a test of your strength.

shloka_text: यथा हि तेजस्सु वरस्सदा रवि र्यथा हि शैलो हिमवान्महाद्रिषु। यथा चतुष्पात्सु च केसरी वर स्तथा नरणामसि विक्रमे वरः4.11.93।।
translation: तेजस्सु among the brilliant, रविः Sun, यथा as, वरः best, महाद्रिषु among the great mountains, हिमवान् शैलः Himalaya mountain, यथा as, चतुष्पात्सु among the quadrupeds, केसरी lion, यथा as, वरः best, तथा similarly, नराणाम् among men, विक्रमे in valour, वरः best, असि you are.
explanation: 'Just as the Sun is the best among the brilliant, the Himalayas among the great mountains, the lion among the quadrupeds, so also you are the best among men of valour.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends  the eleventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: एतच्च वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम्। प्रत्ययार्थं महातेजा रामो जग्राह कार्मुकम्4.12.1।।
translation: महातेजाः effulgent, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सुभाषितम् good words, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रत्ययार्थम्  to create faith, कार्मुकम् bow, जग्राह took up.
explanation: Having heard Sugriva's pleasing words, the brilliant Rama took up the bow in order to inspire confidence in Sugriva.
comments: Rama demonstrates his prowess in shooting -- Sugriva fails in the first combat with Vali -- Rama explains the difficulty in identifying Vali -- advises Sugriva to wear Gajapushpi creeper to help him identify -- once again Sugriva proceeds to encounter Vali

shloka_text: स गृहीत्वा धनुर्घोरं शरमेकं च मानदः। सालमुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः। 4.12.2।।
translation: मानदः subduer of enemy's pride, सः he, घोरम् terrific, धनुः bow, पूरयन् filled, दिशः directions, ज्यास्वनैः by the twang, सालम् sala tree, उद्दिश्य aiming, एकम् single, शरम् arrow, चिक्षेप discharged
explanation: Rama, subduer of the enemy's pride, strung his terrific bow, produced the twang that filled all directions, and discharged a single arrow aimed at the sala tree.

shloka_text: स विसृष्टो बलवता बाणस्स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः। भित्त्वा सालान् गिरिप्रस्थं सप्त भूमिं विवेश ह4.12.3।।
translation: बलवता forcefully, विसृष्टः released, स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः decorated with gold, सः बाणः that arrow, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, गिरिप्रस्थम् pierced through the mountain terrain, भित्त्वा on splitting, भूमिम् into the earth, विवेश ह entered.
explanation: Released with great force, Rama's arrow embellished with gold pierced through the seven sala trees and splitting the mountain terrain entered the earth.

shloka_text: प्रविष्टश्च मुहूर्तेन धरां भित्त्वा महाजवः। निष्पत्य च पुनस्तूर्णं स्वतूणीं प्रविवेश ह4.12.4।।
translation: महाजवः of great speed, सायकस्तु the arrow, मुहूर्तेन in a moment, सालान् sala trees, भित्त्वा  split, निष्पत्य emerging forth, तम् its, स्वतूणीमेव from his quiver, पुनः again, प्रविवेश ह returned
explanation: In a moment the arrow emerged from the earth which it pierced and reentered the quiver with great speed.

shloka_text: तान्दृष्ट्वा सप्त निर्भिन्नान्सालान्वानरपुङ्गवः। रामस्य शरवेगेन विस्मयं परमं गतः4.12.5।।
translation: वानरपुङ्गवः chief of monkeys, निर्भिन्नान् split through, तान् those, सप्त seven, सालान् sala trees, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, रामस्य Rama's, शरवेगेन by the speed of his arrow, परमम् highly, विस्मयम् wonderstruck, गतः became.
explanation: The chief of the monkeys was struck with wonder seeing Rama's arrow piercing through  the seven sala trees so swiftly.

shloka_text: स मूर्ध्ना न्यपतदभ्मौ प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः। सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो राघवाय कृताञ्जलिः4.12.6।।
translation: परमप्रीतः highly pleased, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, राघवाय to Rama, कृताञ्जलिः offered obeisance with folded hands, प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः ornaments hanging down, मूर्ध्ना forehead, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् prostrated.
explanation: Sugriva was immensely happy and offered obeisance to Rama with folded hands and bowed down and prostrated while his ornaments touched the ground.

shloka_text: इदं चोवाच धर्मज्ञं कर्मणा तेन हर्षितः। रामं सर्वास्त्रविदुषां श्रेष्ठं शूरमवस्थितम्4.12.7।।
translation: तेन by that, कर्मणा by the deed, हर्षितः he felt glad, धर्मज्ञम् the knower of dharma, सर्वास्त्रविदुषाम् among the proficient in the use of arms, श्रेष्ठं the best one, शूरम् valiant, अवस्थितम् who stood there, रामम् at Rama, इदम् this, उवाच च and spoke.
explanation: Sugriva who stood by, elated to watch the deed of Rama, best among the valiant, proficient in the use of arms of all kinds and knower of dharma, said:

shloka_text: सेन्द्रानपि सुरान्सर्वांस्त्वं बाणैः पुरुषर्षभ। समर्थस्समरे हन्तुं किं पुन र्वालिनं प्रभो 4.12.8।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ O best among men, प्रभो O lord, त्वम् you, समरे in war, सेन्द्रान् including Indra, सर्वान् all, सुरान् अपि even gods, हन्तुम् to kill, समर्थः are capable, वालिनम् Vali, किं पुनः what to speak of again.
explanation: 'O bull among men, O lord, you are capable of killing with your arrows even the gods including Indra in the battle, what to speak of Vali.

shloka_text: येन सप्तमहासाला गिरिर्भूमिश्च दारिताः। बाणेनैकेन काकुत्स्थ स्थाता ते को रणाग्रतः4.12.9।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, येन by such a person, एकेन बाणेन with a single arrow, सप्त seven, महासालाः great sala trees, गिरिः mountain, भूमिश्च even earth, दारिताः pierced, ते to  you, रणाग्रतः in the forefront of the battle, कः who, स्थाता can stand.
explanation: 'O Rama who can in a battle confront you, capable of splitting seven huge sala trees, the mountain and the earth with a single arrow?

shloka_text: अद्य मे विगतश्शोकः प्रीतिरद्य परा मम। सुहृदं त्वां समासाद्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम्4.12.10।।
translation: अद्य now, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम् comparable to Indra and Varuna, त्वाम् you, सुहृदम् friend, समासाद्य after getting, मे to me, शोकः sorrow, विगतः is gone, अद्य now, मम my, परा supreme, प्रीतिः pleasure.
explanation: 'Having found a friend in you comparable to Indra and Varuna, my grief is gone and I am so happy now.

shloka_text: तमद्यैव प्रियार्थं मे वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम्। वालिनं जहि काकुत्स्थ मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः4.12.11।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, मे my, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of a brother, वैरिणम् enemy, तं वालिनम्  that Vali, अद्यैव now itself, प्रियार्थम् for my pleasure, जहि you may kill, मया by me, अयम् this, अञ्जलि: reverential obeisance, बद्धः offered.
explanation: 'O Rama, for my pleasure kill Vali who is, to me, an enemy in the guise of a brother. I fold my hands to you.

shloka_text: ततो रामः परिष्वज्य सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम्। प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणानुगतं वचः4.12.12।।
translation: ततः then, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, रामः Rama, प्रियदर्शनम् handsome, लक्ष्मणानुगतम् following Lakshmana, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिष्वज्य having embraced, वचः these words, प्रत्युवाच said in reply.
explanation: Then wise Rama embraced handsome Sugriva and replied in these words which were agreeable to Lakshmana:

shloka_text: अस्माद्गच्छेम किष्किन्धां क्षिप्रं गच्छ त्वमग्रतः। गत्वा चाह्वय सुग्रीव वालिनं भ्रातृगन्धिनम्4.12.13।।
translation: सुग्रीव Sugriva, क्षिप्रम् at once, अस्मात् from here, किष्किन्थाम् to Kishkinda, गच्छेम will go, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, अग्रतः forward, गच्छ go, गत्वा on going, भ्रातृगन्धिनम् a brother for name's sake, वालिनम् Vali, आह्वय invite.
explanation: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'

shloka_text: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम्। वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने4.12.14।।
translation: ते सर्वे they all, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, त्वरितम् quickly, गत्वा went, गहने dense, वने forest, वृक्षैः with trees, आत्मानम् themselves, अवृ़त्य after covering, अतिष्ठन् stayed.
explanation: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.

shloka_text: सुग्रीवो व्यनदद्घोरं वालिनोऽऽह्वानकारणात्। गाढं परिहितो वेगान्नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम्4.12.15।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, गाढं tightly, परिहितः tightened the cloth around waist, वेगात् with speed, नादैः by roaring, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing the sky, वालिनः Vali's, ह्वानकारणात् to call out, घोरम् terrific, व्यनदत् screamed.
explanation: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed  for Vali.

shloka_text: तं श्रुत्वा निनदं भ्रातुः क्रुद्धो वाली महाबलः। निश्चक्राम सुसंरब्धो भास्करोऽस्ततटादिव4.12.16।।
translation: महाबलः powerful, वाली Vali, भ्रातुः brother's, तं निनदम्  roaring, श्रुत्वा  hearing, क्रुद्धः enraged, सुसंरब्धः overwhelmed, अस्ततटात् from behind the western bank of the ocean, भास्करः Sun, यथा like, निष्पपात came out.
explanation: On hearing his brother roaring, powerful Vali was enraged and rushed like the Sun from behind the western shore of the ocean (this simile suggests the downfall of Vali).

shloka_text: ततस्सुतुमुलं युद्धं वालिसुग्रीवयोरभूत्। गगने ग्रहयोर्घोरं बुधाङ्गारकयोरिव4.12.17।।
translation: ततः then, वालिसुग्रीवयोः for Vali and Sugriva, बुधाङ्गारकयोः between Budha                (Mercury) and Angaraka (Mars), ग्रहयोरिव like the planets, सुतुमुलम् tumultous, युद्धम् war, अभूत् took place.
explanation: Then a tumultuous combat took place between Vali and Sugriva who looked like the planets Mercury and Mars.

shloka_text: तलैरशनिकल्पैश्च वज्रकल्पैश्च मुष्टिभिः। जघ्नतुस्समरेऽन्योन्यं भ्रातरौ क्रोधमूर्छितौ4.12.18।।
translation: क्रोधमूर्छितौ senseless with fury, भ्रातरौ brothers, अशनिकल्पैः like thunder, तलैः with palms soles, वज्रकल्पैः like thunderbolts, मुष्टिभिः with fists, समरे in the combat, अन्योन्यम् each other, जघ्नतुः struck.
explanation: The brothers, insensate with fury, struck each other like thunder with their palms, soles  and fists in the combat.

shloka_text: ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिस्तावुभौ समुदीक्ष्यतु। अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरावुभौ देवाविवाश्विनौ4.12.19।।
translation: ततः then, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, रामः Rama, देवौ two deities, अश्विनौ इव like the twin Aswini Kumaras, अन्योन्यसदृशौ both of them similar in looks, तौ they, उभौ both, वीरौ the two heroes, समुदीक्ष्यतु  watched
explanation: Bow in hand, Rama watched both the heroes who resembled the twin Aswini Kumaras.

shloka_text: यन्नावगच्छत्सुग्रीवं वालिनं वापि राघवः। ततो न कृतवान्बुद्धिं मोक्तुमन्तकरं शरम्4.12.20।।
translation: राघवः Rama, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वालिनं वापि or Vali, यत् such and such, नावगच्छत् not able to distinguish, ततः then, अन्तकरम् deadly, शरम् arrow, मोक्तुम् to discharge, बुद्धिम् intellect, न कृतवान्  not made.
explanation: Since Rama was not able to distinguish between Vali and Sugriva, he could not decide whether he should discharge his deadly arrow .

shloka_text: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे भग्नस्सुग्रीवस्तेन वालिना। अपश्यन्राघवं नाथमृश्यमूकं प्रदुद्रुवे4.12.21।।
translation: एतस्मिन् अन्तरे in the mean while, तेन वालिना by Vali, भग्नः discomfited, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नाथम्  lord, राघवम् Rama, अपश्यन् not finding, ऋश्यमूकम् to Rishyamuka, प्रदुद्रुवे ran.
explanation: Discomfited  by Vali, and not seeing Rama around, Sugriva ran towards Rishyamuka mountain.

shloka_text: क्लान्तो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः प्रहारैर्जर्झरीकृतः। वालिनाऽभिद्रुतः क्रोधात्प्रविवेश महावनम्4.12.22।।
translation: वालिना by Vali, क्रोधात् angry, अभिद्रुतः chased, क्लान्तः exhausted, रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः body drenched in blood, प्रहारैः with strokes, जर्झरीकृतः mauled, महावनम् great grove (of Matanga), प्रविवेश entered.
explanation: Exhausted, disfigured and body mauled and drenched in blood all over, Sugriva, chased by the infuriated Vali, entered the region of  great sage Matanga.

shloka_text: तं प्रविष्टं वनं दृष्ट्वा वाली शापभयार्दितः। मुक्तो ह्यसि त्वमित्युक्त्वा स निवृत्तो महाद्युतिः4.12.23।।
translation: वनम् grove, प्रविष्टम् entered, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, महाद्युतिः effulgent, वाली Vali, त्वम् you, मुक्तः असि हि you have escaped, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, शापभयात् by the fear of the curse, ततः then, निवृत्तः returned.
explanation: Effulgent Vali saw Sugriva entering the (prohibited) grove and turned back due to the fear of the curse (of sage Matanga) saying, 'You have escaped'.

shloka_text: राघवोऽसि सह भ्रात्रा सह चैव हनूमता। तदेव वनमागच्छत्सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः4.12.24।।
translation: राघवोऽपि Rama too, भ्रात्रा सह along with brother, हनूमता च सह also with Hanuman, वानरः Vanara, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, यत्र where, तत् that, वनमेव to the grove, आगच्छत् arrived.
explanation: Rama together with Lakshmana and Hanuman also arrived at the same gave where  Sugriva was.

shloka_text: तं समीक्ष्यागतं रामं सुग्रीवस्सहलक्ष्मणम्। ह्रीमान्दीनमुवाचेदं वसुधामवलोकयन्4.12.25।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, आगतम् coming in, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, तं रामम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, ह्रीमान् ashamed, वसुधाम् ground, अवलोकयन् looking down , दीनम्  piteously, इदम् this, उवाच spoke.
explanation: At the sight of Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, Sugriva felt ashmed and aggrieved, and looking down on the ground, said:

shloka_text: आह्वयस्वेति मामुक्त्वा दर्शयित्वा च विक्रमम्। वैरिणा घातयित्वा च किमिदानीं त्वया कृतम्4.12.26।।
translation: आह्वयस्व asked me to declare, इति thus, माम् me, उक्त्वा after telling, विक्रमम् prowess, दर्शयित्वा having demonstrated, वैरिणा by the enemy, घातयित्वा  had hit me, त्वया  by you, इदानीम् this way, किं कृतम् why did you do?
explanation: 'You demonstrated your prowess and directed me to challenge Vali and then why did you make the enemy hit me thus?

shloka_text: तामेन वेलां वक्तव्यं त्वया राघव तत्त्वतः। वालिनं न निहन्मीति ततो नाहमितो व्रजे4.12.27।।
translation: राघव Rama, तां वेलामेव at that time, त्वया by you, वालिनम् Vali, न निहन्मि I will not kill, इति thus, तत्त्वतः truly, वक्तव्यम् should have been said, ततः then, अहम् I, इतः from this place, न व्रजे would not have gone.
explanation: 'Had you, in fact, told me that you were not going to kill Vali, I would not have budged from this place.'

shloka_text: तस्य चैवं ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः। करुणं दीनया वाचा राघवः पुनरब्रवीत्4.12.28।।
translation: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, दीनया a piteous, वाचा by word, करुणम् compasionately, एवम् in that manner, ब्रुवाणस्य while he spoke, राघवः Rama, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: On hearing the great Sugriva's miserable and moving words, Rama again said:

shloka_text: सुग्रीव श्रूयातां तात क्रोधश्च व्यपनीयताम्। कारणं येन बाणोऽयं न मया स विसर्जितः4.12.29।।
translation: तात O dear, सुग्रीव Sugriva, येन why, सः अयम् this, बाणः arrow, मया by me, न विसर्जितः not released, कारणम् reason, श्रूयताम् listen to me, क्रोधः anger, व्यपनीयतां च dispel.
explanation: 'O dear Sugriva dispel your anger and listen to me why I had not released the arrow.

shloka_text: अलङ्कारेण वेषेण प्रमाणेन गतेन च। त्वं च सुग्रीव वाली च सदृशौ स्थः परस्परम्4.12.30।।
translation: सुग्रीव Sugriva, अलङ्कारेण in personal embelishment, वेषेण in form, प्रमाणेन in appearance, गतेन च in your movements, त्वं च your, वाली च and Vali, परस्परम् to each other, सदृशौ both similar, स्थः are.
explanation: 'O Sugriva in form, ornaments and movements there is perfect resemblance between you and Vali.

shloka_text: स्वरेण वर्चसा चैव प्रेक्षितेन च वानर। विक्रमेण च वाक्यैश्च व्यक्तिं वां नोपलक्षये4.12.31।।
translation: वानर monkey, स्वरेण in voice, वर्चसा चैव or in splendour, प्रेक्षितेन in looks, विक्रमेण च in valour, वाक्यैश्च in talk, वाम् between the two, व्यक्तिम् difference, नोपलक्षये I have not seen.
explanation: 'O monkey in your voice, in brightness, in looks, in valour or in words I have marked no difference between you.

shloka_text: ततोऽहं रूपसादृश्यान्मोहितो वानरोत्तम। नोत्सृजामि महावेगं शरं शत्रुनिबर्हणम्4.12.32।।
translation: वानरोत्तम distinguished monkey, ततः then, रूपसादृश्यात् similar appearance, मोहितः bewildered, अहम् I was, महावेगम् swift, शत्रुनिबर्हणम् that which can destroy enemy, शरम् arrow, नोत्सृजामि I have not let loose.
explanation: 'O distinguished monkey you both are so similar in form that I was puzzled and did not release my swift arrow that could have destroyed the enemy.

shloka_text: जीवितान्तकरं घोरं सादृश्यात्तु विशङ्कितः। मूलघातो न नौ स्याद्धि द्वयोरपि कृतो मया4.12.33।।
translation: सादृश्यात् due to similar appearance, विशङ्कितः I doubted, जीवितान्तकरम् deadly arrow, घोरम् terrific, नौ of us, द्वयोः of both, मूलघातः strike at the root, स्याद्धि may be indeed, मया by myself, न कृतः was not done.
explanation: 'I was doubtful because of your similar appearance. I thought that I should not strike at the very root of the interests of both of us. Therefore, I did not release the terrific and deadly  arrow.

shloka_text: त्वयि वीरे विपन्ने हि अज्ञानाल्लाघवान्मया। मौढ्यं च मम बाल्यं च ख्यापितं स्यात्कपीश्वर4.12.34।।
translation: वीरे warrior, कपीश्वर O lord of monkeys, अज्ञानात् by ignorance, लाघवात् due to thoughtlessness, त्वयि विपन्ने in your danger, मया by me, मम my, मौढ्यं च folly, बाल्यं च childishness, ख्यापितम् revealed, स्यात् will be.
explanation: 'O lord of monkeys I would have betrayed my foolishness and childishness had I exposed you to danger by my ignorance and thoughtlessness.

shloka_text: दत्ताभयवधो नाम पातकं महदुच्यते। अहं च लक्ष्मणश्चैव सीता च वरवर्णिनी4.12.35।। त्वदधीना वयं सर्वे वनेऽस्मिन् शरणं भवान्।
translation: दत्ताभयवधो नाम killing a person after promising protection, महत् great, पातकम् sin, उच्यते it is said to be, अहं च I also, लक्ष्मणश्चैव even Lakshmana, वरवर्णिनी darling, सीता च Sita also, वयं सर्वे all of us, त्वदधीनाः under your care, अस्मिन् in this regard, भवान् you, शरणम् refuge.
explanation: 'It is said that killing a person to whom protection is promised is highly sinful. Lakshmana, darling Sita and me, are under your care and you are our refuge.

shloka_text: तस्माद्युध्यस्व भूयस्त्वं मा मा शङ्केश्च वानर4.12.36।। एतन्मुहूर्ते सुग्रीव पश्य वालिनमाहवे। निरस्तमिषुणैकेन वेष्टमानं महीतले4.12.37।।
translation: वानर monkey, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, भूयः again go, युध्यस्व fight, मा मा do not do not, शङ्केश्च you may doubt me, एतन्मुहूर्ते  in one moment, मया by me, आहवे in war, एकेन by a single, बाणेन by arrow, निरस्तम् thrown down, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमानम्  rolling, वालिनम् Vali, पश्य see.
explanation: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.

shloka_text: तस्माद्युध्यस्व भूयस्त्वं मा मा शङ्केश्च वानर4.12.36।। एतन्मुहूर्ते सुग्रीव पश्य वालिनमाहवे। निरस्तमिषुणैकेन वेष्टमानं महीतले4.12.37।।
translation: वानर monkey, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, भूयः again go, युध्यस्व fight, मा मा do not do not, शङ्केश्च you may doubt me, एतन्मुहूर्ते  in one moment, मया by me, आहवे in war, एकेन by a single, बाणेन by arrow, निरस्तम् thrown down, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमानम्  rolling, वालिनम् Vali, पश्य see.
explanation: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.

shloka_text: अभिज्ञानं कुरुष्व त्वमात्मनो वानरेश्वर। येन त्वामभिजानीयां द्वन्द्वयुद्धमुपागतम्4.12.38।।
translation: वानरेश्वर lord of monkeys, द्वन्द्वयुद्धम् duel, उपागतम् has come, त्वाम् you, येन by which,  अभिजानीयाम् I may recognise you, अभिज्ञानम् an identification, आत्मनः you, कुरुष्व may put on.
explanation: 'O lord of monkeys while you both are engaged in a duel wear some identification mark by which I can recognise you.

shloka_text: गजपुष्पीमिमां फुल्लामुत्पाट्य शुभलक्षणाम्। कुरु लक्ष्मण कण्ठेऽस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।।4.12.39।।
translation: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इमाम् these, फुल्लाम् flowers blossomed, शुभलक्षणाम् auspicious, गजपुष्पीम् Gajapushpi, उत्पाट्य plucking, महात्मनः of the great, अस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, कण्ठे in the neck, कुरु put on.
explanation: 'O Lakshmana this Gajapushpi  in bloom is auspicious. Pluck and fasten it on great Sugriva's neck.'

shloka_text: ततो गिरितटे जातामुत्पाट्य कुसुमाकुलाम्। लक्ष्मणो गजपुष्पीं तां तस्य कण्ठे व्यसर्जयत्4.12.40।।
translation: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, गिरितटे on the slope of the mountain, जाताम् growing, कुसुमायुताम् flowering, तां गजपुष्पीम् those gajapushpi blossoms, उत्पाट्य  plucked, तस्य his, कण्ठे on the neck, व्यसर्जयत्  fastened on.
explanation: Then Lakshmana went to the mountain slope, plucked the (creeper with) gajapuspi blossoms and fastened it on the neck of Sugriva.

shloka_text: स तया शुशुभे श्रीमान् लतया कण्ठसक्तया। मालयेव बलाकानां ससन्ध्य इव तोयदः4.12.41।।
translation: श्रीमान् lucky, सः Sugriva, कण्ठसक्तया by that on the neck, तया लतय by that creeper, ससन्ध्यः at twilight, तोयदः rain cloud, बलाकानाम् of cranes, मालयेव  like a garland, शुशुभे   glowed.
explanation: With the creeper round the neck, Sugriva looked like the raincloud at twilight, adorned by a row of cranes like a garland.

shloka_text: विभ्राजमानो वपुषा रामवाक्यसमाहितः। जगाम सह रामेण किष्किन्थां वालिपालिताम्4.12.42।।
translation: वपुषा with his body, विभ्राजमानः radiant, सः he, रामवाक्यसमाहितः intent on carrying out Rama's instruction, रामेण सह with Rama, जगाम went, पुनः again, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali.
explanation: Radiant Sugriva intent on carrying out Rama's words again went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: ऋष्यमूकात्स धर्मात्मा किष्किन्धां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः। जगाम सहसुग्रीवो वालिविक्रमपालिताम्4.13.1।।
translation: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः he, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः Lakshmana's elder brother, सहसुग्रीवः along with Sugriva, ऋष्यमूकात् Rishyamuka, वालिविक्रमपालिताम् ruled by Vali's valour, किष्किन्धाम् Kishkinda, जगाम went.
explanation: Lakshmana's righteous elder brother left Rishyamuka with Sugriva for Kishkinda protected by Vali's valour.
comments: Nature on the way to Kishkinda -- Sugriva describes the hermitage of the seven sages and the power of their penance

shloka_text: समुद्यम्य महच्चापं रामः काञ्चनभूषितम्। शरांश्चादित्यसङ्काशान्गृहीत्वा रणसाधकान्4.13.2।।
translation: रामः Rama, काञ्चनभूषितम् adorned with gold, महत् great, चापम् bow, समुद्यम्य  getting ready, आदित्यसङ्कशान् radiant as the Sun, रणसाधकान् potent in war, शरान् arrows, गृहीत्वा taking up.
explanation: Getting ready to go, Rama took up his great bow and arrows adorned with gold and potent in war looking (dazzling) like the Sun.

shloka_text: अग्रतस्तु ययौ तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः। सुग्रीवः संहतग्रीवो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः4.13.3।।
translation: महात्मनः greatsoul, तस्य राघवस्य that Rama's, अग्रतः in front, संहतग्रीवः strongnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana, ययौ went.
explanation: The strongnecked Sugriva and mighty Lakshmana walked in front of the highsouled Rama.

shloka_text: पृष्ठतो हनुमान्वीरो नलो नीलश्च वानरः। तारश्चैव महातेजा हरियूथपयूथपः4.13.4।।
translation: पृष्ठतः behind them, वीरः courageous, हनुमान् Hanuman, नलः Nala, वानरः monkey, नीलश्च and Nila, महातेजाः brilliant, हरियूथपयूथपः the head of monkey leaders, तारश्चैव and  Tara.
explanation: Brave and brilliant Hanuman, Nala, Nila, and Tara among the leaders of the monkeys  walked behind.

shloka_text: ते वीक्षमाणा वृक्षांश्च पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः। प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाश्चैव सरितस्सागरङ्गमाः4.13.5।।
translation: ते they, वीक्षमाणा enjoying the view, पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः bending down due to the weight of the flowers, वृक्षांश्च trees, प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाः carrying pure waters, सागरंगमाः flowing into the sea, सरितः rivers.
explanation: They saw (on the way) trees bent down with the load of flowers, and rivers with pure water flowing into the sea.

shloka_text: कन्दराणि च शैलांश्च निर्दराणि गुहास्तथा। शिखराणि च मुख्यानि दरीश्च प्रियदर्शनाः4.13.6।।
translation: कन्दराणि valleys, शैलांश्च mountains, निर्दराणि caverns, तथा similarly, गुहाः caves, मुख्यानि prominent, शिखराणि peaks, प्रियदर्शनाः pleasing to look at, दरीश्च  deep caves.
explanation: (They saw) beautiful valleys, mountains, caves, prominent peaks with deep caverns.

shloka_text: वैढूर्यविमलै:पर्णै पद्मैश्चाकोशकुट्मलैः। शोभितांत्सजलान्मार्गे तटाकांश्च व्यलोकयन्4.13.7।।
translation: मार्गे on the way, पर्णै with leaves, वैदूर्यविमलैः clear like Vaidurya, अकोशकुडमलैः buds, पद्मैश्च and lotuses, शोभितान् beautiful, सजलान् with water, तटाकान् tanks, अवलोकयन् observing
explanation: Observing on the way delightful lotus buds with leaves like Vaidurya, clear water and full tanks (They moved on).

shloka_text: कारण्डैस्सारसैर्हंसैर्वञ्जुलैर्जलकुक्कुटैः। चक्रवाकै स्तथा चान्यैश्शकुनैः रुपनादितान्4.13.8।।
translation: कारण्डैः with karandas (ducks), सारसैः with cranes, हंसैः with swans, वञ्जुलैः with vanjulas, जलकुक्कुटैः with water fowls, चक्रवाकैः with chakravakas, तथा similarly, अन्यैः with others, शकुनैः with birds, रुपनादितान् warbling melodiously
explanation: Ducks, cranes, swans, vanjulas, waterfowls, chakravakas and other birds warbling melodiously.

shloka_text: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान्निर्भयान्वनगोचरान्। चरतस्सर्वतौऽपश्यन् स्थलीषु हरिणान् स्थितान्4.13.9।।
translation: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान् feeding on tender grass, निर्भयान् without fear, वनगोचरान् roaming the forest, स्थलीषु on the ground, सर्वतः all around, चरतः roaming, स्थितान् standing, हरिणान् deer, अपश्यन् saw.
explanation: They observed deer feeding on tender grass on the ground around without fear, some standing and some roaming the forest

shloka_text: तटाकवैरिणश्चापि शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान्। घोरानेकचरान्वन्यान्द्विरदान्कूलघातिनः4.13.10।।
translation: तटाकवैरिणः destroyers of tanks, शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान् adorned with white tusks, घोरान् terrific, एकचरान् wandering alone, कूलघातिनः destroyers of the banks, द्विरदान् elephants (those that have two tusks).
explanation: Observing terrific elephants adorned with white tusks wandering alone destroying the tanks, shattering the banks.

shloka_text: मत्तान्गिरितटोत्कृष्टान्पर्वतानिव जङ्गमान्। वारणान्वारिदप्रख्यान्महीरेणुसमुक्षितान्4.13.11।।
translation: मत्तान् intoxicated, गिरितटोत्कृष्टान् that were knocking the edges of mountain slopes, जङ्गमान् moving, पर्वतानिव mountainlike, वारिदप्रख्यान् resembling (dark) rainbearing clouds, महीरेणुसमुक्षितान् covered with dust of the earth, वारणान् elephants.
explanation: (Observing) intoxicated elephants knocking the edges of mountain slopes, elephants resembling (dark) rainbearing clouds, elephants like moving mountains, elephants with dust covered all over the body.

shloka_text: वने वनचरांश्चान्यान्खेचरांश्च विहङ्गमान्। पश्यन्तस्त्वरिता जग्मुस्सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः4.13.12।।
translation: सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः faithful to Sugriva, वने in the forest, अन्यान् other, वनचरांश्च wild animals, खेचरान् those flying in the sky, विहङ्गमांश्च and birds, पश्यन्तः seeing, त्वरिताः fast, जग्मुः went.
explanation: Following Sugriva faithfully, they proceeded swiftly, observing animals of the forest and birds flying in the sky.

shloka_text: तेषां तु गच्छतां तत्र त्वरितं रघुनन्दनः। द्रुमषण्डं वनं दृष्ट्वा रामस्सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्4.13.13।।
translation: तेषाम् while they, त्वरितम् swiftly, गच्छताम् were going, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu family, रामः Rama, तत्र there, द्रुमषण्डवनम्  dense forest dense with trees, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: While walking fast, looking at the forest full of trees Rama, the delight of the Raghus said to Sugriva:

shloka_text: एष मेघ इवाकाशे वृक्षषण्डः प्रकाशते। मेघसङ्घातविपुलः पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः4.13.14।।
translation: मेघसङ्घातविपुलः vast like a collection of clouds, पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः surrounded by banana plants all over, एषः that, वृक्षषण्डः cluster of trees, आकाशे in the sky, मेघः cloud, इव like, प्रकाशते splendid.
explanation: 'This cluster of trees surrounded by plantain groves look splendid like a vast collection of clouds in the sky.

shloka_text: किमेतत् ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सखे कौतूहलं हि मे। कौतूहलापनयनं कर्तुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वया4.13.15।।
translation: सखे O friend, एतत् this, किम् what, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि wish, मम mine, कौतूहलम् curiosity, त्वया by you, कौतूहलापनयनम् clear to my curiosity, कर्तुम् do, इच्चामि I wish to.
explanation: 'O friend I wish to know what this is? Could you answer my curiosity?'

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः। गच्छन्नेवाचचक्षेऽथ सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वनम्4.13.16।।
translation: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य राघवस्य that Raghava's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अथ then, गच्छन्नेव walking, तत् that, महत्  extensive, वनम् forest, आचचक्षे started narrating.
explanation: On hearing great Rama's words while walking in the extensive forest,  Sugriva started narrating:

shloka_text: एतद्राघव विस्तीर्णमाश्रमं श्रमनाशनम्। उद्यानवनसम्पन्नं स्वादुमूलफलोदकम्4.13.17।।
translation: राघव Raghava, उद्यानवनसम्पन्नम् beautiful gardens, स्वादुमूलफलोदकम् tasty roots fruits and water, विस्तीर्णम् vast, एतत् all this, श्रमनाशनम् relieves tiresomeness of wearied people, आश्रमम् hermitage.
explanation: 'O Raghava this is a hermitage, enchanting with vast gardens and trees bearing sweet fruits, full of tasty roots and water that relieves tiresomeness (of travellers).

shloka_text: सप्तरात्रकृताहारा वायुनाचलवासिनः। दिवं वर्षशतैर्याताः सप्तभिः सकलेबराः4.13.19।।
translation: सप्तरात्रे on the seventh night, वायुना with air, कृताहाराः as food, अचलवासिनः without motion, सप्तभिः  seven, वर्षशतैः hundred years, सकलेबराः with their bodies, दिवम् heaven, याताः attained.
explanation: 'These seven sages used to live on air and that too once in seven nights. They lived for seven hundred years performing penance with motionlessness and attained heaven along with their bodies.

shloka_text: तेषामेवं प्रभावानां द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम्। आश्रमस्सुदुराधर्ष अपि सेन्द्रैस्सुरासुरैः4.13.20।।
translation: द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम् surrounded by a row of trees, एवं in this way, आश्रम् hermitage, तेषाम् their, प्रभावानां by virtue of their power of penance, सेन्द्रैः by those including Indra, सुरासुरैरपि gods and demons, सुदुराधर्षम् very difficult to enter.
explanation: 'By virtue of the power of their penance, this hermitage surrounded by a row of trees is impenetrable even for demons and gods including Indra.

shloka_text: पक्षिणो वर्जयन्त्येतत्तथाऽन्ये वनचारिणः। विशन्ति मोहाद्येऽप्यत्र निवर्तन्ते न ते पुनः4.13.21।।
translation: पक्षिणः birds, तथा so also, अन्ये other, वनचारिणः wild animals, एतत् this place, वर्जयन्ति avoid, ये whoever, मोहात् by ignorance, अत्र there, विशन्ति enter, ते they, पुनः again, न निवर्तन्ति do not return.
explanation: 'Birds and wild animals avoid the hermitage and whoever enters there out of ignorance never returns.

shloka_text: विभूषणरवास्तत्र श्रूयन्ते सकलाक्षराः। तूर्यगीतस्वनाश्चात्र गन्धो दिव्यश्च राघव4.13.22।।
translation: राघव Rama, अत्र here, सकलाक्षराः all words, विभूषणरवाश्च jingling of ornaments, तूर्यगीतस्वराश्चात्र sounds of songs and windinstruments (instruments that make a sound when wind passes through), श्रूयन्ते heard, दिव्यः divine, गन्धश्च fragrance also.
explanation: 'O Rama, one can hear pleasant sounds of jingling ornaments (of nymphs), of songs and windinstruments here. One can inhale divine fragrance, too.

shloka_text: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि दीप्यन्ते दूमो ह्यत्र प्रकाशते। वेष्टयन्निव वृक्षाग्रान्कपोताङ्गारुणो घनः4.13.23।।
translation: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि three sacred fires (Dakshinagni, Ahavaniya, Garhapatya fires), दीप्यन्ते shining, वृक्षाग्रान् treetops, वेष्टयन्निव as if enveloping, कपोताङ्गारुणः red like the pigeon's feet, घनः thick,दूमो smoke, एषः this, प्रकाशते हि glows.
explanation: 'The three sacred fires keep burning and the thick smoke they emit resembles the red feet of  pigeons. It shines forth as if enveloping the treetops.

shloka_text: एते वृक्षाः प्रकाशन्ते धूमसंसक्तमस्तकाः। मेघजालप्रतिच्छन्ना वैढूर्यगिरयो यथा4.13.24।।
translation: धूमसंसक्तमस्तकाः treetops covered with thick smoke, वृक्षाः trees, मेघजालप्रतिच्छन्नाः concealed by clouds, यथा as, प्रकाशन्ते glowing, वैढूर्य Vaidurya, गिरियः a mountain, एते   appears.
explanation: 'These treetops covered with thick smoke glow like mountains of Vaidurya concealed by a cluster of clouds.

shloka_text: कुरु प्रणामं धर्मात्मंस्तेषामुद्दिश्य राघव। लक्ष्मणेव सह भ्रात्रा प्रयन्तस्सयताञ्जलिः4.13.25।।
translation: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, राघव Rama, तेषाम् उद्दिश्य contemplating about them, भ्रात्रा  brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, प्रयतः humbly, सयताञ्जलिः with folded hands, प्रणामम् offer obeisance, कुरु do, ताम् them.
explanation: 'O rigteous Rama you and your brother Lakshmana humbly offer obeisance to them(sacred hermitage and sages Saptajana) with folded hands and meditate on them.

shloka_text: प्रणमन्ति हि ये तेषां मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम्। न तेषामशुभं किञ्चिच्छरीरे राम दृश्यते4.13.26।।
translation: राम Rama, भावितात्मनाम्  sacred souls, तेषाम् मुनीनाम् to those sages, ये whoever, प्रणमन्ति offer obeisance, तेषाम् to them, शरीरे in body, किञ्चित् not even a little, अशुभम् inauspicious, न दृश्यते will not be seen.
explanation: 'O Rama, nothing inauspicious happens to them who offer obeisance to those highly spiritual sacred sages.'

shloka_text: ततो रामस्सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन कृताञ्जलिः। समुद्दिश्य महात्मानस्तानृषीनभ्यवादयत्4.13.27।।
translation: ततः then, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands offered obeisance, महात्मानः great souls, तान् them, ऋषीन् समुद्दिश्य thinking of the seers, अभ्यवादयत् saluted.
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana  offered salutations with folded hands in memory of those great sages, great souls.

shloka_text: अभिवाद्य तु धर्मात्मा रामो भ्राता च लक्ष्मणः। सुग्रीवो वानराश्चैव जग्मुसंहृष्टमानसाः4.13.28।।
translation: धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, भ्राता brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वानराश्चैव and monkeys, अभिवाद्य  offered obeisance, संहृष्टमानसाः  delighted at heart, जग्मुः went.
explanation: Righteous Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva and all the monkeys offered obeisance and proceeded delighted at heart.

shloka_text: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं तस्मात्सप्तजनाश्रमात्। ददृशुस्तां दुराधर्षां किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम्4.13.29।।
translation: ते they, तस्मात् from there, सप्तजनाश्रमात् the hermitage of seven seers, दूरम् long distance, अध्वानम् path, गत्वा on going, वालिपालिताम् ruled by Vali, दुराधर्षाम् unassailable, तां किष्किन्धाम् that Kishkinda, ददृशुः  beheld
explanation: Walking a long distance from the hermitage of the seven seers, they beheld the unassailable Kishkinda ruled by Vali.

shloka_text: ततस्तु रामानुजरामवानराः प्रगृह्य शस्त्राण्युदिताग्र्यतेजसः। पुरीं सुरेशात्मजवीर्यपालितां वधाय शत्रोः पुनरागतास्सह4.13.30।।
translation: ततः then, उदितोग्रतेजसः possessed of fierce lustre, रामानुजरामवानराः Lakshmana, Rama and the monkeys, शस्त्राणि weapons, प्रगृह्य took, शत्रोः enemy, वधाय to kill, सुरेशात्मजवीर्यपालिताम् ruled by the valour of the son of Indra, पुरीम् capital, पुनः again, इह there, आगताः reached.
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana of fierce lustre, and the monkeys took hold of the weapons to kill the enemy and reached the capital ruled by the valour of Vali, son of Indra. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालि पालिताम्। वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन् गहने वने4.14.1।।
translation: सर्वे ते all of them, त्वरितं at once, गत्वा went वालि पालिताम् ruled by Vali, किष्किन्धां Kishkinda, वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य hiding behind the trees, गहने वने in the dense forest, व्यतिष्ठन् waited
explanation: They all at once went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali and there waited hiding behind the trees in the dense forest.
comments: Sugriva roars at Vali -- Rama encourages him to challenge Vali, himself hiding behind the tree.

shloka_text: विचार्य सर्वतो दृष्टिं कानने काननप्रियः। सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः क्रोधमाहारयद्भृशम्4.14.2।।
translation: काननप्रियः a lover of forest, विपुलग्रीवः broadnecked, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कानने in the forest, सर्वतः all over, दृष्टिम् sight, विचार्य  extending, भृशम् very, क्रोधम् anger, आहारयत् became.
explanation: Broadnecked Sugriva, a lover of the forest, looked around and flew into a rage.

shloka_text: ततस्स निनदं घोरं कृत्वा युद्धाय चाह्वयत्। परिवारैः परिवृतो नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम्4.14.3।। गर्जन्निव महामेघो वायुवेगपुरस्सरः।
translation: परिवारैः with companions, परिवृतः surrounded, ततः then, नादैः with sounds, अम्बरम् sky, भिन्दन्निव as if piercing through, वायुवेगपुरःसरः moving with the speed of wind, गर्जन् while roaring, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, घोरम् terrific, निनदम् sound, कृत्वा having produced, युद्धाय for the combat, अह्वयत् challenged.
explanation: Sugriva, surrounded by his companions, raised his voice as if piercing the sky, roaring like a huge thundering cloud, challenging Vali to a duel.

shloka_text: अथ बालार्कसदृशो दृप्तसिंहगतिस्तदा4.14.4।। दृष्ट्वा रामं क्रियादक्षं सुग्रीवो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
translation: अथ then, बालार्कसदृश looking like the rising Sun, दृप्तसिंहगतिः moving like a proud lion, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्रियादक्षम् proficient in any task, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तदा then, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Sugriva, proficient in the performance of any task, one who appeared like the rising Sun and moved like a proud lion, said to Rama:

shloka_text: हरिवागुरया व्याप्तां तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम्। प्राप्ताः स्म ध्वजयन्त्राढ्यां किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम्।।4.14.5।।
translation: हरिवागुरया  like a net to catch animals, व्याप्ताम् filled, तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम् having a glittering golden archway, ध्वजयन्त्राढ्याम् decorated with the flagstaff operated mechanically, वालिनः Vali's, पुरीम् capital city, किष्किन्धाम् of Kishkinda, प्राप्ताः स्म reached
explanation: 'We have arrived at Kishkinda, the capital of Vali, decorated with flags and having a glittering golden archway that can be opened mechanically. Teeming with monkeys, it looks like a snare to catch the enemy.

shloka_text: प्रतिज्ञा या त्वया वीर कृता वालिवधे पुरा। सफलां कुरु तां क्षिप्रं लतां काल इवागतः4.14.6।।
translation: वीर hero, त्वया by  you, वालिवधे to kill Vali, पुरा earlier, या such, प्रतिज्ञा vow, कृता has been taken, ताम् that one, आगतः came, कालः time, लताम् इव like creeper, क्षिप्रम् at once, सफलाम् successful, कुरु make it.
explanation: 'O heroic Rama fulfil quickly the vow taken by you earlier to kill Vali in the same way  a creeper bears fruit when the time comes.'

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवेण स राघवः। तमेवोवाच वचनं सुग्रीवं शत्रुसूदनः4.14.7।।
translation: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मात्मा righteous one, शत्रुसूदनः destroyer of enemies, सः राघवः that Rama, तम् to him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Requested thus by Sugriva, righteous Rama, the destroyer of enemies, replied:.

shloka_text: कृताभिज्ञानचिह्नस्त्व मनया गजसाह्वया। लक्ष्मणेन समुत्पाट्य यैषा कण्ठे कृता तव4.14.8।।
translation: या that, एषा this, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, समुत्पाट्य having uprooted, तव your, कण्ठे in the neck, कृता done, अनया by that, गजसाह्वया with the help of Gaja creeper, त्वम् you, कृताभिज्ञानचिह्नः can be easily recognised.
explanation: 'Lakshmana has uprooted a creeper of  gaja, and fastened it on your neck by which you can be easily identified.

shloka_text: शोभसेऽह्यधिकं वीर लतया कण्ठसक्तया। विपरीत इवाकाशे सूर्यो नक्षत्रमालया4.14.9।।
translation: वीर hero, कण्ठसक्तया  fastened to your neck, लतया by the creeper, आकाशे in the sky, नक्षत्रमालया by the cluster of stars, विपरीतः opposite, सूर्यः इव like the Sun, अधिकम् excessive, शोभसे shining.
explanation: 'O hero, you are shining with the creeper fastened to your neck , just as the fullmoon adorned with a cluster of stars shines in the sky.

shloka_text: अद्य वालिसमुत्थं ते भयं वैरं च वानर। एकेनाहं प्रमोक्ष्यामि बाणमोक्षेण संयुगे4.14.10।।
translation: वानर O monkey, अद्य now, अहम् I, संयुगे in combat, एकेन by a single, बाणमोक्षेण by the release of an arrow, ते to you, वालिसमुत्थम् caused by Vali, भयम् fear, वैरं च and enmity, प्रमोक्ष्यामि I will dispel
explanation: 'O monkey, with the release of a single arrow in the combat, I shall dispel your fear and enmity (hatred) for Vali.

shloka_text: मम दर्शय सुग्रीव वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम्। वाली विनिहतो यावद्वने पांसुषु वेष्टते4.14.11।।
translation: सुग्रीव  O Sugriva, भ्रातृरूपिणम् in the form of brother, वैरिणम् an enemy, मम to me, दर्शय वाली show Vali, विविहतः killed, वने in the forest, पांसुषु in the dust, यावत् चेष्टते before he rolls down.
explanation: 'O Sugriva show me your enemy,who is in the guise of your brother.He will be killed. He will roll down in the dust of the forest.

shloka_text: यदि दृष्टिपथं प्राप्तो जीवन्स विनिवर्तते। ततो दोषेण मा गच्छेत्सद्यो गर्हेच्च मा भवान्4.14.12।।
translation: दृष्टिपथम् sight, प्राप्तः comes, सः he, जीवन् with life, विनिवर्तते यदि if he will return, ततः then, भवान् you, सद्यः now, मा my, दोषेण blame, गच्छेत् may go, माम् me, गर्हेच्च will blame.
explanation: 'If Vali appears before me I will not let him go with life.Then you will not blame me and find fault with me.

shloka_text: प्रत्यक्षं सप्त ते साला मया बाणेन दारिताः। तेनावेहि बलेनाद्य वालिनं निहतं मया4.14.13।।
translation: ते to you, प्रत्यक्षम् in your presence, मया by me, बाणेन by an arrow, सप्त seven, सालाः sala trees, दारिताः are torn, ततः then, अद्य now, मया by me, वालिनम् Vali, बलेन by strength, निहतम् killed, वेहि you may know.
explanation: 'You have seen how I have pierced through seven sala trees with a single arrow. You will know how with the same strength I will kill Vali.'

shloka_text: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे वीर कृच्छ्रेऽपि तिष्टता। धर्मलोभपरीतेन न च वक्ष्ये कथञ्चन4.14.14।।
translation: वीर hero, कृच्छ्रे in distress, तिष्ठतापि although subjected, धर्मलोभपरीतेन with the fear of deviating from righteousness, मे from me, अनृतम् a lie, उक्तपूर्वम् earlier, कथञ्चन in any way, न वक्ष्ये I will not speak.
explanation: 'O Sugriva, I have uttered no falsehood before for fear of deviation from righteousness although I was in distress, nor shall I utter any falsehood in any circumstances hereafter.

shloka_text: सफलां च करिष्यामि प्रतिज्ञां जहि सम्भ्रमम्। प्रसूतं कलमं क्षेत्रे वर्षेणेव शतक्रतुः4.14.15।।
translation: शतक्रतुः Indra who performed a hundred sacrifices, वर्षेण by rain, प्रसूतम् production, कलमं क्षेत्रम् इव like the cornfield, प्रतिज्ञाम् my promise, सफलाम् will make it fruitful, करिष्यामि I will fulfil, सभ्रमम् apprehension, जहि give up.
explanation: 'I shall fulfil my promise just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) helps production in the cornfield through timely rain. Give up your apprehension.

shloka_text: तदाह्वाननिमित्तं त्वं वालिनो हेममालिनः। सुग्रीव कुरु तं शब्दं निष्पतेद्येन वानरः4.14.16।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तत् that, हेममालिनः adorned with a golden garland, वालिनः Vali, आह्वाननिमित्तं च to invite him, तम् such, शब्दम् sound, कुरु make, येन by which, वानरः monkey, निष्पतेत् will come out.
explanation: 'O Sugriva give a warcry so that Vali adorned with a golden garland will come out.

shloka_text: जितकाशी बलश्लाघी त्वया चाधर्षितः पुरा। निष्पतिष्यत्यसङ्गेन वाली स प्रियसंयुगः4.14.17।।
translation: जितकाशी proud of valour, बलश्लाघी one who praises strength, त्वया by you, अधर्षितः challenged, प्रियसंयुगः fond of battle, सः वाली that Vali, असङ्गेन without any fear, पुरात् from the city, निष्पतिष्यति will rush forward.
explanation: 'Vali, who is proud of  his valour,  is strong, fearless and fond of combat, will rush out of the city in response to your challenge.

shloka_text: रिपूणां धर्षिण शूरा मर्षयन्ति न संयुगे। जानन्तस्तु स्वकं वीर्यं स्त्रीसमक्षं विशेषतः4.14.18।।
translation: स्वकम् their own, वीर्यम् prowess, जानन्तः proud, संयुगे in battle, रिपूणाम् foe's, धर्षितम् roar of challenge, श्रुत्वा on hearing, न मर्षयन्ति not brook, स्त्री समक्षम् in front of women, विशेषतः specially.
explanation: 'Proud of their own prowess, heroes will not brook the challenge of foes in battle, specially in the presence of women.'

shloka_text: स तु रामवचश्श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः। ननर्द क्रूरनादेन विनिर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम्4.14.19।।
translation: हेमपिङ्गलः goldenhued, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, रामवचः Rama's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अम्बरम् sky, विनिर्भिन्दन्निव as if splitting, क्रूरनादेन in fierceful voice, ननर्द roared.
explanation: On hearing Rama's words, the goldenhued Sugriva roared in a fierce voice as if it would piece  the sky.

shloka_text: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्ता गावो यान्ति हतप्रभाः। राजदोषपरामृष्टाः कुलस्त्रिय इवाकुलाः4.14.20।।
translation: तत्र thereafter, गावः cows, शब्देन by the yelling, वित्रस्ताः were alarmed, हतप्रभाः lost their brightness, राजदोषपरामृष्टाः by the failure of the king, कुलस्त्रियः यथा like the chaste women, आकुलाः much perplexed, यान्ति become.
explanation: Alarmed at the yelling of Sugriva, the cows began to run in all directions, like the  women of noble pedigree who, with their brightness lost, run perplexed for failure of the king to protect their chastity.

shloka_text: द्रवन्ति च मृगाश्शीघ्रं भग्ना इव रणे हयाः। पतन्ति च खगा भूमौ क्षीणपुण्या इव ग्रहाः4.14.21।।
translation: रणे in battle, भग्नाः wounded हयाः इव like the horses, मृगाः deer, शीघ्रम् speedily, द्रवन्ति च unable to run, खगाः birds, क्षीणपुण्याः their merit exhausted, ग्रहाः इव like planets, भूमौ on the ground, पतन्ति च fall.
explanation: The deer were unable to run like wounded horses in a battle. Birds fell down on the ground like planets fall when their merit is exhausted.

shloka_text: ततस्सजीमूतगणप्रणादो नादं ह्यमुञ्चत्त्वरया प्रतीतः। सूर्यात्मजश्शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः सरित्पतिर्वाऽनिलचञ्चलोर्मिः4.14.22।।
translation: ततः then, जीमूतगणप्रणादः thundering of a cluster of clouds, प्रतीतः quickly, सूर्यात्मजः son of Sungod, शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः lustre enhanced by valour, अनिलचञ्चलोर्मि: waves lashed by the wind become restless, सरित्पतिर्वा (like the lord of rivers) ocean, त्वरया quick, नादम्  sound, अमुञ्चत् let loose.
explanation: Then Sugriva, son of the Sungod, with his lustre enhanced by his valour moved swiftly. His roar resembled the rumbling of a cluster of thundering clouds. He gave a warcry the tone of which resembled the sounds of waves lashed by high velocity winds in the sea. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: अथ तस्य निनादं तं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः। शुश्रावान्तः पुर गतो वाली भ्रातुरमर्षणः4.15.1।।
translation: अथ then, महात्मनः venerable, भ्रातुः brother, तस्य सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, तं निनादम् that sound, आन्तःपुरगतः into the inner chambers, अमर्षणः indignant, वाली Vali, शुश्राव heard.
explanation: The indignant Vali, who was in the harem, heard the roaring of his venerable brother, Sugriva.
comments: Tara suspects Sugriva's intention -- advises Vali to make alliance with Rama -- obstructs Vali from going for war

shloka_text: श्रुत्वा तु तस्य निनदं सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम्। मदश्चैकपदे नष्टः क्रोधश्चापतितो महान्4.15.2।।
translation: तस्य his, सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम् that shook all creatures, निनदम् roar, श्रुत्वा having heard, एकपदे at once, मदः च vanity नष्टः lost, महान्  violent, क्रोधः rage, आपादितश्च was aroused
explanation: The roar (of Sugriva) that frightened all beings gave Vali's vanity a jolt and at once   aroused in him violent rage.

shloka_text: स तु रोषपरीताङ्गो वाली सन्ध्याकनकप्रभः। उपरक्त इवादित्यस्सद्यो निष्प्रभतां गतः4.15.3।।
translation: ततः then, रोषपरीताङ्गःovercome with anger, कनकप्रभः radiant like gold, वालीVali, उपरक्तः eclipsed, आदित्यः इव like the Sun, सद्यःat once, निष्प्रभताम्  pale, गतः became
explanation: Overcome with anger, Vali looked pale like the eclipsed Sun with the golden radiance faded from  his face.

shloka_text: वाली दंष्ट्राकरालस्तु क्रोधाद्दीप्ताग्निसन्निभः। भात्युत्पतितपद्मस्तु समृणाळ इव ह्रदः4.15.4।।
translation: दंष्ट्राकरालः of fierce teeth, क्रोधात्  in  anger, दीप्ताग्निसन्निभः like the flaming fire, वाली Vali, उत्पतितपद्मस्तु a pond with uprooted lotuses, समृणालः with the stalks, ह्रदः इव like a pond
explanation: Vali, who looked fierce with his teeth and whose eyes shone like a flaming fire through anger looked like a pond with the lotuses and their stalks uprooted.

shloka_text: शब्दं दुर्मर्षणं श्रुत्वा निष्पपात ततो हरिः। वेगेन चरणन्यासैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम्4.15.5।।
translation: ततः then, हरिः Sugriva, दुर्मर्षणम् intolerable, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वेगेन hurriedly, पदन्यासैः  long strides, मेदिनीम् earth, दारयन्निव as if breaking, निष्पपात rushed out
explanation: Unable to tolerate Sugriva's roar, Vali stepped out hurriedly, taking long strides as if breaking the earth.

shloka_text: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य स्नेहाद्दर्शितसौहृदाः। उवाच त्रस्तसम्भ्रान्ता हितोदर्कमिदं वचः4.15.6।।
translation: तारा Tara, तम् him, स्नेहात् with love, परिष्वज्य embraced, दर्शितसौहृदाः glanced lovingly, त्रस्तसम्भ्रान्ता perplexed out of fear, हितोदर्कम् a good counsel, इदं वचः these words, उवाच spoke
explanation: Tara, perplexed out of fear, glanced at Vali lovingly, embraced him and gave him wise counsel:

shloka_text: साधु क्रोधमिमं वीर नदीवेगमिवागतम्। शयनादुत्थितः काल्यं त्यज भुक्तामिव स्रजम्4.15.7।।
translation: वीर valiant Vali, नदीवेगमिव like the flood of river, आगतम् come, इमम् this, क्रोधम् with anger, काल्यम् entertained at this time, शयनात् from bed, उत्थितः got up, भुक्ताम् used up, स्रजमिव like a flower garland, साधु the wise, त्यज give up.
explanation: 'O valiant Vali anger has overtaken you like the flood of a river. It is natural for you to be angry at this time, but shake off your anger just as the wise discard a flower  garland already used up.

shloka_text: काल्यमेतेन सङ्ग्रामं करिष्यसि च वानर। वीर ते शत्रुबाहुल्यं फल्गुता वा न विद्यते4.15.8।।
translation: वानर monkey, एतेन with him, काल्यम्  tomorrow morning, सङ्ग्रामम् fight, करिष्यसि wish to  wage, वीर hero, ते to you, शत्रुबाहुल्यम् respect enemy more, फल्गुता वा weak also, न विद्यते  not become
explanation: 'O monkey fight him only tomorrow morning. By this you are not going to prove your weakness or increase your respect for the enemy.

shloka_text: सहसा तव निष्क्रामो मम तावन्न रोचते। श्रूयतां चाभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं निवार्यसे4.15.9।।
translation: सहसा rashly, तव you, निष्क्रामः exit, मम for me, न रोचते तावम् do not feel good, यन्निमित्तम् for what reason, निवार्यसे you are prevented, अभिधास्यामि I will explain, श्रूयताम् listen.
explanation: 'I do not like your rashness. I will explain the reason I am preventing you. Listen:

shloka_text: पूर्वमापतितः क्रोधात्स त्वामाह्वयते युधि। निष्पत्य च निरस्तस्ते हन्यमानो दिशो गतः4.15.10।।
translation: सः he, पूर्वम् earlier, क्रोधात् raged, आपतितः came, त्वाम् you, आह्वयते  challenging you, ते for you, निष्पत्य  attacked, निरस्तः thrown , हन्यमानः struck , दिशः directions, गतः went.
explanation: 'Earlier, he (Sugriva) came  and challenged you to a duel. You struck him in anger, and defeated, he fled, running in all directions. Now his challenge rouses my suspicion.

shloka_text: त्वया तस्य निरस्तस्य पीडितस्य विशेषतः। इहैत्य पुनराह्वानं शङ्कां जनयतीव मे4.15.11।।
translation: त्वया by you, निरस्तस्य defeated by you, विशेषतः specially, पीडितस्य hurt by you, तस्य his, इह here, पुनः again, एत्य after coming, आह्वानम् inviting you, मे to me, शङ्काम् suspicion, जनयतीव arouses.
explanation: 'One who is defeated and badly mauled by you is again coming and inviting you to a duel in this manner arouses suspicion in me.

shloka_text: दर्पश्च व्यवसायश्च यादृशस्तस्य नर्दतः। निनादश्चापि संरम्भो नैतदल्पं हि कारणम्4.15.12।।
translation: नर्दतः roaring, तस्य his, दर्पश्च and his arrogance, व्यवसायश्च determination also, निनादस्य roaring, संरम्भः insolence, एतत् all this, अल्पम् small, कारणम् cause, न हि cannot be.
explanation: 'His determination, his insolence, his roaring, his arroganceall this cannot be for a small reason.

shloka_text: नासहायमहं मन्ये सुग्रीवं तमिहागतम्। अवष्टब्धसहायश्च यमाश्रित्यैष गर्जति4.15.13।।
translation: इह here, आगतम् came, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, असहायम् without any help, न मन्ये not think so, अवष्टब्धसहाय certainly sought refuge, यम् big, आश्रित्य having taken help, एषः he, गर्जति is roaring.
explanation: 'Certainly Sugriva has not come here to give a warcry without any external help. The person whose refuge he has sought is not a small one.

shloka_text: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव बुद्धिमांश्चैव वानरः। अपरीक्षितवीर्येण सुग्रीवस्सहनैष्यति।।4.15.14।।
translation: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव naturally a clever, बुद्धिमांश्चैव wise person, वानरः monkey, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, अपरीक्षितवीर्येण without testing the ability of the ally, सख्यम् friendship न एष्यति will not make
explanation: 'Sugriva is clever by nature. He is wise. Without assessing the ability of the ally he will not enter into friendship.

shloka_text: पूर्वमेव मया वीर श्रुतं कथयतो वचः। अङ्गदस्य कुमारस्य वक्ष्यामित्वा हितं वचः4.15.15।।
translation: वीर O hero, पूर्वमेव earlier, कथयतः what he spoke, कुमारस्य from the son, अङ्गदस्य of Angada, वचः news, मय by me, श्रुतम् heard, हितम् good, वचः words, अद्य now, वक्ष्यामि त्वा will tell you.
explanation: 'O hero I have heard the news earlier from our son Angada. I will tell you what he had heard and what he has said to me:

shloka_text: अङ्गदस्तु कुमारोऽयं वनान्तमुपनिर्गतः। प्रवृत्तिस्तेन कथिता चारै राप्तैर्निवेदिता4.15.16।।
translation: कुमारः son, अयम् अङ्गदः this Angada, वनान्तम् to the forest, उपनिर्गतः had gone, तेन by him, प्रवृत्ति: news, कथिता narrated, चारैः  by spies, निवेदिता revealed.
explanation: 'When our son Angada was out into the forest he had collected some reports from the spies which he has transmitted to me.

shloka_text: अयोध्याधिपतेः पुत्रौ शूरौ समरदुर्जयौ। इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातौ प्रथितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ4.15.17।। सुग्रीवप्रियकामार्थं प्राप्तौ तत्र दुरासदौ।
translation: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvaku, कुले race, जातौ both born, अयोध्याधिपतेः king of Ayodhya, पुत्रौ sons, शूरौ two heroic, समरदुर्जयौ inviacible in war, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, प्रस्थितौ both had, दुरासदौ both unconquerable, सुग्रीवप्रियकामार्थम् to please Sugriva, तत्र there, प्राप्तौ came.
explanation: 'Rama and Lakshmana, two heroic sons of the king of Ayodhya born of the Ikshvaku race, are invincible in war. They have come there to help Sugriva.

shloka_text: तव भ्रातुर्हि विख्यातस्सहायो रणकर्कशः। रामः परबलामर्दी युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः4.15.18।।
translation: रणकर्कशः  crushing the foes in war, विख्यातः famous man, उत्थितः sprung up, युगान्ताग्निरिव like fire at the end of creation, परबलामर्दी who slayed strong enemies like Khara, सः रामः that Rama, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, सहायः हि will help.
explanation: 'Rama, famous for crushing foes in war, like the fire that breaks out at the dissolution of the world, has slain strong enemies like Khara and will help your brother.

shloka_text: निवासवृक्षः साधूनामापन्नानां परा गतिः। आर्तानां संश्रयश्चैव यशसश्चैकभाजनम्4.15.19।।
translation: साधूनाम् to the virtuous people, निवासवृक्षः a sheltering tree, आपन्नानाम् to the destitutes, परा  supreme, गतिः refuge, आर्तानाम् to the distressed, संश्रयश्चैव protector, यशसः fame, एकभाजनम् sole repository.
explanation: 'He is like a sheltering tree to the virtuous, an ultimate refuge for the destitutes and a protector of the distressed. He is the sole repository of fame.

shloka_text: ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नो निदेशे निरतः पितुः। धातूनामिव शैलेन्द्रो गुणानामाकरो महान्4.15.20।।
translation: ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नः endowed with knowledge of scriptures science and, पितुः father's, निदेशे at the command, स्थितः stood by, शैलेन्द्रः lord of mountains, धातूनामिव like the mine of minerals, गुणानाम् for all virtues, महान् great, आकरः a mine.
explanation: 'He is endowed with the knowledge of science and scriptures. He stood by his father's command. He is like a mine of virtues just as the lord of the mountain is  a mine of minerals.

shloka_text: तत्क्षमं न विरोधस्ते सह तेन महात्मना। दुर्जयेनाप्रमेयेन रामेण रणकर्मसु4.15.21।।
translation: तत् therefore, महात्मना great, रणकर्मसु in war, दुर्जयेन unconquerable, अप्रमेयेन of immeasurable, तेन रामेण by that Rama, ते to you, विरोधः enmity, न क्षमम् not desirable.
explanation: 'Rama is immeasurable in prowess and unconquerable in war. Therefore, enmity with him is not desirable for you.

shloka_text: शूर वक्ष्यामि ते किञ्चिन्न चेच्छाम्यभ्यसूयितुम्। श्रूयतां क्रियतां चैव तव वक्ष्यामि यद्धितम्4.15.22।।
translation: शूर valiant, ते to you, किञ्चित् a little, वक्ष्यामि I will tell, अभ्यसूयितुम् not to dislike you, न इच्छामि not intend to, तव your, हितम् welfare, यत् वक्ष्यामि telling for your sake, श्रूयताम् please listen, क्रियतां च do as I say.
