explanation: 'Between mount Asta (the mountain behind which the Sun sets) and Meru there is a shining golden palm tree with ten high peaks and wonderful altars around.

shloka_text: तेषु सर्वेषु दुर्गेषु सरस्सु च सरित्सु च। रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्तत स्ततः।।4.42.47।।
translation: सर्वेषु in all, तेषु दुर्गेषु in those inaccessible mountains, सरस्सु च in lakes, सरित्सु च in rivers, ततस्ततः every where, वैदेह्या सह along with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, मार्गितव्यः look for
explanation: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over those inaccessible mountains, lakes and rivers.

shloka_text: यत्र तिष्ठति धर्मज्ञस्तपसा स्वेन भावितः। मेरुसावर्णिरित्येव ख्यातो वै ब्रह्मणा समः।।4.42.48।।
translation: धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, स्वेन on his own, तपसा with penance, भावितः he is identified, ब्रह्मणा with Brahma, समः equal, मेरुसावर्णिः इत्येव known as Meru Savarna, ख्यातः popular, यत्र there, तिष्ठति lies
explanation: 'The sage Merusavarna, knower of dharma, famous for his penance and comparable to Brahma lives there with him on Meru.

shloka_text: प्रष्टव्यो मेरुसावर्णिर्महर्षिः सूर्यसन्निभः। प्रणम्य शिरसा भूमौ प्रवृत्तिं मैथिलीं प्रति।।4.42.49।।
translation: सूर्यसन्निभः glowing like the Sun, महर्षिः seer, मेरुसावर्णिः Merusavarna who glows like Meru, शिरसा with head, भूमौ touching ground, प्रणम्य bowing down, मैथिलीं Maithili प्रति with regard to  प्रवृत्तिम् information, प्रष्टव्यः enquire
explanation: 'Bow down, touch the feet of the seer Merusavarna, who glows like the Sun and then enquire from him about Sita.

shloka_text: एताव ज्जीवलोकस्य भास्करो रजनीक्ष्ये। कृत्वा वितिमिरं सर्वमस्तं गच्छति पर्वतम्।।4.42.50।।
translation: भास्करः Sun, जीवलोकस्य of the world of living beings, एतावत् to this extent, सर्वम् all, रजनीक्ष्ये at the end of the night, वितिमिरम् devoid of darkness, कृत्वा after doing, अस्तं पर्वतम् mountain behind which the sun sets, गच्छति reaches
explanation: 'The world of living beings is extended to this extent. The Sun dispels darkness at the end of the night and thereafter reaches the mountain behind which he sets (at the end of the day).

shloka_text: एतावद्वानरैश्शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुङ्गवाः। अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम्।।4.42.51।।
translation: वानरपुङ्गवाः O great monkeys, एतावत् to this limit, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् possible, अभास्करम्  devoid of the Sun, अमर्यादं च without boundaries, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः we do not know
explanation: 'O great monkeys you can go only up to that point. The Sun's rays do not extend beyond this and it has no boundaries.We do not know about the area beyond this limit.

shloka_text: अधिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च। अस्त पर्वतमासाद्य पूर्णे मासे निवर्तत।।4.42.52।।
translation: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च abode, अधिगम्य after finding out, अस्तं पर्वतम् Astha mountain, आसाद्य after reaching, मासे a month, पूर्णे in completion of, निवर्तत you may return
explanation: 'Go and find out Sita and the abode of Ravana. After this, return to the mountain behind which the Sun sets and come back on completion of a month.

shloka_text: ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न वस्तव्यं वसन् वध्यो भवेन्मम। सहैव शूरो युष्माभिश्श्वशुरो मे गमिष्यति।।4.42.53।।
translation: मासात् more than a month, ऊर्द्वम् beyond that, न वस्तव्यम् you should not stay, वसन् while staying, मम to me, वध्यः to be killed, भवेत् you may be, युष्माभिः by you सहैव along with you, मे my, शूरः brave, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, गमिष्यति will go
explanation: 'If you tarry beyond a month, you will be slain. My fatherin law, the brave hero will go with your group.

shloka_text: श्रोतव्यं सर्वमेतस्य भवद्भिर्दिष्टकारिभिः। गुरुरेष महाबाहुश्श्वशुरो मे महाबलः।।4.42.54।।
translation: दिष्टकारिभिः by those who carry out orders, भवद्भि: by you, एतस्य his, सर्वम् all, श्रोतव्यम् listen, महाबाहुः strongarmed one, महाबलःvery strong, एषः he, मे my, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, गुरुः teacher
explanation: 'You should obey him. You are meant to carry out his orders. He is not only my fatherinlaw but also a valiant, strong and powerful hero and my preceptor.

shloka_text: भवन्तश्चापि विक्रान्ताः प्रमाणं सर्व कर्मसु। प्रमाणमेनं संस्थाप्य पश्यध्वं पश्चिमां दिशम्।।4.42.55।।
translation: विक्रान्ताः advancing heroes, सर्वः all, भवन्तश्चापि you too, प्रमाणम् leader, कर्मसु in performing, एनम् him, प्रमाणमेन as authority, संस्थाप्य having placed him, पश्चिमां दिशम् western quarter, पश्यध्वम् look for
explanation: 'My fatherinlaw will be your leader. His authority will be final in all matters. Accept his authority and look for Vaidehi in the western direction.

shloka_text: ततस्सन्दिश्य सुग्रीवश्श्वशुरं पश्चिमां दिशम्। वीरं शतवलिं नाम वानरं वानरर्षभः।।4.43.1।।
translation: वानरर्षभः bull among monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, श्वशुरम् to fatherinlaw, पश्चिमां दिशम् western side, सन्दिश्य having assigned, ततः then, नाम called, वीरम् troop leader, वानरम् of monkeys, शतवलिं Satavali.
explanation: Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, having sent his fatherinlaw in the western direction, said to Satavali, troop leader of the monkeys:
comments: Sugriva sends the next contingent in the northern direction towards the Himalayas -- countries and places in the north described.

shloka_text: उवाच राजा धर्मज्ञस्सर्ववानरसत्तमम्। वाक्यमात्म हितं चैव रामस्य च हितं तथा।।4.43.2।।
translation: राजा king, धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, सर्ववानरसत्तमः foremost among all the monkeys, तथा in that way, आत्महितं च एव for his own welfare, रामस्य च and Rama's also, हितम् good, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: 'Righteous king Sugriva said to the foremost among the monkeys, Satavali what would help his cause as well as the cause of Rama:

shloka_text: वृतश्शतसहस्रेण त्वद्विधानां वनौकसाम्। वैवस्वतसुतैस्सार्धं प्रतिष्ठस्व स्वमन्त्रिभिः।।4.43.3।।
translation: त्वद्विधानाम् like you, वनौकसाम् the foresters, शतसहस्रेण a hundred thousand, वृतः take, स्वमन्त्रिभिः with ministers also, वैवस्वतसुतैस्सार्धम् along with the sons of the Sungod, प्रतिष्ठस्व  get going.
explanation: 'Take like you a hundred thousand courageous heroes, your ministers and the sons of Vaivasvata. And begin your expedition.

shloka_text: दिशं ह्युदीचीं विक्रान्तां हिमशैलावतंसकाम्। सर्वतः परिमार्गध्वं रामपत्नीमनिन्दिताम्।।4.43.4।।
translation: विक्रान्तां mighty, हिमशैलावतंसकाम् having Himavan as its earring, उदीचीं दिशम् in the northern direction, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, रामपत्नीम् Rama's spouse, सर्वतः all over, परिमार्गध्वम् search for.
explanation: 'Look all over the northern direction adorned with mighty Himavan as its earring, for the spouse of blameless Rama

shloka_text: अस्मिन्कार्येविनिर्वृत्ते कृते दाशरथेः प्रिये। ऋणान्मुक्ता भविष्यामः कृतार्थार्थविदां वराः।।4.43.5।।
translation: कृतार्थविदां वराः successful in our endeavour, अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये in this work, विनिवृत्ते returned, दाशरथेः Dasarathi's, प्रिये कृते when the task dear to him is done, ऋणान् from the debt, मुक्ताः redeemed, कृतार्थाः sucessful, भविष्यामः we will be.
explanation: 'We should be succeessful in our endeavour when we have completed the task dear to Rama. We will be redeemed of our debt to him.

shloka_text: कृतं हि प्रियमस्माकं राघवेण महात्मना। तस्य चेत्प्रतिकारोऽस्ति सफलं जीवितं भवेत्।।4.43.6।।
translation: महात्मना highsouled, राघवेण by Rama, अस्माकम् for us, प्रियम् dear, कृतं हि is done, तस्य for that, प्रतिकारः a help in return, अस्ति चेत् if there is anything, जीवितम् life, सफलम् sucessful, भवेत् will be(blessed).
explanation: 'Highsouled Rama has done a great service to us earlier. We will be blessed if we are successful in helping Rama in return.

shloka_text: अर्थिनः कार्यनिर्वृत्तिमकर्तुरपि यश्चरेत्। तस्य स्यात्सफलं जन्म किं पुनः पूर्वकारिणः।।4.43.7।।
translation: यः whoever, अकर्तुरपि who has not helped, अर्थिनः by a needy man, कार्यनिर्वृत्तिम् fulfilling the task, चरेत् if one takes up, तस्य his, जन्म life, सफलं स्यात् will be fruitful, पूर्वकारिणः one who has helped earlier, किं पुनः what to say.
explanation: 'Our life becomes fruitful when we help a person who was not helped us. What to speak of returning the help one has rendered.

shloka_text: एतां बुद्धिमवस्थाय दृश्यते जानकी यथा। तथा भवद्भिः कर्तव्यमस्मत्प्रियहितैषिभिः।।4.43.8।।
translation: एताम् such, बुद्धिम् mind, अवस्थाय after taking such a stand, अस्मत्प्रियहितैषिभिः by our well wishers, भवद्भिः by you, जानकी Janaki, यथा in such a way, दृश्यते is seen, तथा like that, कर्तव्यम् should be done.
explanation: 'Keeping this in mind, you, as my wellwishers, should act in a way Janaki can be traced.

shloka_text: अयं हि सर्वभूतानां मान्यस्तु नरसत्तमः। अस्मासु चागत: प्रीती रामः परपुरञ्जयः।।4.43.9।।
translation: अयम् this, नरसत्तमः king, परपुरञ्जयः  who can conquer the capitals of enemies, रामः Rama, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, मान्यः revered, अस्मासु at us also, प्रीतिं गतः he loves.
explanation: 'This Rama who can conquer the capitals of enemies is great. He loves and is loved by all living beings including ourselves.

shloka_text: इमानि वनदुर्गाणि नद्यश्शैलान्तराणि च। भवन्तः परिमार्गन्तु बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पदा।।4.43.10।।
translation: भवन्तः by your, बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पदा rich wisdom and valour, इमानि these, वनदुर्गाणि inacessible forests, नद्यः rivers, शैलान्तराणि च mountain ranges,परिमार्गन्तु search.
explanation: 'You are rich in wisdom and valour. You should search for Sita everywhere including inaccessible forests and mountain ranges.

shloka_text: तत्र म्लेच्छान्पुलिन्दांश्च शूरसेनांस्तथैव च। प्रस्थलान्भरतांश्चैव कुरूंश्च सह मद्रकैः।।4.43.11।। काम्बोजान्यवनां श्चैव शकानारट्टकानपि। बाह्लीकानृषिकां श्चैव पौरवानथ टङ्कणान्।।4.43.12।। चीनान्परमचीनांश्च नीहारांश्च पुनः पुनः। अन्विष्यदरदांश्चैव हिमवन्तं तथैव च।।4.43.13।।
translation: तत्र there, म्लेच्छान् Mlechhas, पुलिन्दांश्च Pulindas, तथैव च so also, शूरसेनान् Surasenas, प्रस्थलान् Prasthalas, भरतांश्चैव Bharatas, मद्रकै सह along with Madrakas, कुरूंश्च and also Kurus, काम्बोजान्यवनांश्चैव Kambojas and Yavanas, शकान् Shakas, आरट्टकानपि च Arattakas, बाह्लीकान् Bahlikas, ऋषिकांश्चैव Rishikas, पौरवान् Pauravas, अथ and then, टङ्कणान्  Tankanas, चीनान् Cheenas, परमचीनांश्च in Paramacheena, नीहारांश्च Niharas, दरदांश्चैव Daradas also, पुनःपुनः again and again, अन्विष्य  searching, हिमवन्तम्  Himavanta, विचिन्वथ search.
explanation: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.

shloka_text: तत्र म्लेच्छान्पुलिन्दांश्च शूरसेनांस्तथैव च। प्रस्थलान्भरतांश्चैव कुरूंश्च सह मद्रकैः।।4.43.11।। काम्बोजान्यवनां श्चैव शकानारट्टकानपि। बाह्लीकानृषिकां श्चैव पौरवानथ टङ्कणान्।।4.43.12।। चीनान्परमचीनांश्च नीहारांश्च पुनः पुनः। अन्विष्यदरदांश्चैव हिमवन्तं तथैव च।।4.43.13।।
translation: तत्र there, म्लेच्छान् Mlechhas, पुलिन्दांश्च Pulindas, तथैव च so also, शूरसेनान् Surasenas, प्रस्थलान् Prasthalas, भरतांश्चैव Bharatas, मद्रकै सह along with Madrakas, कुरूंश्च and also Kurus, काम्बोजान्यवनांश्चैव Kambojas and Yavanas, शकान् Shakas, आरट्टकानपि च Arattakas, बाह्लीकान् Bahlikas, ऋषिकांश्चैव Rishikas, पौरवान् Pauravas, अथ and then, टङ्कणान्  Tankanas, चीनान् Cheenas, परमचीनांश्च in Paramacheena, नीहारांश्च Niharas, दरदांश्चैव Daradas also, पुनःपुनः again and again, अन्विष्य  searching, हिमवन्तम्  Himavanta, विचिन्वथ search.
explanation: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.

shloka_text: तत्र म्लेच्छान्पुलिन्दांश्च शूरसेनांस्तथैव च। प्रस्थलान्भरतांश्चैव कुरूंश्च सह मद्रकैः।।4.43.11।। काम्बोजान्यवनां श्चैव शकानारट्टकानपि। बाह्लीकानृषिकां श्चैव पौरवानथ टङ्कणान्।।4.43.12।। चीनान्परमचीनांश्च नीहारांश्च पुनः पुनः। अन्विष्यदरदांश्चैव हिमवन्तं तथैव च।।4.43.13।।
translation: तत्र there, म्लेच्छान् Mlechhas, पुलिन्दांश्च Pulindas, तथैव च so also, शूरसेनान् Surasenas, प्रस्थलान् Prasthalas, भरतांश्चैव Bharatas, मद्रकै सह along with Madrakas, कुरूंश्च and also Kurus, काम्बोजान्यवनांश्चैव Kambojas and Yavanas, शकान् Shakas, आरट्टकानपि च Arattakas, बाह्लीकान् Bahlikas, ऋषिकांश्चैव Rishikas, पौरवान् Pauravas, अथ and then, टङ्कणान्  Tankanas, चीनान् Cheenas, परमचीनांश्च in Paramacheena, नीहारांश्च Niharas, दरदांश्चैव Daradas also, पुनःपुनः again and again, अन्विष्य  searching, हिमवन्तम्  Himavanta, विचिन्वथ search.
explanation: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.

shloka_text: लोध्रपद्मकषण्डेषु देवदारुवनेषु च। रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.14।।
translation: लोध्रपद्मकषण्डेषु in the thickets of Lodhra and lotuses, देवदारुवनेषु च and in the woods of Devadaru, रावणः Ravana, ततस्ततः everywhere, वैदेह्या सह Vaidehi, मार्गितव्यः explore.
explanation: 'There you should explore the dwelling of Ravana and Vaidehi, in the thickets of lodhra and lotuses and in the woods of devadaru.

shloka_text: ततस्सोमाश्रमं गत्वा देवगन्धर्वसेवितम्। कालं नाम महासानुं पर्वतं तु गमिष्यथ।।4.43.15।।
translation: ततः then, देवगन्धर्वसेवितम् inhabited by gods and gandharvas, सोमाश्रमम् hermitage of Soma, गत्वा after visiting, महासानुम् great slopes, कालं नाम named Kala, पर्वतं तु the mountain also, गमिष्यथ go and explore.
explanation: 'Then go and explore the hermitage of Soma inhabited by gods and gandharvas and also the great summits of mount Kala.

shloka_text: महत्सु तस्य शैलस्य निर्दरेषु गुहासु च। विचिनुध्वं महाभागां रामपत्नींततस्ततः।।4.43.16।।
translation: तस्य that mountain's, महत्सु mighty one's, शैलस्य mountain's, निर्दरेषु in caverns, गुहासु च in caves as well, महाभागाम् great lady, ततस्ततः everywhere, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, विचिनुध्वं  search for.
explanation: 'Look for that great lady, Rama's consort, in the big caves and caverns all over the mountain.

shloka_text: तमतिक्रम्य शैलेन्द्रं हेमगर्भं महागिरिम्। ततस्सुदर्शनं नाम गन्तुमर्हथ पर्वतम्।।4.43.17।।
translation: हेमगर्भम् filled with gold, शैलेन्द्रम् lord of mountain, तम् that, महागिरिम् great mountain, अतिक्रम्य after passing , ततः then, सुदर्शनं नाम called Sudarsana, पर्वतम् mountain, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हथ it is proper for you.
explanation: 'Crossing this lord of hills filled with gold, you should reach the great mountain called Sudarsana.

shloka_text: ततो देवसखो नाम पर्वतः पतगालयः। नानापक्षिगणाकीर्णो विविधद्रुमभूषितः।।4.43.18।।
translation: ततः from there, पतगालयः nests of birds, नानापक्षिगणाकीर्णः full of different kinds of birds, विविधद्रुमभूषितः adorned with different kinds of trees, देवसखो नाम Devasakha by name, पर्वतः mountain.
explanation: 'Then proceed to mount Devasakha inhabited by a variety of birds adorning the trees.

shloka_text: तस्य काननषण्डेषु निर्घरेषु गुहासु च। रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.19।।
translation: तस्य its, काननषण्डेषु in the thickets, निर्घरेषु near mountain streams, गुहासु च in caves, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्यासह and Vaidehi, ततस्ततः everywhere, मार्गितव्यः should be searched.
explanation: 'You should search for Ravana as well as Vaidehi everywhere in the thickets of that hill, near the mountain streams and also in caves.

shloka_text: तमतिक्रम्य चाकाशं सर्वतश्शतयोजनम्। अपर्वतनदीवृक्षं सर्वसत्त्वविवर्जितम्।।4.43.20।।
translation: तम् those, अतिक्रम्य after passing, अपर्वतनदीवृक्षम् a location without mountains, rivers and trees, सर्वसत्त्ववर्जितम् a desolate place without trace of life, सर्वतः all over, शतयोजनम् hundred yojanas, आकाशम् vacant space.
explanation: 'Beyond, there is a desolate place of hundred yojanas with no trace of life, no mountains, no trees, no rivers.

shloka_text: तं तु शीघ्रमतिक्रम्य कान्तारं रोमहर्षणम्। कैलासं पाण्डुरं शैलं प्राप्य हृष्टा भविष्यथ।।4.43.21।।
translation: कान्तारम् fearsome, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, तम् that, शीघ्रम् quickly, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, पाण्डुरम् pale white, कैलासम् Kailasa, प्राप्य on reaching, शैलम् mountain, हृष्टाः happy, भविष्यथ you will be.
explanation: 'Crossing that horripilating, desolate place quickly, you will be happy to reach the snowy Kailasa mountain.

shloka_text: तत्र पाण्डुरमेघाभं जाम्बूनदपरिष्कृतम्। कुबेरभवनं रम्यं निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।।4.43.22।।
translation: तत्र there, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितम् built, पाण्डुरमेघाभम् like pale white cloud, जाम्बूनदपरिष्कृतम् embellished with gold, रम्यम् exquisite, कुबेरभवनम् mansion of Kubera.
explanation: 'There is an exquisite mansion of Kubera built by Visvakarma which, embellished with gold, looks like a pale white cloud.

shloka_text: विशाला नलिनी यत्र प्रभूतकमलोत्पला। हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाप्सरोगणसेविता।।4.43.23।।
translation: यत्र where, प्रभूतकमलोत्पला with many lotuses and lilies, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा inhabited by swans and ducks, अप्सरोगणसेविता frequented by groups of apasaras, विशाला large, नलिनी lotus pond.
explanation: 'There is a large lotus pond with many lotuses and lilies, inhabited by swans and ducks and frequented by groups of apasaras.

shloka_text: तत्र वैश्रवणो राजा सर्वभूतनमस्कृतः। धनदो रमते श्रीमान्गुह्यकैस्सह यक्षराट्।।4.43.24।।
translation: तत्र there, वैश्रवणः Vaisravana, राजा king, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतः worshipped by all beings, यक्षराट् Yaksha king, श्रीमान् prosperous, धनदः Kubera, गुह्यकैः सह along with Guhyakas, रमते enjoying.
explanation: 'Kubera, son of Vaisravana, a prosperous king of the yakshas (demigods) worshipped by all beings dwells there with Guhyakas.

shloka_text: तस्य चन्द्रनिकाशेषु पर्वतेषु गुहासु च। रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.25।।
translation: तस्य its, चन्द्रनिकाशेषु of the colour of the Moon, पर्वतेषु in mountains, गुहासु च and caves, ततस्ततः here and there, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, मार्गितव्यः you may look for.
explanation: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over the caves and mountains of Kilasa of the colour of the moon.

shloka_text: क्रौञ्चं तु गिरिमासाद्य बिलं तस्य सुदुर्गमम्। अप्रमत्तै: प्रवेष्टव्यं दुष्प्रवेशं हि तत्स्मृतम्।।4.43.26।।
translation: क्रौञ्चं गिरिम् mountain Krauncha, आसाद्य after reaching, सुदुर्गमम् most diffficult place to access, तस्य बिलम् its entrance, अप्रमत्तै:carefully, प्रवेष्टव्यम् you may enter, तत् that, दुष्प्रवेशम् difficult to enter, स्मृतम् हि it is stated.
explanation: 'Therefrom proceed to mount krauncha mountain and enter carefully its cave which is reportedly difficult to access.

shloka_text: वसन्ति हि महात्मानस्तत्र सूर्यसमप्रभाः। देवैरप्यर्चिता स्सम्यग्देवरूपा महर्षयः।।4.43.27।।
translation: तत्र there (in krauncha caves), सूर्यसमप्रभाः radiant like the Sun, देवैः अपि even by the gods, अर्चिताः worshipped, देवरूपाः  form of gods, महात्मानः highsouled, महर्षयः ascetics, सम्यक् properly, वसन्ति हि live there.
explanation: 'Great ascetics live there. Worshipped even by the gods, these highsouled godlike ascetics shine like the very Sun.

shloka_text: क्रौञ्चस्य तु गुहाश्चान्या स्सानूनिशिखराणि च। निर्दराश्च नितम्बाश्च विचेतव्या स्ततस्ततः।।4.43.28।। कौञ्चस्य शिखरं चापि निरीक्ष्य च ततस्ततः।
translation: क्रौञ्चस्य Krauncha's, शिखरं चापि peak also, ततस्ततः all over, निरीक्ष्य after observing, क्रौञ्चस्य Krauncha's, अन्याः other, गुहाश्च caves also, सानूनि summits, शिखराणि च peaks, निर्दराश्च and caverns also, नितम्बाश्च ridges, ततस्ततः everywhere, विचेतव्याः search.
explanation: 'Ransack the peaks of Krauncha, its caves, caverns and ridges.

shloka_text: अवृक्षं कामशैलं च मानसं विहगालयम्। न गतिस्तत्र भूतानां देवदानव रक्षसाम्।।4.43.29।।
translation: अवृक्षम् without trees, विहगालयम् abode of birds, मानसम् Manasa, कामशैलम् mountain Kama, तत्र there, भूतानाम् for all living beings, गतिः access, न not, देवदानव gods, demons, रक्षसां च rakshas, न not.
explanation: 'There is a mountain region known as Kama, and Manasa where there are no trees. It is a bird sanctuary. Not only living beings, even gods, demons and rakshas have no access to that place.

shloka_text: स च सर्वैर्विचेतव्यस्ससानुप्रस्थभूधरः। क्रौञ्चं गिरिमतिक्रम्य मैनाको नाम पर्वतः।।4.43.30।।
translation: ससानुप्रस्थभूधरः the mountain including its plain lands and ridges, सः that mountain, सर्वैः by all of you, विचेतव्यः it has to be searched, क्रौञ्चं गिरिम् Krauncha mountain, अतिक्रम्य after passing, मैनाको नाम called Mainaka, पर्वतः mountain.
explanation: 'Beyond mount Krauncha you will find Mainaka. All of you should search for Sita in the plain lands and the ridges of the mountain.

shloka_text: मयस्य भवनं यत्र दानवस्य स्वयं कृतम्।।4.43.31।। मैनाकस्तु विचेतव्य स्ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः। स्त्रीणामश्वमुखीनां तु निकेतास्तत्र तत्र तु।।4.43.32।।
translation: यत्र there, दानवस्य demon's, मयस्य Maya's, स्वयं कृतम् built personally by him, भवनम् mansion, ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः with table lands and deep caves, मैनाकः Mainaka, विचेतव्यः you may look, तत्र तत्र here and there, अश्वमुखीनां स्त्रीणाम् of kinnera women with horseface, निकेताः residences.
explanation: 'There on Mainaka a demon, called Maya has built a mansion all by himself. Try to look in the plain lands, ridges and deep caves of Mainaka and in the residences of kinnera women with faces of horses.

shloka_text: मयस्य भवनं यत्र दानवस्य स्वयं कृतम्।।4.43.31।। मैनाकस्तु विचेतव्य स्ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः। स्त्रीणामश्वमुखीनां तु निकेतास्तत्र तत्र तु।।4.43.32।।
translation: यत्र there, दानवस्य demon's, मयस्य Maya's, स्वयं कृतम् built personally by him, भवनम् mansion, ससानुप्रस्थकन्दरः with table lands and deep caves, मैनाकः Mainaka, विचेतव्यः you may look, तत्र तत्र here and there, अश्वमुखीनां स्त्रीणाम् of kinnera women with horseface, निकेताः residences.
explanation: 'There on Mainaka a demon, called Maya has built a mansion all by himself. Try to look in the plain lands, ridges and deep caves of Mainaka and in the residences of kinnera women with faces of horses.

shloka_text: तं देशं समतिक्रम्य आश्रमं सिद्धसेवितम्। सिद्धा वैखानसास्तत्र वालखिल्याश्च तापसाः।।4.43.33।।
translation: तं देशम् that place, समतिक्रम्य after passing, सिद्धसेवितम् inhabited by siddhas, आश्रमम् hermitage, तत्र there, सिद्धाः siddhas, वैखानसाः vaikhanasas, तापसाः ascetics, वालखिल्याश्च and Valakilyas.
explanation: 'On passing that place, you will come across a hermitage inhabited by siddhas and ascetics, Vaikhanasas and Valakilyas.

shloka_text: वन्द्यास्ते तु तपस्सिद्धास्तपसा वीतकल्मषाः। प्रष्टव्या चापि सीतायाः प्रवृत्तिर्विनयान्वितैः।।4.43.34।।
translation: ते they, तपस्सिद्धाः accomplished ascetics, तपसा with penance, वीतकल्मषाः free of sins, वन्द्यान् those revered sires, विनयान्वितैः politely, सीतायाः about Sita, प्रवृत्ति: information, प्रष्टव्या चापि you should ask.
explanation: 'They deserve  your reverence since they are accomplished ascetics.They are cleansed of sins by their penance.You should be polite when you ask them for information  about Sita.

shloka_text: तत्सरस्समतिक्रम्य नष्टचन्द्रदिवाकरम्। अनक्षत्रगणं व्योम निष्पयोदमनादितम्।।4.43.37।।
translation: तत् that, सरः pond, समतिक्रम्य beyond that, नष्टचन्द्रदिवाकरम् Sun and Moon not seen, अनक्षत्रगणम् no stars, निष्पयोदम्  no clouds  move, अनादितम् no sound heard, व्योम silent.
explanation: 'If you cross that region, you will find no Sun, no Moon, no stars, no cloud, no sound.

shloka_text: गभस्तिभिरिवार्कस्य स तु देशः प्रकाशते। विश्राम्यद्भिस्तपस्सिद्धैर्देवकल्पैः स्वयंप्रभैः।।4.43.38।।
translation: देवकल्पैः  equal to gods, स्वयंप्रभैः selfeffulgent ones, विश्राम्यद्भिः by the living, तपस्सिद्धैः perfected by austerities, सः देशः that place, अर्कस्य Sun's, गभस्तिभिरिव like the Sun rays, प्रकाशते shines.
explanation: 'That (Sunless) land shines like the radiance of the Sungod with the presence of selfeffulgent ascetics who have attained perfection in penance.

shloka_text: तं तु देशमतिक्रम्य शैलोदा नाम निम्नगा। उभयोस्तीरयोस्तस्याः कीचका नाम वेणवः।।4.43.39।। ते नयन्ति परं तीरं सिद्धान्प्रत्यानयन्ति च।
translation: तं तु देशम् that region, अतिक्रम्य on passing, शैलोदानाम called Sailoda, निम्नगा mountainstream, तस्याः its, उभयोः both, तीरयोः on the banks, कीचकाः नाम called Kichakas, वेणवः bamboos, ते you, सिद्धान् ascetics, परं तीरम् to the other bank, नयन्ति going, प्रत्यानयन्ति च and get back.
explanation: 'Passing that region you will reach a mountain stream called Sailoda. On both the banks of the stream are bamboo groves called Kichakas. They waft the siddhas to and from the river. (Kichakas bend forward forming an arch and thus help sages to cross the river.)

shloka_text: उत्तराः कुरवस्तत्र कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः।।4.43.40।। ततः काञ्चनपद्माभिः पद्भिनीभिः कृतोदकाः। नीलवैडूर्यपत्राभिर्नद्यस्तत्र सहस्रशः।।4.43.41।। रक्तोत्पलवनैश्चात्र मण्डिताश्च हिरण्मयैः।
translation: तत्र there, कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः those who did meritorious deeds, उत्तराः कुरवः UttaraKuru country, ततः  there, काञ्चनपद्माभिः  beds of golden lotuses, पद्भिनीभिः with lotus groves, कृतोदकाः brimming with water, नीलवैढूर्यपत्राभिः blue and green leaves, नद्यः rivers, सहस्रशः in thousands, अत्र here, हिरण्मयैः with golden ones, रक्तोत्पलवनैः with red lotuses, मण्डिताः are adorned with.
explanation: 'Thereafter you will reach the country of UttaraKuru, a resort for those who have done meritorious deeds.There are lotus ponds with golden lotuses with bluish and greenish leaves.There are thousands of rivers adorned with red and night lotuses of gold.

shloka_text: उत्तराः कुरवस्तत्र कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः।।4.43.40।। ततः काञ्चनपद्माभिः पद्भिनीभिः कृतोदकाः। नीलवैडूर्यपत्राभिर्नद्यस्तत्र सहस्रशः।।4.43.41।। रक्तोत्पलवनैश्चात्र मण्डिताश्च हिरण्मयैः।
translation: तत्र there, कृतपुण्यप्रतिश्रयाः those who did meritorious deeds, उत्तराः कुरवः UttaraKuru country, ततः  there, काञ्चनपद्माभिः  beds of golden lotuses, पद्भिनीभिः with lotus groves, कृतोदकाः brimming with water, नीलवैढूर्यपत्राभिः blue and green leaves, नद्यः rivers, सहस्रशः in thousands, अत्र here, हिरण्मयैः with golden ones, रक्तोत्पलवनैः with red lotuses, मण्डिताः are adorned with.
explanation: 'Thereafter you will reach the country of UttaraKuru, a resort for those who have done meritorious deeds.There are lotus ponds with golden lotuses with bluish and greenish leaves.There are thousands of rivers adorned with red and night lotuses of gold.

shloka_text: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैर्भान्ति तत्र जलाशयाः।।4.43.42।। महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः। निलोत्पलवनैश्चित्रै स्स देश स्सर्वतो वृतः।।4.43.43।। निस्तुलाभिश्च मुक्ताभिर्मणिभिश्च महाधनैः।
translation: तत्र there, जलाशयाः tanks and lakes, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैः glowing red like the rising Sun,  भान्ति adorned with, सः देशः in that place, सर्वतः all over, महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च with excellent leaves of the colour of precious emeralds, काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः with filaments like golden threads, चित्रैः with wonderful, नीलोत्पलवनैः with clusters of blue lotus groves, निस्तुलाभिः with incomaparable, मुक्ताभिः with pearls, महाधनैः with very valuable, मणिभिश्च with gems also, वृतः covered.
explanation: 'There are tanks and lakes filled with lotuses shining like the rising Sun with lotus leaves having the colour of precious emeralds. The lotus filaments look like golden threads. The entire place is full of blue lotus groves, exquisite pearls and other gems.

shloka_text: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैर्भान्ति तत्र जलाशयाः।।4.43.42।। महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः। निलोत्पलवनैश्चित्रै स्स देश स्सर्वतो वृतः।।4.43.43।। निस्तुलाभिश्च मुक्ताभिर्मणिभिश्च महाधनैः।
translation: तत्र there, जलाशयाः tanks and lakes, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशैः glowing red like the rising Sun,  भान्ति adorned with, सः देशः in that place, सर्वतः all over, महार्हमणिरत्नैश्च with excellent leaves of the colour of precious emeralds, काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः with filaments like golden threads, चित्रैः with wonderful, नीलोत्पलवनैः with clusters of blue lotus groves, निस्तुलाभिः with incomaparable, मुक्ताभिः with pearls, महाधनैः with very valuable, मणिभिश्च with gems also, वृतः covered.
explanation: 'There are tanks and lakes filled with lotuses shining like the rising Sun with lotus leaves having the colour of precious emeralds. The lotus filaments look like golden threads. The entire place is full of blue lotus groves, exquisite pearls and other gems.

shloka_text: उद्भूतपुलिनास्तत्र जातरूपैश्च निम्नगाः। सर्वरत्नमयैश्चित्रैरवगाढा नगोत्तमैः।।4.43.44।। जातरूपमयैश्चापि हुताशनसमप्रभैः।
translation: तत्र there, निम्नगाः rivers, जातरूपैः golden, उद्भूतपुलिनाः sandy banks have appeared, सर्वरत्नमयैः with all kinds of gems, चित्रैः  colourful ones, जातरूपमयैः  golden, हुताशनसमप्रभैः  glowing like fire, नगोत्तमैः  best of mountains, अवगाढाः have entered, अपि and.
explanation: 'There the sandy river banks are rich with all kinds of colourful gems resplendent with the brightness of gold. Gold and gems glowing like fire in the best of mountains have entered these rivers.

shloka_text: नित्यपुष्पफलास्तत्र नगाः पत्त्ररथाकुलाः।।4.43.45।। दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः सर्वान्कामान् स्रवन्ति च। नानाकाराणि वासांसि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.46।।
translation: तत्र there, नगाः trees, नित्यपुष्पफलाः always in bloom and laden with fruits, पत्त्ररथाकुलाः filled with birds, दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः with divine fragrance and feel and touch, सर्वान् all, कामान् desires, स्रवन्ति च emit, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, नानाकाराणि of different kinds, वासांसि clothes, फलन्ति provide.
explanation: 'There the trees are filled with flowers and fruits in all seasons. Birds rest on them.  By their excellent fragrance, taste and smooth feel the fruits and flowers satisfy the desires of all. Some other excellent trees provide barks of various kinds which are used for cloth.

shloka_text: नित्यपुष्पफलास्तत्र नगाः पत्त्ररथाकुलाः।।4.43.45।। दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः सर्वान्कामान् स्रवन्ति च। नानाकाराणि वासांसि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.46।।
translation: तत्र there, नगाः trees, नित्यपुष्पफलाः always in bloom and laden with fruits, पत्त्ररथाकुलाः filled with birds, दिव्यगन्धरसस्पर्शाः with divine fragrance and feel and touch, सर्वान् all, कामान् desires, स्रवन्ति च emit, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, नानाकाराणि of different kinds, वासांसि clothes, फलन्ति provide.
explanation: 'There the trees are filled with flowers and fruits in all seasons. Birds rest on them.  By their excellent fragrance, taste and smooth feel the fruits and flowers satisfy the desires of all. Some other excellent trees provide barks of various kinds which are used for cloth.

shloka_text: मुक्ता वैढूर्यचित्राणि भूषणानि तथैव च। स्त्रीणां चाप्यनुरूपाणि पुरुषाणां तथैव च।।4.43.47।। सर्वर्तुसुख सेव्यानि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः। महार्हाणि विचित्राणि हैमान्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.48।।
translation: अन्ये others, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, अपि also, स्त्रीणाम् for women, तथैव च similarly, पुरुषाणाम् for men, अनुरूपाणि suitable ones, मुक्तावैडूर्यचित्राणि studded with wonderful pearls and vaidurya gems, तथैव च and similarly, सर्वर्तुसुखसेव्यानि which give pleasure in all seasons, भूषणानि ornaments, हैमान् golden, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः trees, महार्हाणि विचित्राणि wonderful and highly valuable ones, फलन्ति yield.
explanation: 'Some other great trees (of the region) provide ornaments suitable for both men and women studded with precious pearls and vaidurya which give pleasure in all seasons.  Other trees put forth beautiful and highly valuable ornaments.

shloka_text: मुक्ता वैढूर्यचित्राणि भूषणानि तथैव च। स्त्रीणां चाप्यनुरूपाणि पुरुषाणां तथैव च।।4.43.47।। सर्वर्तुसुख सेव्यानि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः। महार्हाणि विचित्राणि हैमान्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।।4.43.48।।
translation: अन्ये others, नगोत्तमाः excellent trees, अपि also, स्त्रीणाम् for women, तथैव च similarly, पुरुषाणाम् for men, अनुरूपाणि suitable ones, मुक्तावैडूर्यचित्राणि studded with wonderful pearls and vaidurya gems, तथैव च and similarly, सर्वर्तुसुखसेव्यानि which give pleasure in all seasons, भूषणानि ornaments, हैमान् golden, अन्ये other, नगोत्तमाः trees, महार्हाणि विचित्राणि wonderful and highly valuable ones, फलन्ति yield.
explanation: 'Some other great trees (of the region) provide ornaments suitable for both men and women studded with precious pearls and vaidurya which give pleasure in all seasons.  Other trees put forth beautiful and highly valuable ornaments.

shloka_text: शयनानि प्रसूयन्ते चित्रास्तरणवन्ति च। मनःकान्तानि माल्यानि फलन्त्यत्रापरे द्रुमाः।।4.43.49।।
translation: अत्र here, अपरे others, द्रुमाः trees, चित्रास्तरणवन्ति bed spreads of different colours, शयनानि  beds, प्रसूयन्ते yield, मनःकान्तानि those that are pleasing to the heart, माल्यानि garlands, फलन्ति yield.
explanation: 'The trees of that region deliver beds with colourful spreads. Some trees yield garlands of flowers pleasing to the heart.

shloka_text: पानानि च महार्हाणि भक्ष्याणि विविधानि च। स्त्रियश्च गुणसम्पन्ना रूपयौवनलक्षिताः।।4.43.50।।
translation: महार्हाणि good, पानानि drinks, विविधानि many kinds, भक्ष्याणि च and eatables, गुणसम्पन्नाः virtuous, रूपयौवनलक्षिताः marked by beauty and youth, स्त्रियश्च women also.
explanation: 'Some trees bring forth many  good quality drinks, eatables and also virtuous  women, young and beautiful.

shloka_text: गन्धर्वाः किन्नरास्सिद्धा नागा विद्याधरास्तथा। रमन्ते सततं स्तत्र नारीभिर्भास्करप्रभाः।।4.43.51।।
translation: भास्करप्रभाः radiant like Sun, गन्धर्वाः gandharvas, किंनराः kinneras, सिद्धाः siddhas, नागाः nagas, तथा similarly, विद्याधराः vidyadharas, तत्र there, सततं always, नारीभिः with women, रमन्ते are sporting.
explanation: There gandharvas, kinneras, siddhas, nagas and vidyadharas, radiant like the Sun, are seen sporting with their female companions.

shloka_text: सर्वे सुकृतकर्माण स्सर्वे रतिपरायणाः। सर्वे कामार्थसहिता वसन्ति सहयोषितः।।4.43.52।।
translation: सर्वे all,सुकृतकर्माणः of meritorious deeds , सर्वे all, रतिपरायणाः intent on sensual pleasures, सर्वे all, कामार्थसहिताः for fulfilment of kama and artha, सहयोषितः along with their female companions, वसन्ति live.
explanation: 'By virtue of their meritorious deeds (done in the previous birth) they live a luxurious life of riches and sensual pleasures with their female partners.

shloka_text: गीतवादित्रनिर्घोष स्सोत्कृष्टहसितस्वनः। श्रूयते सततं तत्र सर्वभूतमनोहरः।।4.43.53।।
translation: सोत्कृष्टहसितस्वनः sounds of laughter of celestial beings, सर्वभूतमनोहरः pleasing to all beings, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषः sounds of vocal and instrumental music, तत्र there, सततम् continually, श्रूयते heard.
explanation: 'Pleasing sounds of heavenly musicvocal and instrumental and laughter of celestial beings are ever heard in that region.

shloka_text: तत्र नामुदितः कश्चिन्नास्ति कश्चिदसत्प्रियः। अहन्यहनि वर्धन्ते गुणास्तत्र मनोरमाः।।4.43.54।।
translation: तत्र there, अमुदितः unhappy, कश्चिन् any one, न not, असत्प्रियः who likes bad deeds, कश्चित् any one, न not, नास्ति not there, अहन्यहनि day by day, मनोरमाः delightful, गुणाः virtues, वर्धन्ते increase.
explanation: 'There nobody is unhappy or inclined towards evil deeds and virtues in people go increasing day by day.

shloka_text: समतिक्रम्य तं देशमुत्तरः पयसां निधिः। तत्र सोमगिरिर्नाम मध्ये हेममयो महान्।।4.43.55।।
translation: तं देशम् in that place, अतिक्रम्य after crossing that place, उत्तरः northern, पयसां निधिः sea, तत्र there, मध्ये in the midst, हेममयः golden, महान् great, सोमगिरिर्नाम Somagiri,
explanation: 'Cross it and, you will reach the northern sea. In its midst is the great golden mountain, Somagiri.

shloka_text: इन्द्रलोकगता ये च ब्रह्मलोकगताश्च ये। देवास्तं समवेक्षन्ते गिरिराजं दिवं गताः।।4.43.56।।
translation: ये those, इन्द्रलोकगताः gone to the world of Indra, ये those, ब्रह्मलोकगताश्च gone to Brahma's world, देवाः deities, दिवम् heaven, गताः gone, तम् that, गिरिराजम् king of mountains, समवेक्षन्ते can view.
explanation: 'Only those who have reached the world of Indra and Brahma in heaven can see that  king of mountains.

shloka_text: स तु देशो विसूर्योऽपि तस्य भासा प्रकाशते। सूर्यलक्ष्म्याऽभिविज्ञेयस्तपतेव विवस्वता।।4.43.57।।
translation: सः देशः that place, विसूर्योऽपि though without Sun, सूर्यलक्ष्मयभिऽविज्ञेयः appears as if Sun's radiance, तपता with blazing, विवस्वता इव by the Sun,  इव as if, तस्य his, भासा by light, प्रकाशते shines.
explanation: 'That place gets light and heat even though there is no Sun.

shloka_text: भगवानपि विश्वात्मा शम्भुरेकादशात्मकः। ब्रह्मा वसति देवेशो ब्रह्मर्षिपरिवारितः।।4.43.58।।
translation: भगवानपि even divine being, विश्वात्मा allpervading Visnu, एकादशात्मकः elevenfold, शम्भुः Sambhu, ब्रह्मर्षिपरिवारितः surrounded by divine seers, Brahmarshis, देवेशः lord of gods, ब्रह्मा Brahma, वसति reside.
explanation: 'Even divine beings, the elevenfold Samhbu, the allpervading Visnu and Lord Brahma surrounded by Brahmarshis (divine seers) reside there.

shloka_text: न कथञ्चन गन्तव्यं कुरूणामुत्तरेण वः। अन्येषामपि भूतानां नातिक्रामति वै गतिः।।4.43.59।।
translation: कुरूणामुत्तरेण to the north of Kuru, कथञ्चन however, वः for you, न गन्तव्यम् should not go, अन्येषाम् for other, भूतानाम् अपि other living beings also, गतिः movement, नातिक्रामति transgresses.
explanation: 'You should not go beyond the north of Kuru. No living being can trespass it.

shloka_text: स हि सोमगिरिर्नाम देवानामपि दुर्गमः। तमालोक्य ततः क्षिप्रमुपावर्तितुमर्हथ।।4.43.60।।
translation: सोमगिरिर्नाम Somagiri by name, सः that mountain, देवानामपि even for gods, दुर्गमः inaccessible, तम् them, आलोक्य after seeing, ततः that place, क्षिप्रम् at once, उपावर्तितुम् to return, अर्हथ not proper for you.
explanation: 'It is difficult even for gods to reach Somagiri. You should return immediately after seeing that mountain.

shloka_text: एतावद्वानरैश्शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुङ्गवाः। अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम्।।4.43.61।।
translation: वानरपुङ्गवाः O monkeys, एतावत् until there, वानरैः by monkeys, गन्तुम् to go, शक्यम् possible, अभास्करम् Sunless, अमर्यादं च not visible, ततः परम् beyond that, न जानीमः we do not go.
explanation: 'O monkey leaders it is not possible for monkeys to go beyond. The Sun does not shine beyond that place and it is not visible. We do not know what lies beyond that (Somagiri).

shloka_text: सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं यन्मया परिकीर्तितम्। यदन्यदपि नोक्तं च तत्रापि क्रियतां मतिः।।4.43.62।।
translation: मया by me, यत् whatever, परिकीर्तिम् is mentioned, एतत् all this, सर्वम् every where, विचेतव्यम् explore, अन्यदपि even other places, यत् whatever, नोक्तम् is told, तत्रापि च there also, मतिः mind, क्रियताम् you may apply.
explanation: 'You should keep in mind the places described. You may also think of other places I might have omitted.

shloka_text: ततः कृतं दाशरथेर्महत्प्रियं महत्तरं चापि ततो मम प्रियम्। कृतं भविष्यत्यनिलानलोपमा विदेहजादर्शनजेन कर्मणा।।4.43.63।।
translation: अनिलानलोपमाः comparable to fire, ततः that, विदेहजादर्शनजेन arising out of meeting Vaidehi, कर्मणा by that act, दाशरथेः to Rama, महत् great, प्रियम् pleasure, कृतम् is done, ततः अपि and even great also, मम to me, महत्तरम् greater, प्रियम् pleasure, कृतम् done, भविष्यति you will be.
explanation: 'O heroic monkeys comparable to fire If you are successful in finding Vaidehi you will be carrying out your duty.  Rama will be highly pleased by your action. My pleasure will be even greater.

shloka_text: ततः कृतार्थाः सहितास्सबान्धवाः मयाऽर्चितास्सर्वगुणैर्मनोरमैः। चरिष्यथोर्वीं प्रति शान्तशत्रव स्सहप्रिया भूतधराः प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.43.64।।
translation: भूतधराः supporters of all beings, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, ततः then, कृतार्थाः accomplish your goal, सहिताः along with, सबान्धवाः your relations, मया by me, मनोरमैः  by delightful ones, सर्वगुणैः by all virtues, अर्चिताः honoured, शान्तशत्रवः those who vanquished their enemies, सहप्रियाः with your loved ones, उर्वीम् प्रति towards the earth, चरिष्यथ you will be honoured
explanation: 'O monkeys, when you have accomplished your goal, you will be honoured by me as though you have returned after scoring a victory over the enemy. You will roam this earth with your relatives, rejoicing in the company of your loved ones. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends of fortythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: विशेषेण तु सुग्रीवो हनूमत्यर्थमुक्तवान्। स हि तस्मिन्हरिश्रेष्ठे निश्चितार्थोऽर्थसाधने।।4.44.1।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, विशेषेण particularly, हनूमति in Hanuman, अर्थम् purpose (of the mission), उक्तवान् mentioned, सः he, अर्थसाधने in accomplishing the goal, तस्मिन् हरिश्रेष्ठे great among the monkeys, निश्चितार्थः हि one who was sure of success.
explanation: Sugriva mentioned about the capacity of Hanuman, the best of monkeys as he knew he would surely succeed in accomplishing the task.
comments: Sugriva speaks very highly of Hanuman to Rama -- Rama hands in his ring to Hanuman as a mark of identification.

shloka_text: अब्रवीच्च हनूमन्तं विक्रान्तमनिलात्मजम्। सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतः प्रभु स्सर्ववनौकसाम्।।4.44.2।।
translation: सर्ववनौकसाम् for all the monkeys, प्रभुः king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, परमप्रीतः very pleased, विक्रान्तम् advancing, अनिलात्मजम् son of the Windgod, हनूमन्तम् to Hanumanta, अब्रवीच्च spoke.
explanation: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, spoke, highly pleased, to Hanuman, the warrior son of the Windgod advancing towards him:

shloka_text: न भूमौ नान्तरिक्षे वा नाम्बरे नामरालये। नाप्सु वा गतिसङ्गं ते पश्यामि हरिपुङ्गव।।4.44.3।।
translation: हरिपुङ्गव O best of monkeys, भूमौ on earth, ते to you, गतिसङ्गम् who can equal your movement, न पश्यामि I do not see, अन्तरिक्षे वा or in space, न nor, अम्बरे in sky, न nor, अमरालये in heaven, न nor, अप्सु वा or in water.
explanation: 'O best of monkeys I scarcely see a hero comparable to your speed on earth or in space or sky or heaven or water.

shloka_text: गतिर्वेगश्च तेजश्च लाघवं च महाकपे। पितुस्ते सदृशं वीर मारुतस्य महौजसः।।4.44.5।।
translation: वीर O hero, महाकपे O great monkey, ते your, गतिः in movement, वेगश्च in speed, तेजश्च in brilliance, लाघवं च in movement and speed, पितुः father's, महौजसः mighty, मारुतस्य of the Windgod, सदृशम् similar.
explanation: 'O hero, O great monkey in movement, speed, brilliance and quickness you are similar to your mighty father, the Windgod.

shloka_text: तेजसा वापि ते भूतं न समं भुवि न विद्यते। तद्यथा लभ्यते सीता तत्त्वमेवोपपादय।।4.44.6।।
translation: तेजसा वापि in brilliance, ते to you, समम् equal, भूतम् a being, भुवि in the world, न विद्यते does not exist, तत् therefore, सीता Sita, यथा as such, लभ्यते is secured, तत् that way, त्वमेव you alone, अपपादय should go ahead.
explanation: 'I do not know any living being equal to you in brilliance on this earth. Therefore, you alone know how to secure Sita.Go ahead

shloka_text: त्वय्येव हनुम न्नस्ति बलं बुद्धिः पराक्रमः। देशकालानुवृत्तिश्च नयश्च नयपण्डित।।4.44.7।।
translation: नयपण्डित O learned one, हनुमन् Hanuman, बलम् strength, बुद्धिः wisdom, पराक्रमः prowess, देशकालानुवृत्तिश्च acting in accordance with time and place, नयश्च  knowledge of statecraft, त्वय्येव in you only, अस्ति I exist.
explanation: 'O learned Hanuman I am of opinion that in you alone rest strength, wisdom, prowess, ability to act in accordance with time and place and knowledge of statecraft'.

shloka_text: ततः कार्यसमासङ्गमवगम्य हनूमति। विदित्वा हनुमन्तं च चिन्तयामास राघवः।।4.44.8।।
translation: ततः then, राघवः Rama, हनूमति in Hanuman, कार्यसमासङ्गम् responsibility of achieving the goal, अवगम्य having understood, हनुमन्तं च Hanuman also, विदित्वा knowing, चिन्तयामास reflected.
explanation: Having understood that Hanuman was capable of accomplishing the goal, Rama started reflecting as follows:

shloka_text: सर्वथा निश्चितार्थोऽयं हनूमति हरीश्वरः। निश्चितार्थकरश्चापि हनूमान्कार्यसाधने।।4.44.9।।
translation: अयम् this, हरीश्वरः monkey king, सर्वथा all means, हनूमति Hanumanta, निश्चितार्थः sure, कार्यसाधने in accomplishing the task, हनुमान् Hanuman, निश्चितार्थकरश्चापि sure of accomplishing the task.
explanation: 'This  monkey  king, Sugriva has confidence in Hanuman that he will by all means accomplish the task.'

shloka_text: तदेवं प्रस्थितस्यास्य परिज्ञातस्य कर्मभिः। भर्त्रा परिगृहीतस्य ध्रुवः कार्यफलोदयः।।4.44.10।।
translation: तत् since, एवम् in that way, प्रस्थितस्य of a person who goes forth, कर्मभिः with his tasks, परिज्ञातस्य who is known, भर्त्रा king Sugriva, परिगृहीतस्य favoured, अस्य his, कार्यफलोदयः success in his task, ध्रुवः sure.
explanation: 'The king Sugriva knows for sure that if Hanuman goes forth, success is assured. So he favours him.'

shloka_text: तं समीक्ष्य महातेजा व्यवसायोत्तरं हरिम्। कृतार्थ इव संवृत्तः प्रहृष्टेन्द्रियमानसः।।4.44.11।।
translation: महातेजाः mighty Rama, व्यवसायोत्तरम् with a resolute answer, तम् him, Hanuman, हरिम् monkey, समीक्ष्य on looking at, प्रहृष्टेन्द्रियमानसः very glad at heart, कृतार्थ इव as if he has accomplished, संवृत्तः he became.
explanation: The mighty Rama was happy in his heart to see Hanuman. He felt as if the task is achieved.

shloka_text: ददौ तस्य ततः प्रीतस्स्वनामाङ्कोपशोभितम्। अङ्गुलीयमभिज्ञानं राजपुत्र्याः परन्तपः।।4.44.12।।
translation: ततः then, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, प्रीतः delighted, स्वनामाङ्कोपशोभितम् one on which his name is inscribed, अङ्गुलीयम् ring, राजपुत्र्या: to the princess, अभिज्ञानम् as a token of recognition, तस्य to him, ददौ gave.
explanation: Rama, scorcher of enemies, gladly gave Hanuman a ring inscribed with his name as a mark of identification by princess (Sita). And said:

shloka_text: अनेन त्वां हरिश्रेष्ठ चिह्नेन जनकात्मजा। मत्सकाशादनुप्राप्तमनुद्विग्नाऽनुपश्यति।।4.44.13।।
translation: हरिश्रेष्ठ O distinguished monkey, अनेन by this, चिह्नेन by this signet, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, त्वाम् you, मत्सकाशात् from me, अनुप्राप्तम् have come to her, अनुद्विग्ना without any hesitation, अनुपश्यति will greet you.
explanation: 'O distinguished monkey Janaka's daughter will greet you without any hesitation when you present this signet to her. She will know that you have come from me.

shloka_text: व्यवसायश्च ते वीर सत्त्वयुक्तश्च विक्रमः। सुग्रीवस्य च सन्देशस्सिद्धिं कथयतीव मे।।4.44.14।।
translation: वीर O hero, ते your, व्यवसायः efforts, सत्त्वयुक्तः endowed with prowess, विक्रमश्च courage, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, सन्देशश्च message to you, मे to me, सिद्धिम् achievement, कथयतीव as if telling me.
explanation: 'O great hero your enterprise,  prowess coupled with courage and Sugriva's message to you seem to indicate to me about the success of your mission'.

shloka_text: स तद्गृह्य हरिश्रेष्ठः स्थाप्य मूर्ध्नि कृताञ्जलिः। वन्दित्वा चरणौ चैव प्रस्थितः प्लवगोत्तमः।।4.44.15।।
translation: प्लवगोत्तमः foremost of the monkeys, सः he, हरिश्रेष्ठः greatest of monkeys, गृह्य after taking, मूर्ध्नि on his forehead, स्थाप्य after placing, कृताञ्जलिः saluted with folded palms, चरणौ चैव and the feet also, वन्दित्वा having offered salutation, प्रस्थितः departed.
explanation: The foremost among the monkeys took the ring given to him, placed it on his forehead and saluated it with folded palms. He then prostrated at the feet of Rama and departed.

shloka_text: स तत्प्रकर्षन् हरीणां महद्बलं बभूव वीरः पवनात्मजः कपिः। गताम्बुदे व्योम्नि विशुद्धमण्डलः शशीव नक्षत्रगणोपशोभितः।।4.44.16।।
translation: हरीणाम् of monkeys, महत् great, तत् बलम् that army, प्रकर्षन् being foremost among them, वीरः hero, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः कपिः that monkey, गताम्बुदे cloudless, व्योम्नि in the sky, नक्षत्रगणोपशोभितः adorned by hosts of stars, शशीव like the Moon, बभूव appeared.
explanation: Like the moon adorned by hosts of stars in the cloudless sky, the mighty heroic Hanuman, the great son of the Windgod, shone in the midst of the army of monkeys.

shloka_text: अतिबल बलमाश्रितस्तवाहं हरिवरविक्रम विक्रमैरनल्पैः। पवनसुत यथाऽभिगम्यते सा जनकसुता हनुमं स्तथा कुरुष्व।।4.44.17।।
translation: अतिबल O mighty one, हरिवरविक्रम O valiant among the vanaras, पवनसुत O son of the Windgod, हनुमन् O Hanuman, अहम् I, तव your, बलम् strength, आश्रितः depending, अनल्पैः with mighty, विक्रमैः valour, सा that, जनकसुता daughter of Janaka, यथा in such a way, अभिगम्यते can be found, तथा in such a way that, कुरुष्व do.
explanation: O Hanuman son of the Windgod, O valiant among the Vanaras, I bank on your strength. Do whatever you can with your mighty valour so that the daughter of Janaka can be found. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सर्वांश्चाहूय सुग्रीवः प्लवगान् प्लवगर्षभः। समस्तानब्रवीद्भूयो रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये।।4.45.1।। एवमेतद्विचेतव्यं यन्मया परिकीर्तितम्।
translation: प्लवगर्षभः bull of among monkeys, भूयः further, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सर्वान् all, प्लवगान् vanaras, आहूय  called, रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये for fulfilling the objective of Rama, समस्तान् all of them, अब्रवीत् addressed, मया by me, यत् whatever, परिकीर्तितम् described, एवम् in the same way, एतत् thus, विचेतव्यम् you should search.
explanation: Summoning the entire body of vanaras, Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, said, 'Go to the places I have described and look for  Sita in order to fulfil Rama's objective'.
comments: Sugriva once again addresses all troops -- the vanaras departRama and Lakshmana return to Prasravana mountain

shloka_text: तदुग्रशासनं भर्तुर्विज्ञाय हरिपुङ्गवाः।।4.45.2।। शलभा इव सञ्छाद्य मेदिनीं सम्प्रतस्थिरे।
translation: हरिपुङ्गवाः best of monkeys, भर्तुः king's, तत् that, उग्रशासनम् strict order, विज्ञाय having understood, मेदिनीम् the whole earth, शलभा इव like locusts, सञ्छाद्य covered, सम्प्रतस्थिरे started moving.
explanation: Having understood Sugriva's strict orders, the forces of monkeys started moving. They spread like locusts all over the earth.

shloka_text: रामः प्रस्रवणे तस्मिन्यवसत्सहलक्ष्मणः।।4.45.3।। प्रतीक्षमाणस्तं मासं यस्सीताधिगमे कृतः।
translation: रामः Rama, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, यः such, सीताधिगमे sin tracing the whereabouts of Sita, कृतः was fixed, तं मासम् that month, प्रतीक्षमाणः waiting, तस्मिन् प्रस्रवणे on that Prasravana mountain, न्यवसत् stayed.
explanation: Rama accompanied by Lakshmana stayed back at Prasravana mountain looking forward for the expiry of the month fixed for the monkeys to trace Sita's whereabouts.

shloka_text: उत्तरां तु दिशं रम्यां गिरिराजसमावृताम्।।4.45.4।। प्रतस्थे सहसा वीरो हरिश्शतवलिस्तदा।
translation: तदा then, शतवालिः Satavali, वीरः warrior, हरिः monkey, गिरिराजसमावृताम् surrounded by kings of mountains, रम्याम् lovely, उत्तरां दिशम् northern direction, सहसा at once, प्रतस्थे started their journey.
explanation: Then the monkey warrior Satavali departed for the north, surrounded by kings of mountains.

shloka_text: पूर्वां दिशं प्रतिययौ विनतो हरियूथपः।।4.45.5।। ताराङ्गदादिसहितः प्लवङ्गो  मारुतात्मजः। अगत्याचरितामाशां दक्षिणां हरियूथपः।।4.45.6।।
translation: हरियूथपः leader of monkeys, विनतः Vinata, पूर्वां दिशं प्रति towards the east, ययौ started, हरियूथपः leader of the monkeys, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, प्लवगः monkey, ताराङ्गदादिसहितः along with Tara and Angada, अगस्त्याचरिताम् inhabited by Agastya, दक्षिणाम् आशाम् to the southern quarter.
explanation: Vinata, leader of the monkeys, set out for the eastern direction.The troop leader,  son of the Windgod along with Angada and Tara left for the south inhabited by Agastya.

shloka_text: पूर्वां दिशं प्रतिययौ विनतो हरियूथपः।।4.45.5।। ताराङ्गदादिसहितः प्लवङ्गो  मारुतात्मजः। अगत्याचरितामाशां दक्षिणां हरियूथपः।।4.45.6।।
translation: हरियूथपः leader of monkeys, विनतः Vinata, पूर्वां दिशं प्रति towards the east, ययौ started, हरियूथपः leader of the monkeys, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, प्लवगः monkey, ताराङ्गदादिसहितः along with Tara and Angada, अगस्त्याचरिताम् inhabited by Agastya, दक्षिणाम् आशाम् to the southern quarter.
explanation: Vinata, leader of the monkeys, set out for the eastern direction.The troop leader,  son of the Windgod along with Angada and Tara left for the south inhabited by Agastya.

shloka_text: पश्चिमां तु भृशं घोरां सुषेणः प्लवगेश्वरः। प्रतस्थे हरिशार्दूलो दिशं वरुणपालिताम्।।4.45.7।।
translation: प्लवगेश्वरः chieftain of monkeys, हरिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, सुषेणः Sushena, वरुणपालिताम् ruled by Varuna, दिशम् side, भृशम् quickly, घोराम् fearsome, पश्चिमां दिशम्  western side, प्रतस्थे started.
explanation: 'The chieftain Sushena, tiger among the monkeys, started quickly for the fearsome western direction ruled by Varuna.

shloka_text: ततस्सर्वा दिशो राजा चोदयित्वा यथातथम्। कपिसेनापतीन्मुख्यान्मुमोद सुखितस्सुखम्।।4.45.8।।
translation: ततः then, मुख्यान् of chieftans, राजा king, कपिसेनापतीन् chief of the army of monkeys, यथातथम् properly, सर्वाःदिशः all quarters, चोदयित्वा having sent, सुखितः  relieved, सुखम् मुमोद rejoiced.
explanation: Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys, having sent the leaders to all quarters felt relieved and rejoiced.

shloka_text: एवं सम्बोधितास्सर्वे राज्ञा वानरयूथपाः। स्वां स्वां दिशमभिप्रत्त्य त्वरिता सम्प्रतस्थिरे।।4.45.9।।
translation: राज्ञा by the king, एवम् in that way, सम्बोधिताः having been addressed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः leaders of the monkeys, स्वां स्वाम् in their respective, दिशम् direction, अभिप्रेत्य bound, त्वरिताः quickly, सम्प्रतस्थिरे departed from there.
explanation: Addressed thus  by the king, all the monkeys departed quickly from there for their respective directions with all enthusiasm.

shloka_text: नदन्तश्चोन्नदन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवङ्गमाः। क्ष्वेलन्तो धावमानाश्च विनदन्तो महाबलाः।।4.45.10।।
translation: महाबलाः mighty, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, नदन्तः making noise, उन्नदन्तश्च loudly, गर्जन्तश्च chattering, क्ष्वेलन्तः leaping, विनदन्तः screaming, धावमानाश्च gallopping.
explanation: The powerful monkeys went gallopping and chattering, leaping and screaming.

shloka_text: एवं सम्बोदितास्सर्वे राज्ञा वानरयूथपाः। आनयिष्यामहे सीतां हनिष्यामश्च रावणम्।।4.45.11।।
translation: राज्ञा by the king, एवम् in that way, सम्बोदिता:having addressed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः the leaders of monkeys, सीताम् Sita, आनयिष्यामहे we will get, रावणम् Ravana, हनिष्यामश्च we will kill.
explanation: Thus addressed by the king, the leaders of the monkeys shouted, 'We will kill Ravana and get back Sita'.

shloka_text: अहमेको हनिष्यामि रावणं प्राप्तमाहवे। ततश्चोन्मथ्य सहसा हरिष्ये जनकात्मजाम्।।4.45.12।।
translation: अहम् I am, एकः alone, आहवे in a war, प्राप्तम् faced, रावणम् Ravana, हनिष्यामि I will kill, ततश्च there after, उन्मथ्य after churning, सहसा at once, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, आहरिष्ये I will get.
explanation: 'I shall kill Ravana singlehanded in war and quickly get back Janaka's daughter churning (the enemy army).' (said one)

shloka_text: वेपमानां श्रमेणाद्य भवद्भिः स्थीयतामिति। एक एवाहरिष्यामि पातालादपि जानकीम्।।4.45.13।।
translation: श्रमेण with exhaustion, वेपमानाम् trembling, जानकीम् Sita, पातालादपि even from the nether most world, एक एव I alone, आहरिष्यामि I will get, अद्य now, भवद्भिः you, स्थीयताम् wait, इति thus.
explanation: 'I will alone restore Sita, exhausted and trembling (in fear), even from the nether world. Wait here' (said another leader).

shloka_text: वधिष्याम्यहं वृक्षान् दारयिष्याम्यहं गिरीन्। धरणीं दारयिष्यामि क्षोभयिष्यामि सागरान्।।4.45.14।।
translation: अहम् I, वृक्षान् trees, वधिष्यामि will smash, गिरीन् mountains, दारयिष्यामि I will cleave, धरणीम् earth, दारयिष्यामि break open, सागरान् seas, क्षोभयिष्यामि I will churn.
explanation: 'I will smash trees, shatter mountains, cleave the earth and churn up the seas'. (said a another).

shloka_text: अहं योजनसङ्ख्यायाः प्लविता नात्र संशयः। शतं योजनसङ्ख्यायाश्शतं समधिकं ह्यहम्।।4.45.15।।
translation: अहम् I, योजनसङ्ख्यायाः शतम् cross a hundred yojanas, प्लविता leap, अहम् I, शतयोजनसङ्ख्यायाः cross a distance of hundred yojanas, समधिकम् more, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न no.
explanation: 'I can doubtless cross a distance of a hundred yojanas' said one. Another said,' I can leap a hundred yojanas more'.

shloka_text: गतेषु वानरेन्द्रेषु रामस्सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्। कथं भवान्विजानीते सर्वं वै मण्डलं भुवः।।4.46.1।।
translation: वानरेन्द्रेषु when the monkey chieftains, गतेषु had gone, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अब्रवीत् said, भवान् you, भुवः of the earth, सर्वम् entire, मण्डलम् region, कथम् how, विजानीते do you know
explanation: When the chieftains of the monkeys left, Rama enquired Sugriva, how he had come to know  the regions of the entire earth (which is a mandala. a circular form).
comments: Sugriva narrates the fight between Dundubhi and Vali and explains how he has come to acquire knowledge of geogrphy of all quarters

shloka_text: सुग्रीवस्तु ततो राममुवाच प्रणतात्मवान्। श्रूयतां सर्वमाख्यास्ये विस्तरेण नरर्षभ।।4.46.2।।
translation: ततः then, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रणतात्मवान् offered reverential salutation, रामम् to Rama, उवाच spoke, सर्वम् all, विस्तरेण in detail, आख्यास्ये narrate, नरर्षभ O Rama, श्रूयताम् listen.
explanation: Then offering reverential salutation to Rama, Sugriva said, 'I shall narrate in detail. Listen, O bull among men

shloka_text: यदा तु दुन्दुभिं नाम दानवं महिषाकृतिम्। परिकालयते वाली मलयं प्रति पर्वतम्।।4.46.3।। तदा विवेश महिषो मलयस्य गुहां प्रति। विवेश वाली तत्रापि मलयं तज्जिघांसया।।4.46.4।।
translation: वाली Vali, महिषाकृतिम् in buffalo form, दुन्दुभिं नाम named Dundubhi, दानवम् demon, यदा when, मलयं पर्वतं प्रति till the mount Malaya, प्रतिकालयते wished to kill him, तदा then, महिषः buffalo, मलयस्य Malaya's, गुहां प्रति towards the cave, विवेश entered, वाली Vali, तज्जिघांसया with the intention of killing him, तत्रापि into that, मलयम् Malaya, विवेश entered.
explanation: Vali chased the demon Dundubhi in buffalo form into a cave of mount Malaya in order to kill him.

shloka_text: यदा तु दुन्दुभिं नाम दानवं महिषाकृतिम्। परिकालयते वाली मलयं प्रति पर्वतम्।।4.46.3।। तदा विवेश महिषो मलयस्य गुहां प्रति। विवेश वाली तत्रापि मलयं तज्जिघांसया।।4.46.4।।
translation: वाली Vali, महिषाकृतिम् in buffalo form, दुन्दुभिं नाम named Dundubhi, दानवम् demon, यदा when, मलयं पर्वतं प्रति till the mount Malaya, प्रतिकालयते wished to kill him, तदा then, महिषः buffalo, मलयस्य Malaya's, गुहां प्रति towards the cave, विवेश entered, वाली Vali, तज्जिघांसया with the intention of killing him, तत्रापि into that, मलयम् Malaya, विवेश entered.
explanation: Vali chased the demon Dundubhi in buffalo form into a cave of mount Malaya in order to kill him.

shloka_text: ततोऽहं तत्र निक्षिप्तो गुहाद्वारि विनीतवत्। न च निष्क्रामते वाली तदा संवत्सरे गते4.46.5।।
translation: ततः then, विनीतवत् with due loyalty, अहम् I, तत्र there, गुहाद्वारि निक्षिप्तः I was made to wait at the entrance of the cave, तदा then, संवत्सरे when a year, गते passed, वाली Vali, न निष्क्रामते not returned.
explanation: 'Then I waited at the entrance of the cave with due loyalty. A year passed. Yet Vali did not return.

shloka_text: ततः क्षतजवेगेन आपुपूरे तदा बिलम्। तदहं विस्मितो दृष्ट्वा भ्रातृशोकविषार्दितः।।4.46.6।।
translation: ततः then, बिलम् cave, क्षतजवेगेन with the speed of the gushing blood, आपुपूरे filled with, तदा then, अहम् I, तत् that, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, विस्मितः bewildered, भ्रातुः brother, शोकविषार्दितः suffered intense agony.
explanation: 'There seeing the cave overflowing with the gushing blood, I was bewildered, thinking that my brother might have been killed. I suffered intense agony.

shloka_text: अथाऽहं कृतबुद्धिस्तु सुव्यक्तं निहतो गुरुः। शिला पर्वतसङ्काशा बिलद्वारि मया कृता।।4.46.7।। अशक्नुव न्निष्क्रमितुं महिषो विनशेदिति।
translation: अथ then, गुरुः brother Vali, सुव्यक्तम् it is evident, निहतः killed, अहम् I, कृतबुद्धिः I thought, महिषः buffalo, निष्क्रमितुम् to return, अशक्नुवन् being unable, विनशेदिति should be destroyed, मया by myself, पर्वतसङ्काशा of the mountain size, शिला rock, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of, कृता placed.
explanation: 'Thereafter, convinced that my brother was killed, I placed a mountainsize rock at the entrance of the cave so that Dundubhi will be destroyed, unable to come out of the cave.

shloka_text: ततोऽहमागां किष्किन्धां निराशस्तस्य जीविते।।4.46.8।। राज्यं च सुमहत्प्राप्य तारया रुमया सह। मित्रैश्च सहितस्तत्र वसामि विगतज्वरः।।4.46.9।।
translation: ततः then, अहम् I, तस्य his, जीविते about his life, निराशः lost hope, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, आगाम् I came, सुमहत्  great, राज्यं च kingdom also, रुमया सह with Ruma, तार या with Tara, प्राप्य having got, तत्र there, मित्रैः with friends, सहितः accompanied, विगतज्वरः fearlessly, वसामि I lived.
explanation: 'I lost hope of his life and came back to Kishkinda. Having got the kingdom, and also Ruma and Tara, I was anointed king and ruled it fearlessly with all friends.

shloka_text: ततोऽहमागां किष्किन्धां निराशस्तस्य जीविते।।4.46.8।। राज्यं च सुमहत्प्राप्य तारया रुमया सह। मित्रैश्च सहितस्तत्र वसामि विगतज्वरः।।4.46.9।।
translation: ततः then, अहम् I, तस्य his, जीविते about his life, निराशः lost hope, किष्किन्धाम् to Kishkinda, आगाम् I came, सुमहत्  great, राज्यं च kingdom also, रुमया सह with Ruma, तार या with Tara, प्राप्य having got, तत्र there, मित्रैः with friends, सहितः accompanied, विगतज्वरः fearlessly, वसामि I lived.
explanation: 'I lost hope of his life and came back to Kishkinda. Having got the kingdom, and also Ruma and Tara, I was anointed king and ruled it fearlessly with all friends.

shloka_text: स मां जिघांसुर्दुष्टात्मा वाली प्रव्यथितेन्द्रियः। परिकालयते क्रोधाद्धावन्तं सचिवैस्सह।।4.46.11।।
translation: दुष्टात्मा evilminded, सः वाली that Vali, प्रव्यथितेन्द्रियः having lost control over his senses, सचिवैस्सह along with ministers, धावन्तम् while I was running, माम् me, जिघांसुः to kill, क्रोधात् enraged, परिकालयते ran after me.
explanation: 'The evilminded Vali, having lost his selfcontrol, ran after me in anger, to kill me and my ministers. I kept running.

shloka_text: पूर्वां दिशं ततो गत्वा पश्यामि विविधान् द्रुमान्। पर्वतन्श्च नदी  रम्यास्सरांसि विविधानि च।।4.46.14।।
translation: ततः then, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern quarter, गत्वा after going, विविधान् several, द्रुमान् trees, नदीन् rivers, रम्यान् delighting, पर्वतान् mountains, विविधानि many, सरांसि च lakes also, पश्यामि see (saw).
explanation: 'Then I ran in the eastern direction and saw many trees, lakes, rivers and beautiful mountains.

shloka_text: उदयं तत्र पश्यामि पर्वतं धातुमण्डितम्। क्षीरोदं सागरं चैव नित्यमप्सरसालयम्।।4.46.15।।
translation: तत्र there, धातुमण्डितम् embellished with minerals, उदयं पर्वतम् mountain behind which the Sun rises, नित्यम् always, अप्सरसालयम् frequented by apsaras, क्षीरोदं सागरं चैव the milky ocean also, पश्यामि see (saw).
explanation: 'There I saw, filled with minerals the mountain behind which the Sun rises and the milky ocean frequented by the apsaras.

shloka_text: परिकालयमानस्तु वालिनाऽभिद्रुत स्तदा। पुनरावृत्य सहसा प्रस्थितोऽहं तदा विभो।।4.46.16।।
translation: विभो O king, वालिना by Vali, परिकालयमानः chased away, अहम् I, तदा then, अभिद्रुतः I ran, तदा then, पुनः again, आवृत्य I turned back, सहसा at once, प्रस्थितः I left.
explanation: 'O king chased thus by Vali, I ran and turned back and ran againfast.

shloka_text: पुनरावर्तमानस्तु वालिनाऽभिद्रुतोद्रुतम्। दिशस्तस्यास्ततो भूयः प्रस्थितो दक्षिणां दिशम्। विन्ध्यपादपसङ्कीर्णां चन्दनद्रुमशोभिताम्।।4.46.17।।
translation: पुनः again, आवर्तमानः changing, वलिना by Vali, द्रुतम् fast, अभिद्रुतः chased, ततः then, तस्याः that, दिशः direction, भूयः turned, विन्ध्यपादपसङ्कीर्णाम् filled with the mountains of Vindhya and trees, चन्दनद्रुमशोभिताम् filled with beautiful sandal trees, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern quarter, प्रस्थितः ran.
explanation: 'Then chased by Vali, I changed my present direction from the east towards the southern quarter where Vindhya mountain stood with its, beautiful sandal trees.

shloka_text: द्रुमशैलांस्ततः पश्यन्भूयो दक्षिणतोऽपराम्। पश्चिमां च दिशं प्राप्ता वालिना समभिद्रुतः।।4.46.18।।
translation: द्रुमशैलां trees and mountains, दक्षिणतः from the southern quarter, अपराम् another, पश्यन् while seeing, भूयः again, वालिना by Vali, समभिद्रुतः chased, पश्चिमां दिशम् western quarter, प्राप्ताः I reached.
explanation: 'I was looking at the trees and mountains in the southern direction, I reached the western quarter pursued by Vali.

shloka_text: सम्पश्यन्विविधान्देशानस्तं च गिरिसत्तमम्। प्राप्य चास्तं गिरिश्रेष्ठमुत्तरां सम्प्रधावितः।।4.46.19।।
translation: विविधान् many, देशान् places, गिरिसत्तमम् best of mountains, अस्तं च where the Sun sets, पश्यन् while I was seeing, गिरिश्रेष्ठम् foremost of mountains, अस्तम् where the Sun sets, प्राप्य having  reached, उत्तराम्  northern, सम्प्रधावितः ran.
explanation: 'Looking at the places around, I reached the best of mountains where the Sun sets (I found Vali still chasing me) and ran towards the north.

shloka_text: हिमवन्तं च मेरुं च समुद्रं च तथोत्तरम्। यदा न विन्दं शरणं वालिना समभिद्रुतः।।4.46.20।। तदा मां बुद्धिसम्पन्नो हनूमान्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
translation: हिमवन्तं च Himavanta also, मेरुं च Meru also, तथा so also, उत्तरं समुद्रं च even the northern sea, वालिना by Vali, समभिद्रुतः chased, यदा when, शरणम् protection, न विन्दम् I did not get, तदा then, बुद्धिसम्पन्नः wise, हनूमान् Hanuman, माम् to me, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत्  spoke.
explanation: 'I saw Himavan and mount Meru on the north and the northern sea. Still pursued by Vali, I could not know where to go when wise Hanuman spoke to me these words:

shloka_text: इदानीं मे स्मृतं राजन्यथा वाली हरीश्वरः।।4.46.21।। मतङ्गेन तदा शप्तो ह्यस्मिन्नाश्रममण्डले। प्रविशेद्यदि वै वाली मूर्धाऽस्य शतधा भवेत्।।4.46.22।। तत्र वासस्सुखोऽस्माकं निरुद्विग्नो भविष्यति।
translation: राजन् O king, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली Vali, तदा then, मतङ्गेन by Mathanga, यथा as, शप्तः cursed, मे to me, इदानीम् now, स्मृतम् I remembered, वाली Vali, अस्मिन् in this, आश्रममण्डले hermitage site, प्रविशेद्यदि if he enters, अस्य his, मूर्धा head, शतधा hundred pieces, भवेत् will become, तत्र there, अस्माकम् to us, वासः residence, सुखः happy, निरुद्विग्नः peaceful, भविष्यति will be.
explanation: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore  we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.

shloka_text: इदानीं मे स्मृतं राजन्यथा वाली हरीश्वरः।।4.46.21।। मतङ्गेन तदा शप्तो ह्यस्मिन्नाश्रममण्डले। प्रविशेद्यदि वै वाली मूर्धाऽस्य शतधा भवेत्।।4.46.22।। तत्र वासस्सुखोऽस्माकं निरुद्विग्नो भविष्यति।
translation: राजन् O king, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, वाली Vali, तदा then, मतङ्गेन by Mathanga, यथा as, शप्तः cursed, मे to me, इदानीम् now, स्मृतम् I remembered, वाली Vali, अस्मिन् in this, आश्रममण्डले hermitage site, प्रविशेद्यदि if he enters, अस्य his, मूर्धा head, शतधा hundred pieces, भवेत् will become, तत्र there, अस्माकम् to us, वासः residence, सुखः happy, निरुद्विग्नः peaceful, भविष्यति will be.
explanation: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore  we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.

shloka_text: ततः पर्वतमासाद्य ऋष्यमूकं नृपात्मज।।4.46.23।। न विवेश तदा वाली मतङ्गस्य भयात्तदा।
translation: नृपात्मज  O prince Rama, ततः from that place, ऋष्यमूकं पर्वतम् mountain Rishyamuka, तदा then, आसाद्य having reached, वाली Vali, मतङ्गस्य Matanga's, भयात् out of fear of, तदा then, न विवेश did not enter.
explanation: 'O prince Rama then I reached mount Rishyamuka which Vali did not enter out of fear of the curse of Matanga.

shloka_text: एवं मया तदा राजन्प्रत्यक्षमुपलक्षितम्।।4.46.24।। पृथिवीमण्डलं कृत्स्नं गुहामस्यागतस्ततः।
translation: राजन् king, एवम् in that manner, तदा then, कत्स्नम् पृथिवीमण्डलम् entire earth, प्रत्यक्षम् saw directly, मया by me, उपलक्षितम् is surveyed, गुहाम् this cave, ततः thereafter, आगतः reached, अस्मि I am.
explanation: 'O king that way I surveyed the entire earth directly and returned to this cave and lived here. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षटचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: दर्शनार्थं तु वैदेह्यास्सर्वतः कपियूधपाः। व्यादिष्टाः कपिराजेन यथोक्तं जग्मुरञ्जसा।।4.47.1।।
translation: कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, व्यादिष्टाः commanded, कपियूधपाः leaders of vanara troops, यथोक्तम् as instructed, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, दर्शनार्थम् to look for, अञ्जसा swiftly, सर्वतः all directions, जग्मुः went.
explanation: The leaders of vanara troops went fast in all directions to look for Vaidehi following the instructions of  the king of vanaras.
comments: Return of Satavali, Vinata and Sushena with no news of Sita.

shloka_text: सरांसि सरित काक्षानाकाशं नगराणि च। नदीदुर्गांस्तथा शैलान्विचिन्वन्ति समन्ततः।।4.47.2।।
translation: ते they, सरांसि tanks, सरित: कक्षान् bottom of rivers, आकाशम् sky, नगराणि च and towns, तथा similarly, नदीदुर्गान् forts surrounded by rivers, शैलान् mountains, समन्ततः every where, विचिन्वन्ति looking for.
explanation: They went looking everywhere in the tanks, in the bottom of rivers, in towns, in the sky and similarly in inaccessible rivers, mountains, and forts surrounded by rivers.

shloka_text: सुग्रीवेण समाख्यातास्सर्वे वानरयूथपाः। प्रदेशान्प्रविचिन्वन्ति सशैलवनकाननान्।।4.47.3।।
translation: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, समाख्याताः instructed, सर्वे all, वानरयूथपाः vanara troop leaders, सशैलवनकाननान् including forests and mountains, प्रदेशान्  places, विचिन्वन्ति searched.
explanation: The troop leaders of the monkeys instructed by Sugriva searched in all places including mountains and forests.

shloka_text: विचित्य दिवसं सर्वे सीताधिगमने धृताः। समायान्ति स्म मेदिन्यां निशाकालेषु वानराः।।4.47.4।।
translation: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, सीताधिगमने in search of Sita, धृताः determined, दिवसम् all day, विचित्य after searching, निशाकालेषु during nights also, मेदिन्याम् on the ground, समायान्ति स्म used to meet one another.
explanation: The monkeys used to search for Sita all day determinedly and at night assemble at one place.

shloka_text: सर्वर्तुकमान् देशेषु वानारास्सफलद्रुमान्। आसाद्य रजनीं शय्यां चक्रुस्सर्वेष्वहस्सु ते।।4.47.5।।
translation: ते वानराः those monkeys, सर्वेषु अहस्सु all day, सर्वर्तुकामान् in all seasons, सफलद्रुमान् fruitbearing trees, देशेषु in countries, आसाद्य having reached, रजनीम् in the night, शय्याम् resting place, चक्रुः they made.
explanation: The monkeys would search all day and by night reach for rest the branches of the trees that bear fruits in all seasons.

shloka_text: तदहः प्रथमं कृत्वा मासे प्रश्रवणं गताः। कपिराजेन सङ्गम्य निराशाः कपियूधपाः।।4.47.6।।
translation: तत् अहः that day, प्रथमम् first, कृत्वा having passed off, मासे in the month, कपियूधपाः monkey leaders, निराशाः disappointed, प्रस्रवणम् mountain Prasravana, गताः gone, कपिराजेन by the king of vanaras, सङ्गम्य after meeting.
explanation: The monkey leaders thus spent a month doing what they did daily and returning disappointed, met the monkey king on mount Prasravana.

shloka_text: विचित्य तु दिशं पूर्वां यथोक्तां सचिवैस्सह। अदृष्ट्वा विनतस्सीतामाजगाम महाबलः।।4.47.7।।
translation: महाबलः powerful, विनतः Vinata, सचिवैः सह along with the ministers, यथोक्ताम् as instructed, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern side, विचित्य having searched, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा not able to see, आजगाम returned.
explanation: Having searched for Sita as instructed by  Sugriva, powerful Vinita returned along with the ministers unable to find Sita.

shloka_text: उत्तरां च दिशं सर्वां विचित्य स महाकपिः। आगतस्सह सैन्येन वीरश्शतवलिस्तदा।।4.47.8।।
translation: तदा then, वीरः hero, महाकपिः great monkey, शतबलः Satabala, सैन्येन सह with the army, सर्वाम् all, उत्तरां दिशम् northern direction, विचित्य after searching, आगतः came back.
explanation: Then the great monkey hero Satabali came back from the northern direction along with the army after searching in vain for Sita.

shloka_text: सुषेणः पश्चिमा माशां विचित्य सह वानरैः। समेत्य मासे सम्पूर्णे सुग्रीवमुपचक्रमे।।4.47.9।।
translation: सुषेणः Sushena, वानरैस्सह along with the monkeys, पश्चिमाम् आशाम् western side, विचित्य having searched, मासे in a month, सम्पूर्णे when completed, समेत्य after coming back, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, उपचक्रमे reported.
explanation: Sushena searched for a full month in the western quarter along with the monkeys and returned to report to Sugriva.

shloka_text: तं प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थं समासाद्याभिवाद्य च। आसीनं सह रामेण सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्।।4.47.10।।
translation: रामेण सह along with Rama, आसीनम् seated, प्रस्रवणपृष्ठस्थम् on the Prasravana mountain, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, आसाद्य came near, अभिवाद्य च and offered salutations, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Sushena came to Sugriva, seated with Rama at Prasravana mountain, offered salutations and spoke:

shloka_text: विचिताः पर्वतास्सर्वे वनानि गहनानि च। निम्नगास्सागरान्ताश्च सर्वे जनपदाश्च ये।।4.47.11।।
translation: सर्वे all, पर्वताः mountains, विचिताः are searched, गहनानि inacccessible, वनानि च forests also, निम्नगाः rivers, सागरान्ताश्च in the seas, ये those, जनपदाश्च country side, सर्वे every where.
explanation: 'We searched for her in the mountains, in inaccessible forests, in rivers and seas and also the countryside.

shloka_text: गुहाश्च विचितास्सर्वास्त्वया याः परिकीर्तिताः। विचिताश्च महागुल्मा लताविततसन्तताः।।4.47.12।।
translation: सर्वाः all, त्वया by your, परिकीर्तिताः mentioned, याः those, गुहाः caves, विचिताः searched, लताविततसन्तताः filled with extensive vines, महागुल्माः and huge bushes, विचिताः are searched.
explanation: 'We searched for her in the caves, in places filled with extensive vines and huge bushes and in all places mentioned by you.

shloka_text: गहनेषु च देशेषु दुर्गेषु विषमेषु च। सत्त्वान्यतिप्रमाणानि विचितानि हतानि च।।4.47.13।। ये चैव गहना देशा विचितास्ते पुनः पुनः।
translation: गहनेषु in the interiors, दुर्गेषु inaccessible, विषमेषु च and unevenplaces, देशेषु locations, अतिप्रमाणानि very huge, सत्त्वानि beings, विचितानि searched, हतानि च killed, गहनाः difficult interiors, ये those, देशाः places, ते those, पुनः पुनः again and again, विचिताः searched.
explanation: 'We searched again and again the interior, inaccessible and uneven locations,and killed huge animals. We searched in regions difficult to penetrate.

shloka_text: उदारसत्त्वाभिजनो महात्मा स मैथिलीं द्रक्ष्यति वानरेन्द्रः। दिशं तु यामेव गता तु सीता तामास्थितोवायुसुतो हनूमान्।।4.47.14।।
translation: वानरेन्द्र O king of monkeys, उदारसत्त्वाभिजनः exhalted by strength and birth, सः that, महात्मा  great person, मैथिलीम् Maithili, द्रक्ष्यति will see, सीता sita, याम् एव whichever, दिशम्  direction, गता is taken, ताम् that, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, आस्थितः he has set out.
explanation: 'O king of monkeys we hope, his exhalted highness, the mighty vanara, son of the Windgod, Hanuman has gone in the direction in which Maithili has been carried off. He alone will find Sita and come back.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सह ताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु गत्वा स हनुमान्कपिः। सुग्रीवेण यथोद्दिष्टं तं देशमुपचक्रमे।।4.48.1।।
translation: कपिः monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, गत्वा सा  going, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यथोद्दिष्टम् as instructed, तम् them, देशम् place, उपप्रचक्रमे started.
explanation: Hanuman, the monkey accompanied by Tara and Angada proceeded as instructed by Sugriva in the (South) direction.
comments: Search in Vindhya -- disappointed -- troops sit in despair

shloka_text: स तु दूरमुपागम्य सर्वैस्तै: कपिसत्तमैः। विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च।।4.48.2।। पर्वताग्रान्नदीदुर्गान्सरांसि विपुलान्द्रुमान्। वृक्षषण्डांश्च विविधान्पर्वतान्घनपादपान्।।4.48.3।।
translation: सः that, सर्वैः तैः they all, कपिसत्तमैः with heroic monkeys, दूरम् a distant place, उपागम्य having gone, ततः then, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च impenetrable, विचिनोति searched, पर्वताग्रान् on the peaks of mountains, नदीदुर्गान् inaccessible fortress surrounded by rivers, सरांसि tanks, विपुलान्द्रुमान् huge trees, वृक्षषण्डांश्च collection of trees, विविधान् many, पर्वतान् mountains, घनपादपान् dense trees.
explanation: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.

shloka_text: स तु दूरमुपागम्य सर्वैस्तै: कपिसत्तमैः। विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च।।4.48.2।। पर्वताग्रान्नदीदुर्गान्सरांसि विपुलान्द्रुमान्। वृक्षषण्डांश्च विविधान्पर्वतान्घनपादपान्।।4.48.3।।
translation: सः that, सर्वैः तैः they all, कपिसत्तमैः with heroic monkeys, दूरम् a distant place, उपागम्य having gone, ततः then, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya's, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च impenetrable, विचिनोति searched, पर्वताग्रान् on the peaks of mountains, नदीदुर्गान् inaccessible fortress surrounded by rivers, सरांसि tanks, विपुलान्द्रुमान् huge trees, वृक्षषण्डांश्च collection of trees, विविधान् many, पर्वतान् mountains, घनपादपान् dense trees.
explanation: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.

shloka_text: अन्वेषमाणास्ते सर्वे वानरास्सर्वतो दिशम्। न सीतां ददृशुर्वीरा मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।4.48.4।।
translation: वीराः heroes, ते वानराः the vanaras, सर्वे all, सर्वतो दिशम् all over in that direction, अन्वेषमाणाः  went searching, मैथिलीम् for Maithili, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, न ददृशुः they did not see.
explanation: The heroic monkeys went searching all over the direction for the daughter of Janaka, but in vain.

shloka_text: ते भक्षयन्तो मूलानि फलानि विविधानि च। अन्वेषमाणा दुर्धर्षान्यवसं स्तत्र तत्र ह।।4.48.5।।
translation: दुर्धर्षाः unassailable, ते those, विविधानि many, मूलानि roots, फलान्यपि and also fruits, भक्षयन्तः  eating, अन्वेषमाणाः searching, तत्र तत्र here and there, न्यवसन् dwelt.
explanation: The unassailable monkeys ate roots and fruits and halted here and there at different places searching for Sita.

shloka_text: स तु देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहागहनवान्महान्। निर्जलं निर्जनं शून्यं गहनं रोमहर्षणम्।।4.48.6।।
translation: गुहागहनवान् a location with impenetrable caves, महान् great, सः देशः that place, दुरन्वेषः is difficult to search, निर्जलम्  with no water, निर्जनम् no people, शून्यम् desolate, गहनम्  impassable, रोमहर्षणम् terrific.
explanation: They searched in dense forests, interior locations impassable, desolate and terrific, without water, and people.

shloka_text: त्यक्त्वा तु तं तदा देशं सर्वे वै हरियूथपाः। तादृशान्यप्यरण्यानि विचित्य भृशपीडिताः।।4.48.7।। देशमन्यं दुराधर्षं विविशु श्चाकुतो भयाः।
translation: तादृशानि such of those, अरण्यान्यपि even in the forests, विचित्य having searched, भृशपीडिताः very difficult, सर्वे all, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, ततः then, तं देशम् that place, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, अकुतोभयाः fearless warriors, दुराधर्षम् unassailable, अन्यं देशम् other places, विविशुः entered.
explanation: Having searched all over in the forests and very difficult areas, the fearless, invincible vanaras moved forward, leaving that place and entered another areasearching.

shloka_text: यत्र वन्ध्यफला वृक्षा विपुष्पाः पर्णवर्जिताः।।4.48.8।। निस्तोयास्सरितो यत्र मूलं यत्र सुदुर्लभम्।
translation: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, वन्ध्यफलाः without fruits, विपुष्पाः without flowers, पर्णवर्जिताः without leaves, यत्र where, सरितः rivers, निस्तोयाः without water, यत्र there, मूलम् root, सुदुर्लभम् very difficult to get.
explanation: As they marched forward, they entered a location where there were trees devoid of leaves, flowers and fruits and rivers without water and a place where it was difficult to get roots (for food).

shloka_text: न सन्ति महिषा यत्र न मृगा न च हस्तिनः।।4.48.9।। शार्दूलाः पक्षिणो वापि ये चान्ये वनगोचराः।
translation: यत्र where, महिषाः buffaloes, न सन्ति not found, मृगाः deer, न not, हस्तिनः elephants, शार्दूलाः tigers, पक्षिणो वापि  and even birds, वनगोचराः forest beasts, ये those, अन्ये च and other, न not,
explanation: There were no buffaloes, no deer, no elephants, tigers or even  birds and  other wild animals.

shloka_text: न यत्रवृक्षा नौषध्यो न वल्ल्यो नापि वीरुधः।।4.48.10।। स्निग्धपत्रास्स्थले यत्र पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः। प्रेक्षणीयास्सुगन्धाश्च भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः।।4.48.11।।
