translation: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, न not, ओषध्यः medicinal plants, न not, वल्ल्यः vines, न not, वीरुधः creepers spreading on ground, न not, यत्र where, स्निग्धपत्राः shining leaves, स्थले on the dry ground, पद्मिन्यः lotus creepers, फुल्लपङ्कजाः in full bloom, प्रेक्षणीयाः beautiful to look, सुगन्धाश्च fragrant ones, भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः devoid of bees.
explanation: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.

shloka_text: न यत्रवृक्षा नौषध्यो न वल्ल्यो नापि वीरुधः।।4.48.10।। स्निग्धपत्रास्स्थले यत्र पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः। प्रेक्षणीयास्सुगन्धाश्च भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः।।4.48.11।।
translation: यत्र where, वृक्षाः trees, न not, ओषध्यः medicinal plants, न not, वल्ल्यः vines, न not, वीरुधः creepers spreading on ground, न not, यत्र where, स्निग्धपत्राः shining leaves, स्थले on the dry ground, पद्मिन्यः lotus creepers, फुल्लपङ्कजाः in full bloom, प्रेक्षणीयाः beautiful to look, सुगन्धाश्च fragrant ones, भ्रमरैश्चापिवर्जिताः devoid of bees.
explanation: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.

shloka_text: कण्डुर्नाम महाभागस्सत्यवादी तपोधनः। महर्षिः परमामर्षी नियमैर्दुष्प्रधर्षणः।।4.48.12।।
translation: सत्यवादी truthful, महाभागः an eminent acsetic, तपोधनः rich in penance, परमामर्षी choleric tempered, नियमैः strict follower of austerities, दुष्प्रधर्षणः outrageous, कण्डुर्नाम called Kandu, महर्षिः sage.
explanation: There was a sage called Kandu who was truthful, outrageous and shorttempered. He observed strict austerities and was rich in penance.

shloka_text: तस्य तस्मिन्वने पुत्रो बालष्षोडशवार्षिकः। प्रणष्टो जीवितान्ताय क्रुद्धस्तत्र महामुनिः।।4.48.13।।
translation: तस्मिन् वने in that forest, तस्य his, षोडशवार्षिकः sixteen years old, पुत्रः son, बाल: young boy, तत्र there, जीवितान्ताय  died, प्रणष्टः was lost, महामुनिः great sage, क्रुद्धः enraged.
explanation: The great sage was enraged because he had lost his sixteenyearold son in the forest.

shloka_text: तेन धर्मात्मना शप्तं कृत्स्नं तत्रमहद्वनम्। अशरण्यं दुराधर्षं मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम्।।4.48.14।।
translation: तत्र there, महत् great, कृत्स्नम् entire, वनम् forest, अशरण्यम् barren, दुराधर्षम् unfit to harbour, मृगपक्षिविवर्जितम् without beasts and birds, तेन by him, धर्मात्मना by the righteous sage, शप्तम् cursed.
explanation: Cursed by the great righteous sage the entire forest turned barren, unfit to harbour  living beings and became devoid of even beasts and birds.

shloka_text: तस्य ते काननान्ताश्च गिरीणां कन्दराणि च। प्रभवनि नदीनां च विचिन्वन्ति समाहिताः।।4.48.15।।
translation: ते those, समाहिताः those with concentrated attention, तस्य his, काननान्ताश्च forest regions, गिरीणाम्  in the mountains, कन्दराणि च caves also, नदीनाम् प्रभवानि च sources of rivers also, विचिन्वन्ति searched.
explanation: The monkeys searched in the forest regions, in the mountains, rivers and sources of rivers with concentrated attention.

shloka_text: तत्र चापि महात्मानो नापश्यञ्जनकात्मजाम्। हर्तारं रावणं वापि सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः।।4.48.16।।
translation: महात्मानः great souls, सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः eager to please Sugriva, तत्र चापि and there also, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, हर्तारम् one who has abducted, रावणं वापि Ravana also, नापश्यन् could not see.
explanation: Eager to please Sugriva, the great souls searched  in the forest region. Even there they   could not find Janaka's daughter and also Ravana who had abducted Sita.

shloka_text: ते प्रविश्याऽशु तं भीमं लतागुल्मसमावृतम्। दद्दृशुः क्रूरकर्माणमसुरं सुरनिर्भयम्।।4.48.17।।
translation: ते they, लतागुल्मसमावृतम् covered with creepers and bushes, क्रूरम् dreadful, तम् that, प्रविश्य entering, आशु immediately, क्रूरकर्माणम् one of wicked deeds, सुरनिर्भयम् not even afraid of gods, असुरम् demon, दद्दृशुः they saw.
explanation: (Then) they noticed a place covered with creepers and bushes. As soon as they entered the dreadful forest, they saw a demon of wicked deeds, unafraid even of gods.

shloka_text: तं दृष्ट्वा वानरा घोरं स्थितं शैलमिवापरम्। गाढं परिहितास्सर्वे दृष्ट्वा तान्पर्वतोपममान्।।4.48.18।।
translation: सर्वे all, वानराः monkeys, शैलम् इव like a mountain, स्थितम् stood, घोरम् dreadful, तम् they, अपरम् another, दृष्ट्वा saw, पर्वतोपमम् like a huge mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा saw, गाढम् firmly, परिहिताः stood in attention.
explanation: The monkeys beheld the dreadful demon standing firmly like a huge, incomparable mountain in front of them.

shloka_text: सोऽपि तान्वानरान्सर्वान् नष्टा स्स्थेत्यब्रवीद्बली। अभ्यधावत सङ्कृद्धो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य संहितम्।।4.48.19।।
translation: सोऽपि he also, नष्टाः killed, स्थ you are, इति thus, तान् them, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, संहितम् held, मुष्टिम् the fist, उद्यम्य raising, अभ्यधावत ran towards them.
explanation: Seeing the monkeys, the infuriated demon ran towards them, raising his fist firmly, saying, 'You are all as good as dead, now that I have caught you.'

shloka_text: तमापतन्तं सहसा वालिपुत्रोऽङ्गदस्तदा। रावणोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा तलेनाभिजघान ह।।4.48.20।।
translation: तदा then, वालिपुत्रः Vali's son, अङ्गदः Angada, आपतन्तम् pouncing, तम् them, अयम् this person, रावणः is Ravana, इति thus, ज्ञात्वा on thinking, सहसा at once, तलेन  with his palm, अभिजघान ह slapped him.
explanation: Mistaking him for Ravana, Angada, Vali's son at once pounced on him and slapped him with his palm.

shloka_text: स वालिपुत्राभिहतो वक्त्राच्छोणितमुद्वमन्। असुरोऽभ्यपतद्भूमौ पर्यस्त इव पर्वतः।।4.48.21।।
translation: वालिपुत्राभिहतः struck by the son of Vali, सः असुरः that demon, वक्त्रात् from the mouth, शोणितम् blood, उद्वमन्  vomitting, पर्यस्तः uprooted, पर्वतः इव like a mountain, भूमौ on the ground, अभ्यपतत् overturned.
explanation: Struck by Vali's son, the demon vomitting blood from the mouth, fell down on the ground like a mountain, uprooted.

shloka_text: तेऽपि तस्मिन्निरुच्छवासे वानरा जितकाशिनः। व्यचिन्वन्प्रायशस्तत्र सर्वं तद्गिरिगह्वरम्।।4.48.22।।
translation: तस्मिन् his, निरुच्छवासे  he breathed his last, जितकाशिनः  vanaras who won him, ते they, तत्र there, प्रायशः probably, सर्वम् all over, तत् that, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, व्यचिन्वन्  searched, अपि also.
explanation: He breathed his last, and the monkeys who won went searching almost all over the mountain caves.

shloka_text: विचितं तु ततः कृत्वा सर्वे ते काननं पुनः। अन्यदेवापरं घोरं विविशुर्गिरिगह्वरम्।।4.48.23।।
translation: सर्वे all, ते they, काननं पुनः again in the forest, विचितम् searched, कृत्वा having done, ततः then, अन्यदेव a different, घोरम् dreadful, अपरम् another, गिरिगह्वरम् mountain cave, विविशुः entered.
explanation: Again they searched the forest and  entered another dreadful mountain cave.

shloka_text: अथाङ्गदस्तदा सर्वान्वानरानिदमब्रवीत्। परिश्रान्तो महाप्राज्ञस्समाश्वास्य शनैर्वचः।।4.49.1।।
translation: अथ then, परिश्रान्तः an exhausted person, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, अङ्गदः Angada, तदा then, सर्वान् all, वानरान् the vanaras, समाश्वास्य consoled, शनैः slowly, इदम् these, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Wise Angada, exhausted after the search, collected the monkeys, and consoling them, said slowly:
comments: Angada encourages the troops to search the silver mountain.

shloka_text: वनानि गिरयो नद्यो दुर्गाणि गहनानि च। दर्यो गिरिगुहाश्चैव विचितानि समन्ततः।।4.49.2।। तत्र तत्र सहास्माभिर्जानकी न च दृश्यते। तद्वा रक्षो हृता येन सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।4.49.3।।
translation: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.
explanation: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.

shloka_text: वनानि गिरयो नद्यो दुर्गाणि गहनानि च। दर्यो गिरिगुहाश्चैव विचितानि समन्ततः।।4.49.2।। तत्र तत्र सहास्माभिर्जानकी न च दृश्यते। तद्वा रक्षो हृता येन सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।4.49.3।।
translation: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.
explanation: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.

shloka_text: विहाय तन्द्रीं शोकं च निद्रां चैव समुत्थिताम्। विचिनुध्वं यथा सीतां पश्यामो जनकात्मजाम्।।4.49.5।।
translation: समुत्थिताम् overpowering us, तन्द्रीं laziness, शोकं च and sorrow, निद्रां चैव even sleep, विहाय after giving up, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, पश्यामः we will see, यथा so also, विचिनुध्वम् you may search.
explanation: 'You should keep searching on till we see Sita, Janaka's daughter, giving up laziness and sorrow and sleep that is overpowering us.

shloka_text: अनिर्वेदं च दाक्ष्यं च मनसश्चापराजयः। कार्यसिद्धिकराण्याहुस्तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीम्यहम्।।4.49.6।।
translation: अनिर्वेदम् zeal, दाक्ष्यं च capability and, मनसः mind's, अपराजयं च robust optimism, कार्यसिद्धिकराणि conducive  to success, आहुः is said, तस्मात् therefore, अहम् I am, एतत् all this, ब्रवीमि I am telling you.
explanation: 'It is said, zeal, capability, and fortitude can overcome defeat and lead to success. Therefore I am saying this.

shloka_text: अद्यापि तद्वनं दुर्गं विचिन्वन्तु वनौकसः। खेदं त्यक्त्वा पुनस्सर्वैर्वनमेतद्विचीयताम्।।4.49.7।।
translation: अद्यापि even now, वनौकसः you forestdwellers, दुर्गम् difficult to enter, तत् वनम् that forest, विचिन्वन्तु search, सर्वैः by all, खेदम् grief, त्यक्ता giving up, पुनः again, वनमेव forest itself, विचीयताम् search.
explanation: 'Search this impenetrable forest even now, O you denizens of this forest Give up grief, let us all once again ransack this forest.

shloka_text: सुग्रीवः कोपनो राजा तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च वानरः। भेतव्यं तस्य सततं रामस्य च महात्मनः।।4.49.9।।
translation: वानरः monkey, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, कोपनः an angry one, तीक्ष्णदण्डश्च severe punishment, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great self, रामस्य च of Rama also, सततम् ever, भेतव्यम् we have to fear.
explanation: 'Sugriva, the monkey king, is wrathful and awards severe punishment. We should ever bear in mind the (purpose of the) great self, Rama.

shloka_text: हितार्थमेतदुक्तं वः क्रियतां यदि रोचते। उच्यतां वा क्षमं यन्नस्सर्वेषामेव वानराः।।4.49.10।।
translation: वानराः O monkeys, वः हितार्थम् for your benefit, एतत् all this, उक्तम् said, रोचते यदि if it pleases you, क्रियताम् it may be done, यत् whatever, सर्वेषामेव for all of you, क्षमम् right, नः for us, उच्यताम् you may tell.
explanation: 'I have said all this for your good. You may carry it out, if it pleases you. Speak freely if there is any other course left for all of us, O monkeys'

shloka_text: अङ्गदस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा वचनं गन्धमादनः। उवाचाव्यक्तया वाचा पिपासाश्रमखिन्नया।।4.49.11।।
translation: अङ्गदस्य Angada's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, पिपासाश्रमखिन्नया worn out by thirst and exhaustion, अव्यक्तया feebly, वाचा with language, वचनम् these words, उवाच expressed.
explanation: Having heard Angada, Gandhamadana worn out by thirst and exhaustion, replied in a feeble tone:

shloka_text: सदृशं खलु वो वाक्यमङ्गदो यदुवाच ह। हितं चैवानुकूलं च क्रियतामस्य भाषितम्।।4.49.12।।
translation: अङ्गदः Angada, यत् वाक्यम् those words, उवाच ह expressed, वः for us, सदृशं खलु appropriate too, हितं चैव good also, अनुकूलं च even favourable, अस्य his, भाषितम्  utterance, क्रियताम् carry out.
explanation: 'What Angada says is appropriate, beneficial and also favourable. Carry out his command.

shloka_text: पुनर्मार्गामहै शैलान्कन्दरांश्च दरीस्तथा। काननानि च शून्यानि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।।4.49.13।।
translation: पुनः once again, शैलान् mountains, कन्दरांश्च valleys also, तथा similarly, दरीः caverns, शून्यानि desolate places, काननानि च and forests, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च mountain streams, मार्गामहै we will explore again.
explanation: 'Once again let us explore the mountains, caverns, forests, desolate places and mountain streams.

shloka_text: ततस्समुत्थाय पुनर्वानरास्ते महाबलाः। विन्ध्यकाननसङ्कीर्णां विचेरुर्दक्षिणां दिशम्।।4.49.15।।
translation: ततः then, महाबलाः mighty, ते वानराः those monkeys, पुनः again, समुत्थाय after getting up, विन्ध्यकाननसङ्कीर्णाम् filled with forests surrounding the ranges of Vindhya, दक्षिणां दिशम् in the southern side, विचेरुः started exploring.
explanation: Once again the  monkeys rose up and started exploring the mountain ranges of Vindhya and the forests surrounding the southern side.

shloka_text: ते शारदाभ्रप्रतिमं श्रीमद्रजतपर्वतम्। शृङ्गवन्तं दरीमन्तमधिरुह्य च वानराः।।4.49.16।। तत्र लोध्रवनं रम्यं सप्तपर्णवनानि च। व्यचिन्वंस्ते हरिवरास्सीता दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।4.49.17।।
translation: सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: eager to see Sita, हरिवराः best of monkeys, ते वानराः those monkeys, शारदाभ्रप्रतिमम् resembling the autumn clouds, श्रीमत् rich, शृङ्गवन्तम् endowed with peaks, दरीमन्तम् with caverns, रजतपर्वतम् silver mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, तत्र there, रम्यम् enchanting, लोध्रवनम् Lodhra grove, सप्तपर्णवनानि च and gardens of seven leaves, व्यचिन्वंस्ते they looked out.
explanation: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).

shloka_text: ते शारदाभ्रप्रतिमं श्रीमद्रजतपर्वतम्। शृङ्गवन्तं दरीमन्तमधिरुह्य च वानराः।।4.49.16।। तत्र लोध्रवनं रम्यं सप्तपर्णवनानि च। व्यचिन्वंस्ते हरिवरास्सीता दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।4.49.17।।
translation: सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिण: eager to see Sita, हरिवराः best of monkeys, ते वानराः those monkeys, शारदाभ्रप्रतिमम् resembling the autumn clouds, श्रीमत् rich, शृङ्गवन्तम् endowed with peaks, दरीमन्तम् with caverns, रजतपर्वतम् silver mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, तत्र there, रम्यम् enchanting, लोध्रवनम् Lodhra grove, सप्तपर्णवनानि च and gardens of seven leaves, व्यचिन्वंस्ते they looked out.
explanation: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).

shloka_text: तस्याग्रमधिरूढास्ते श्रान्ता विपुलविक्रमाः। न पश्यन्ति स्म वैदेहीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम्।।4.49.18।।
translation: तस्य its, अग्रम् peak, अधिरूढाः they climbed, विपुलविक्रमाः very brave ones, ते they, श्रान्ताः   exhausted, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियां महिषीम् dear queen, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न पश्यन्ति स्म  did not find.
explanation: Even after scaling up the peak, the exhausted, heroic monkeys could not find Vaidehi, the dear queen of Rama.

shloka_text: ते तु दृष्टिगतं कृत्वा तं शैलं बहुकन्दरम्। अवारोहन्त हरयो वीक्षमाणास्समन्ततः।।4.49.19।।
translation: ते हरयः those monkeys, दृष्टिगतम् having seen all over, बहुकन्दरम् having many caves, तं शैलम् that mountain, कृत्वा after doing so, समन्ततः everywhere, वीक्षमाणाः while looking at, अवारोहन्त descended.
explanation: Having looked all over the mountain and many caverns, those monkeys got down from the mountain.

shloka_text: अवरुह्य ततो भूमिं श्रान्ता विगतचेतसः। स्थित्वा मुहूर्तं तत्राथ वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रिताः।।4.49.20।।
translation: ततः then, भूमिम् ground, अवरुह्य descending down, श्रान्ताः tired, विगतचेतसः dejected at heart, तत्र there, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, स्थित्वा having stood, अथ and then, वृक्षमूलम् under a tree, उपाश्रिताः lay down.
explanation: Descending to the foothills, the exhausted monkeys became quiet. Fatigued and disheartened, they assembled under a tree, stood for a moment and then lay down.

shloka_text: ते मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्ताः किञ्चिद्भग्नपरिश्रमाः। पुनरेवोद्यताः कृत्स्नां मार्गितुं दक्षिणां दिशम्।।4.49.21।।
translation: ते they, मुहूर्तम् for a while, समाश्वस्ताः took rest, किञ्चित् a little, भग्नपरिश्रमाः frustrated, पुनरेव once again, कृत्स्नाम् entire, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, मार्गितुम् to search, उद्यताः decided.
explanation: Resting for a while, the frustrated monkeys resumed their search throughout the southern direction.

shloka_text: हनुमत्प्रमुखास्ते तु प्रस्थिताः प्लवगर्षभाः। विन्ध्यमेवादितस्तावद्विचेरुस्ते समन्ततः।।4.49.22।।
translation: हनुमत्प्रमुखाः Hanuman being the prominent one of the group, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among the vanaras, प्रस्थिताः started search, आदितः from the beginning, तावत् all over, विन्ध्यमेव  Vindhya range itself, समन्ततः everywhere, विचेरुः roamed.
explanation: The bulls among vanaras and Hanuman, the chief of the group again started exploring  everywhere in the Vindhya range starting from the beginning. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सह ताराङ्गदाभ्यां तु सङ्गम्य हनुमान्कपिः। विचिनोति स्म विन्ध्यस्य गुहाश्च गहनानि च।।4.50.1।।
translation: कपिः Monkey, हनुमान् Hanuman, ताराङ्गदाभ्यां सह along with Tara and Angada, सङ्गम्य together with, विन्ध्यस्य Vindhya, गुहाश्च caves, गहनानि च and impenetrable places, विचिनोति स्म searched for.
explanation: Hanuman, together with the monkeys, Tara and Angada, searched in the impenetrable places and caves of Vindhya.
comments: Rikshabila cave -- meeting with Svayamprabha.

shloka_text: सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टेषु शिलाश्च सरितस्तदा। विषमेषु नगेन्द्रस्य महाप्रस्रवणेषु च।।4.50.2।।
translation: तदा then, सरितः rivers, सिंहशार्दूलजुष्टेषु inhabited by lions and tigers, शिलाश्च rocks, नगेन्द्रस्य vast mountain, विषमेषु in difficult spots, महाप्रस्रवणेषु च near mountain streams also.
explanation: They also searched near rivers, mountain streams, hill ranges, caves of lions and tigers, in the rock shelters and difficult spots of vast mountains.

shloka_text: आसेदुस्तस्य शैलस्य कोटिं दक्ष्णिपश्चिमाम्। तेषां तत्रैव वसतां स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत।।4.50.3।।
translation: तस्य शैलस्य that mountain's, दक्ष्णिपश्चिमाम् southwest side, कोटिम् end of, आसेदुः reached, तेषाम् for them, तत्रैव while being there, वसताम् while they stayed, सः कालः that time, व्यत्यवर्तत slipped.
explanation: They reached the end of the southwest side of the mountain(Vindhya). While they were still there, the time stipulated for them (to find Sita) had slipped.

shloka_text: स हि देशो दुरन्वेषो गुहागहनवान्महान्। तत्र वायुसुतस्सर्वं विचिनोति स्म पर्वतम्।।4.50.4।।
translation: गुहागहनवान् a difficult mountain range, caves and woods, महान् great, सः देशः that place, दुरन्वेषः difficult to search in, वायुसुतः son of the Windgod, तत्र there, सर्वम् all, पर्वतम् mountains, विचिनोति स्म had searched.
explanation: The son of the Windgod, Hanuman, searched all over the mountains and caves and woods difficult to access in that southwestern region of the mountain.

shloka_text: परस्परेण हनुमा नन्योन्यस्याविदूरतः। गजो गवाक्षो गवयश्शरभो गन्धमादनः।।4.50.5।। मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव सुषेणो जाम्बवान्नल:। अङ्गदो युवराजश्च तारश्च वनगोचरः।।4.50.6।। गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम्। विचिन्वन्तस्ततस्तत्र ददृशुर्विवृतं बिलम्।।4.50.7।। दुर्गमृक्षबिलं नाम दानवेनाभिरक्षितम्।
translation: गजः Gaja, गवाक्षः Gavaksha, गवयः Gavaya, शरभः Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, मैन्दश्च Mainda, द्विविदश्चैव Dvivida also, सुषेणः Sushena, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, युवराजः heir apparent, अङ्गदश्च Angada too, वनगोचरः forest dweller, तारश्च and Tara too, परस्परेण  close to one another, हनूमान् Hanuman, अन्योन्यस्य  one with the other, अविदूरतः not far away from one, गिरिजालावृतान् surrounded by a network of mountains, देशान्  locations, मार्गित्वा having searched, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern direction, ततः then, विचिन्वन्तः while exploring, तत्र there, दानवेन by a demon, अभिरक्षितम् guarded by, दुर्गम् large, ऋक्षबिलं नाम called Rikshabilam, विवृतम् open, बिलम् mouth of the cave, ददृशुः they saw.
explanation: Having explored the region surrounded by a network of mountains, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda and also Dvivida, Sushena, Jambavan, Angada the heir apparent, Tara the forestdweller staying close to one another and Hanuman too not far from the others searched in the southern direction. While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.

While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.

While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.

shloka_text: क्षुत्पिपासापरीताश्च श्रान्ताश्च सलिलार्थिनः।।4.50.8।। अवकीर्णं लतावृक्षैर्ददृशुस्ते महाबिलम्।
translation: क्षुत्पिपासापरीताः overcome by hunger and thirst, श्रान्ताः tired out, सलिलार्थिनः (desperately) looking for water, ते they, लतावृक्षैः with creepers and bushes, अवकीर्णम् spread with creepers and trees, महाबिलम् huge cave, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: Overcome with hunger and thirst, the exhausted monkeys noticed a huge cave covered with creepers and bushes, while they were looking around for water.

shloka_text: तत्र क्रौञ्चाश्च हंसाश्च सारसाश्च विनिष्क्रमन्।।4.50.9।। जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च रक्ताङ्गा: पद्मरेणुभिः।
translation: तत्र there, क्रौञ्चाश्च kraunchas, हंसाश्च swans, सारसाश्च geese, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, पद्मरेणुभिः covered by the pollen of lotuses, रक्ताङ्गाः wings red in colour, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas, विनिष्क्रमन् flying out of it.
explanation: Just then, the kraunchas, swans, geese and chakravaka drenched in water with their limbs reddened with the pollen of lotuses were fluttering out (of the cave).

shloka_text: ततस्तद्बिलमासाद्य सुगन्धि दुरतिक्रमम्।।4.50.10।। विस्मयव्यग्रमनसो बभूवुर्वानरर्षभाः।
translation: ततः then, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys, सुगन्धि fragrant, दुरतिक्रमम् difficult to enter, तत् that, बिलम् cave, आसाद्य  reached, विस्मयव्यग्रमनसः bewildered, बभूवुः became.
explanation: The bulls among the monkeys were bewildered when they reached the cave which was difficult to access.

shloka_text: संञ्जातपरिशङ्कास्ते तद्बिलं प्लवगोत्तमाः।।4.50.11।। अभ्यपद्यन्त संहृष्टास्तेजोवन्तो महाबलाः।
translation: तेजोवन्तः brilliant, महाबलाः forces, ते those, प्लवगोत्तमाः best of the monkeys, सञ्जातपरिशङ्काः afraid, संहृष्टाः they felt happy, तत् बिलम् that cave, अभ्यपद्यन्त that was difficult to enter.
explanation: The brilliant host of monkeys experienced both fear and joy to see the cave difficult to enter.

shloka_text: नानासत्त्वसमाकीर्णं दैत्येन्द्रनिलयोपमम्।।4.50.12।। दुर्दर्शमतिघोरं च दुर्विगाहं च सर्वशः।
translation: नानासत्त्वसमाकीर्णम् crowded with different kinds of creatures, दैत्येन्द्रनिलयोपमम् looked like the abode of king of the demons, दुर्दर्शम् fearful to look at, अति घोरम् highly dreadful, सर्वशः all over, दुर्विगाह्यं च and inaccessible.
explanation: The cave was crowded with creatures of different kinds. It looked like the abode of the king of demons difficult (to enter), dreadful and impenetrable.

shloka_text: तत: पर्वतकूटाभो हनूमान्पवनात्मजः।।4.50.13।। अब्रवीद्वानरान्सर्वान्कान्तारवनकोविदः।
translation: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभः a being as huge as a mountain, कान्तारवनकोविदः knowledgeable of dense forests, पवनात्मजः son of the windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkeys, अब्रवीत् said:
explanation: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod who appeared like a huge mountain and knew about forests spoke to the fellowmonkeys:

shloka_text: गिरिजालावृतान्देशान्मार्गित्वा दक्षिणां दिशम्।।4.50.14।। वयं सर्वे परिश्रान्ता न च पश्याम मैथिलीम्।
translation: वयम् we, सर्वे all, गिरिजालावृतान् having covered all the mountain ranges, देशान् places, मार्गित्वा having searched, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted, मैथिलीम् Maithili, न च पश्याम not see.
explanation: 'Going round the places covering all mountain ranges in the southern direction, we are spent. But we could not see Maithili.

shloka_text: अस्माच्चापि बिलाद्धंसाः क्रौञ्चाश्च सह सारसैः।।4.50.15।। जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च निष्पतन्ति स्म सर्वशः। नूनं सलिलवानत्र कूपो वा यदि वा ह्रदः।।4.50.16।। तथा चेमे बिलद्वारि स्निग्धास्तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः।
translation: अस्मात् from this, बिलात् cave, हंसाः swans, सारसैः सह with sarasas, क्रौञ्चाश्च and kraunchas, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas also, सर्वशः all over, निष्पतन्ति स्म emerging, अत्र here, सलिलवान्  abundant water, कूपो वा well or, यदि वा so also, ह्रदः a pond, नूनम् surely, तथा like that, इमे these, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, पादपाः trees, स्निग्धाः shining, तिष्ठन्ति are present.
explanation: 'From this cave have emerged several birds like sarasas, swans, kraunchas and chakravakas drenched in water. Surely there must be a source of plenty of water or well or a pond. Moreover there are shining( green) trees at the entrance of the cave (suggesting subsoil water).'

shloka_text: अस्माच्चापि बिलाद्धंसाः क्रौञ्चाश्च सह सारसैः।।4.50.15।। जलार्द्राश्चक्रवाकाश्च निष्पतन्ति स्म सर्वशः। नूनं सलिलवानत्र कूपो वा यदि वा ह्रदः।।4.50.16।। तथा चेमे बिलद्वारि स्निग्धास्तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः।
translation: अस्मात् from this, बिलात् cave, हंसाः swans, सारसैः सह with sarasas, क्रौञ्चाश्च and kraunchas, जलार्द्राः drenched in water, चक्रवाकाश्च chakravakas also, सर्वशः all over, निष्पतन्ति स्म emerging, अत्र here, सलिलवान्  abundant water, कूपो वा well or, यदि वा so also, ह्रदः a pond, नूनम् surely, तथा like that, इमे these, बिलद्वारि at the entrance of the cave, पादपाः trees, स्निग्धाः shining, तिष्ठन्ति are present.
explanation: 'From this cave have emerged several birds like sarasas, swans, kraunchas and chakravakas drenched in water. Surely there must be a source of plenty of water or well or a pond. Moreover there are shining( green) trees at the entrance of the cave (suggesting subsoil water).'

shloka_text: इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं सर्वे विविशुस्तिमिरावृतम्।।4.50.17।। अचन्द्रसूर्यं हरयो ददृशू रोमहर्षणम्।
translation: इति thus, उक्त्वा having been told, सर्वे all, तिमिरावृतम् filled with darkness, तत् बिलम् that cave, विविशुः  entered, हरयः monkeys, अचन्द्रसूर्यम् where there is no Moon or Sun light, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: On hearing him, the monkeys entered the cave full of darkness. There was no light of the Moon or the Sun. It was a horripilating experience.

shloka_text: निशाम्य तस्मात् शिंहांश्च तांस्तांश्च मृगपक्ष्णिः।।4.50.18।। प्रविष्टा हरिशार्दूला बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्।
translation: हरिशार्दूलाः tigers among monkeys, तस्मात् from, सिंहांश्च lions, तांस्तान् various types of, मृगपक्ष्णिः beasts and birds, निशाम्य after hearing their sounds, तिमिरसंवृतम् full of darkness, बिलम् cave, प्रविष्टाः entered.
explanation: The tigers among the monkeys entered the dark cave reverberating with the sounds of lions, beasts and birds.

shloka_text: न तेषां सज्जते चक्षुर्न तेजो न पराक्रमः।।4.50.19।। वायोरिव गतिस्तेषां दृष्टिस्तमसि वर्तते।
translation: तेषाम् their, चक्षु: eyes, न not, सज्जते was uninterrupted, तेजः brilliance, न not, पराक्रमः valour, न not, तेषाम् their, गतिः way, वायोरिव like the wind, दृष्टिः sight, तमसि in darkness, वर्तते moved
explanation: The monkeys could not fix their eyes anywhere.Their lustre or valour could not help them. They moved like wind uninterrupted and their vision was lost in darkness.

shloka_text: ते प्रविष्टास्तु वेगेन तद्बिलं कपिकुञ्जराः।।4.50.20।। प्रकाशमभिरामं च ददृशुर्देशमुत्तमम्।
translation: तत् बिलम् that cave, वेगेन quickly, प्रविष्टाः they entered, ते कपिकुञ्जराः those elephantlike monkeys, प्रकाशं च bright light, अभिरामं च delighting, उत्तमम् excellent, देशम् place, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: As the elephantlike monkeys entered the cave quickly, they saw bright light and an excellent delightful place.

shloka_text: ततस्तस्मिन्बिले दुर्गे नानापादपसङ्कुले।।4.50.21।। अन्योन्यं सम्परिष्वज्य जग्मुर्योजनमन्तरम्।
translation: ततः then, अन्योन्यम् one another, सम्परिष्वज्य after holding on, दुर्गे in the dense, नानापादपसङ्कुले in a place filled with several kinds of trees, तस्मिन् बिले in that cave, योजनम् yojana, अन्तरम् inside, जग्मुः went.
explanation: Holding one another's hands, they went in for a distance of one  yojana inside the cave that was densely covered with several kinds of trees.

shloka_text: ते नष्टसंज्ञास्तृषितास्सम्भ्रान्तास्सलिलार्थिनः।।4.50.22।। परिपेतुर्बिले तस्मिन्कञ्चित्कालमतन्द्रिताः।
translation: नष्टसंज्ञाः they nearly lost consciousness, तृषिताः thirsty ones, सम्भ्रान्ताः bewildered ones, सलिलार्थिनः they were desperate for water, ते they, अतन्द्रिताः without feeling lazy, तस्मिन् in that, बिले in the cave, कञ्चित्कालम् for a while, परिपेतुः wandered.
explanation: Having nearly lost their senses (without water to drink), the thirsty and bewildered monkeys were desperate for water.They wandered in the cave without feeling lazy for some time.

shloka_text: ते कृशा दीनवदनाः परिश्रान्ताः प्लवङ्गमाः।।4.50.23।। आलोकं ददृशुर्वीरा निराशा जीविते यदा।
translation: कृशाः weakened, दीनवदनाः having dejected faces, परिश्रान्ताः exhausted ones, ते they, वीराः heroes, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, यदा when, जीविते in life, निराशाः desperate, आलोकम् light, ददृशुः beheld.
explanation: Exhausted and enfeebled, they saw with dejected faces a gleam of light at a time when they were desparate.

shloka_text: ततस्तं देशमागम्य सौम्या वितिमिरं वनम्।।4.50.24।। ददृशुः काञ्चनान्वृक्षान्दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभान्। सालां स्तालांश्च पुन्नागान्ककुभान्वञ्जुलान्धवान्।।4.50.25।। चम्पकान् नागवृक्षांश्च कर्णिकारांश्च पुष्पितान्। स्तबकैः काञ्चनैश्चित्रै रक्तै: किसलयैस्तथा।।4.50.26।। आपीडैश्च लताभिश्च हेमाभरणभूषितान्। तरुणादित्यसङ्काशान्वैढूर्यकृतवेदिकान्।।4.50.27।। विभ्राजमानान्वपुषा पादपांश्च हिरण्मयान्। नीलवैढूर्यवर्णाश्च पद्मिनीः पतगावृताः।।4.50.28।। महद्भि: काञ्चनैः पद्मैर्वृता बालार्कसन्निभैः।
translation: सौम्याः gentle ones, ततः then, तं देशम् place, आगम्य having reached, वितिमिरम् devoid of darkness, वनम् forest, दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभाम् light of burning fire, काञ्चनान् golden, वृक्षान् trees, सालान् salas, तालान् talas, तमालांश्च tamalas, पुन्नागान् punnagas, वञ्जुलान् vanjjulas, धवान् dhavas, चम्पकान् champakas, नागवृक्षांश्च naga trees, पुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारांश्च Karnikas also, काञ्चनैः golden, चित्रैः  wonderful, स्तबकैः  bunches, तथा so also, रक्तै: red ones, किसलयैः tender leaves, आपीडैः entwining, लताभिश्च with creepers, हेमाभरणभूषितान् adorned with golden ornaments, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशान् looking like effulgent rising Sun, वैदूर्यमयवेदिकान् raised structures encrusted with precious stones of Vaiduryas, वपुषा with their appearance, विभ्राजमानान् dazzling, हिरण्मयान् full of gold, पादपांश्च and trees, नीलवैदूर्यवर्णाः of the colours of sapphires and vaiduryas, पतगैः with birds, वृताः filled, बालार्कसन्निभैः by those looking like the rising Sun, काञ्चनैः with golden, महद्भि: by enchanting ones, पद्मैः lotuses, वृताः surrounded, पद्मिनीः lotus ponds, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: Having reached inside the cave the monkeys saw a forest shining like blazing fire, dispelling the surrounding darkness. There they noticed sala, tala, tamala, punnaga, vanjjula, dhava, champaka, and naga trees. They also saw blossoming plants of Karnikara, bunches of beautiful golden flowers and tender redcoloured leaves.They saw wonderful trees with creepers on top entwining them, and ornamented with gold  (like golden fruits), radiant like the dazzling rising Sun. There were altars encrusted with precious sapphire and vaidurya. The golden trees were shining bright. There were lotus creepers looking like sapphire and vaidurya.The ponds were filled with golden lotuses and were surrounded by birds.

translation: सः that, जातरूपमयैः with those golden ones, मत्स्यैः with fish, महद्भि with huge, अथ and then, कच्छपैः with tortoises, प्रसन्नसलिलावृताः filled with pellucid water, नलिनीः lotus creepers, तत्र ददृशुः saw there.
explanation: There they saw golden fishes and huge tortoises in the pellucid water of the tank filled with lotus creepers.

shloka_text: काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि तथैव च।।4.50.30।। तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मुक्ताजालावृतानि च। हैमराजतभौमानि वैदूर्यमणिमन्ति च।।4.50.31।। ददृशुस्तत्र हरयो गृहमुख्यानि सर्वशः।
translation: हरयः monkeys, तत्र there, काञ्चनानि golden, तथैव similarly, राजतानि silver, विमानानि highrise palaces, तपनीयगवाक्षाणि golden windows (shaped like cow's eye fixed on the roofs and walls), मुक्ताजालावृतानि च covered with lattices of pearls, हैमराजतभौमानि made of gold, silver and mud (earth), वैदुर्यमणिमन्ति च decorated with precious gems of vaidurya, गृहमुख्यानि beautiful houses, सर्वशः all over, ददृशुः they saw.
explanation: The vanaras beheld highrise palaces built with gold and silver. The windows fixed on the roof were golden, shaped like cow's eye with lattices of pearls. They also saw best of houses built in gold, silver and clay, decorated with precious gems including vaidurya.

shloka_text: काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि तथैव च।।4.50.30।। तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मुक्ताजालावृतानि च। हैमराजतभौमानि वैदूर्यमणिमन्ति च।।4.50.31।। ददृशुस्तत्र हरयो गृहमुख्यानि सर्वशः।
translation: हरयः monkeys, तत्र there, काञ्चनानि golden, तथैव similarly, राजतानि silver, विमानानि highrise palaces, तपनीयगवाक्षाणि golden windows (shaped like cow's eye fixed on the roofs and walls), मुक्ताजालावृतानि च covered with lattices of pearls, हैमराजतभौमानि made of gold, silver and mud (earth), वैदुर्यमणिमन्ति च decorated with precious gems of vaidurya, गृहमुख्यानि beautiful houses, सर्वशः all over, ददृशुः they saw.
explanation: The vanaras beheld highrise palaces built with gold and silver. The windows fixed on the roof were golden, shaped like cow's eye with lattices of pearls. They also saw best of houses built in gold, silver and clay, decorated with precious gems including vaidurya.

shloka_text: पुष्पितान्फलिनो वृक्षान्प्रवाळमणिसन्निभान्।।4.50.32।। काञ्चनभ्रमरांश्चैव मधूनि च समन्ततः।
translation: पुष्पितान् blossomed, फलिनः with ripe fruits, प्रवालमणिसन्निभान् trees bright like corals, वृक्षान् trees, काञ्चनभ्रमरांश्चैव golden bees also, मधूनि च and different kinds of honey, समन्ततः all over.
explanation: They saw trees bright like corals in full bloom and ripe fruits. Golden bees were found hovering around making all kinds of honey.

shloka_text: मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च।।4.50.33।। महार्हाणि चयानानि ददृशुस्ते समन्ततः। हैमराजतकांस्यानां भाजनानां च संञ्चयान्।।4.50.34।।
translation: ते they, मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि wonderfully shining with gems and gold, महार्हाणि highly valuable ones, च also, यानानि vehicles, शयनानि beds, आसनानि च and couches, हैमराजतकांस्यानाम् made of gold, silver and bronze, भाजनानाम् of utensils, संञ्चयान् च collections, समन्ततः all over, ददृशुः they saw.
explanation: They saw all over rich collections of beds, couches and highly valuable vehicles,  decorated beautifully with gems and gold.They also saw a large collection of shining utensils made of gold, silver and bronze.

shloka_text: मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च।।4.50.33।। महार्हाणि चयानानि ददृशुस्ते समन्ततः। हैमराजतकांस्यानां भाजनानां च संञ्चयान्।।4.50.34।।
translation: ते they, मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि wonderfully shining with gems and gold, महार्हाणि highly valuable ones, च also, यानानि vehicles, शयनानि beds, आसनानि च and couches, हैमराजतकांस्यानाम् made of gold, silver and bronze, भाजनानाम् of utensils, संञ्चयान् च collections, समन्ततः all over, ददृशुः they saw.
explanation: They saw all over rich collections of beds, couches and highly valuable vehicles,  decorated beautifully with gems and gold.They also saw a large collection of shining utensils made of gold, silver and bronze.

shloka_text: अगरूणां च दिव्यानां चन्दनानां च संञ्चायान्। शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.50.35।।
translation: दिव्यानाम् of wonderful, अगरूणाम् of incense, चन्दनानाम् of sandal, सञ्चयान् collections, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits.
explanation: There they noticed a wonderful collection of incense and sandal, tasty and pure eatables, roots and fruits

shloka_text: महार्हाणि च पानानि मधूनि रसवन्ति च। दिव्यानामम्बराणां च महार्हाणां च सञ्चयान्।।4.50.36।। कम्बलानां च चित्राणामजिनानां च सञ्चयान्।
translation: महार्हाणि very rich, पानानि drinks, रसवन्ति tasty, मधूनि many kinds of honey,  दिव्यानाम्    wonderful, महार्हाणाम् of valuable ones, अम्बराणाम् of clothes, सञ्चयान् च and collections, चित्राणाम् of colourful, कम्बलानां च of blankets, अजिनानां च of animal skins, सञ्चयान् collection.
explanation: (They found) excellent drinks and many kinds of honey, wonderful collections of clothes, colourful blankets and heaps of animal skin.

shloka_text: तत्र तत्र च विन्यस्तान्दीप्तान्वैश्वानरप्रभान्।।4.50.37।। ददृशुर्वानराश्शुभ्राञ्जातरूपस्य सञ्चयान्।
translation: वानराः monkeys, तत्र तत्र here and there, विन्यस्तान् placed, दीप्तान् glittering, वैश्वानरप्रभान् like blazing fire, शुभ्रान् pure, जातरूपस्य gold, सञ्चयान् collections, ददृशुः observed.
explanation: The monkeys marked here and there a collection of gold, glittering like blazing fire.

shloka_text: तत्र तत्र विचिन्वन्तो बिले तस्मिन्महाबलाः।।4.50.38।। ददृशुर्वानराश्शूराः स्त्रियं काञ्चिददूरतः।
translation: महाबलाः strong, शूराः powerful, वानराः monkeys, तस्मिन्बिले in that cave, तत्र तत्र here and there, विचिन्वन्तः while they searched, अदूरतः not far from there, काञ्चित् some, स्त्रियम् woman, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: While searching here and there in the cave, the strong and powerful monkeys discovered a woman not far from there.

shloka_text: तां दृष्ट्वा भृशसन्त्रस्ताश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बराम्।।4.50.39।। तापसीं नियताहारां ज्वलन्तीमिव तेजसा।
translation: दृष्ट्वा on seeing, तां her, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् wearing deer skin and bark robes, नियताहाराम् restricted food, तेजसा with lustre, ज्वलन्तीमिव as if glowing, तापसीम् a female ascetic, भृशसन्त्रस्ता very much frightened.
explanation: She was an ascetic in bark robes and deer skin blazing with lustre, restrained in her food. The monkeys got very frightened.

shloka_text: विस्मिता हरयस्तत्र व्यवतिष्ठन्त सर्वशः।।4.50.40।। पप्रच्छ हनुमांस्तत्र काऽसि त्वं कस्य वा बिलम्।
translation: हरयः monkeys, विस्मिताः amazed, तत्र there, सर्वशः all over, व्यवतिष्ठन्त stopped, तत्र there, हनुमान् Hanuman, पप्रच्छ enquired, त्वम् you, का असि who are, बिलम् cave, कस्य वा whose is it?
explanation: The amazed monkeys stopped there. Hanuman enquired, 'Who are you? Whose cave is this'?

shloka_text: ततो हनूमान्गिरिसन्निकाशः कृताज्ञलिस्तामभिवाद्य वृद्धाम्। पप्रच्छ का त्वं भवनं बिलं च रत्नानि चेमानि वदस्व कस्य।।4.50.41।।
translation: ततः then, गिरिसन्निकाशः resembling a mountain in size, हनूमान् Hanuman, कृताञ्जलिः offered salutations with folded palms, तां वृद्धाम् to that old lady, अभिवाद्य having greeted, पप्रच्छ enquired, त्वम् you, का who, भवनम् this mansion, बिलं च and cave, इमानि these, रत्नानि च  gems, कस्य whose, वदस्व  tell.
explanation: Then Hanuman who was of the size of a mountain greeted the old lady with folded hands and enquired her 'Who are you? To whom does this mansion, this cave and these gems belong?' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends of fiftieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic of the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: इत्युक्त्वा हनुमांस्तत्र पुनः कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम्। अब्रवीत्तां महाभागां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्।।4.51.1।।
translation: तत्र there, हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, उक्त्वा having addressed, पुनः again, कृष्णाजिनाम्बराम् robed in deer skin, महाभागाम् a distinguished lady, धर्मचारिणीम् a righteous woman, तां तापसीम् ascetic woman, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: On meeting the distinguished, righteous ascetic woman robed in deer skin, Hanuman said:
comments: The story of Svayamprabha

shloka_text: इदं प्रविष्टास्सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्। क्षुत्पिपासापरिश्रान्ताः परिखिन्नाश्च सर्वशः।।4.51.2।।
translation: क्षुत्पिपासापरिश्रान्ताः exhausted with hunger and thirst, सर्वशः by all means, परिखिन्नाश्च fatigued, तिमिरसंवृतम् filled with darkness, इदम् this, बिलम् cave, सहसा all at once, प्रविष्टाः entered.
explanation: 'We are exhausted with thirst and hunger. We are fatigued. (Hence) we entered this dark cave all at once(without waiting for permission).

shloka_text: महद्धरण्या विवरं प्रविष्टाः स्म पिपासिताः। इमां स्त्वेवंविधान्भावान्विविधानद्भुतोपमान्।।4.51.3।। दृष्ट्वा वयं प्रव्यथितास्सम्भ्रान्ता नष्टचेतसः।
translation: पिपासिताः thirsty, धरण्याः of the earth, महत् huge, विवरम् hole, प्रविष्टाः स्म we entered, एवं विधान् this kind, विविधान् many, अद्भुतोपमान् wonderful ones, इमान् these, भावान् feelings, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, वयम् we, नष्टचेतसः having lost conciousness nearly, सम्भ्रान्ताः amazed, प्रव्यथिताः we are pained.
explanation: 'Thirst drove us into this cave on earth. We are amazed at the kind of many wonderful objects here and have nearly lost our senses. We are tormented with pain.

shloka_text: कस्यैते काञ्चना वृक्षास्तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः।।4.51.4।। शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च। काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि गृहाणि च।।4.51.5।। तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मणिजालावृतानि च।
translation: एते these, तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः resembling like the rising Sun, काञ्चनाः golden, वृक्षाः trees, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि very tasty eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, काञ्चनानि golden, विमानानि storeyed structures, राजतानि silver, तपनीय गवाक्षाणि glittering golden windows, मणिजालावृतानि adorned with lattices encrusted with gems, गृहाणि च and houses, कस्य whose?
explanation: 'To whom do these golden trees resembling the rising Sun belong? For whom are these  tasty roots and fruits? Whose are these manystoreyed golden houses with glittering windows adorned with silver lattices encrusted with gems?

shloka_text: कस्यैते काञ्चना वृक्षास्तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः।।4.51.4।। शुचीन्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च। काञ्चनानि विमानानि राजतानि गृहाणि च।।4.51.5।। तपनीयगवाक्षाणि मणिजालावृतानि च।
translation: एते these, तरुणादित्यसन्निभाः resembling like the rising Sun, काञ्चनाः golden, वृक्षाः trees, शुचीनि pure, अभ्यवहार्याणि very tasty eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, काञ्चनानि golden, विमानानि storeyed structures, राजतानि silver, तपनीय गवाक्षाणि glittering golden windows, मणिजालावृतानि adorned with lattices encrusted with gems, गृहाणि च and houses, कस्य whose?
explanation: 'To whom do these golden trees resembling the rising Sun belong? For whom are these  tasty roots and fruits? Whose are these manystoreyed golden houses with glittering windows adorned with silver lattices encrusted with gems?

shloka_text: पुष्पिताः फलवन्तश्च पुण्यास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।4.51.6।। इमे जाम्बूनदमयाः पादपाः कस्य तेजसा। काञ्चनानि च पद्मानि जातानि विमले जले।।4.51.7।। कथं मत्स्याश्च सौवर्णा दृश्यन्ते सह कच्छपैः। आत्मानमनुभावं च कस्य चैतत्तपोबलम्।।4.51.8।। अजानतां न स्सर्वेषां सर्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
translation: पुष्पिताः blossomed, फलवन्तश्च full of fruits, पुण्याः sacred, सुरभिगन्धिनः filled with fragrance, इमे these, जाम्बूनदमयाः full of gold, पादपाः trees, विमले in pure, जले in water, काञ्चनानि of gold, पद्मानि च and lotuses, कस्य whose, तेजसा by lustre, जातानि created, कच्छपैः सह along with tortoises, सौवर्णाः golden, मत्स्याश्च fishes too, कथम् how, आत्मानम् yourself, अनुभावाम् च your power, एतत् all this, तपोबलम् ascetic power, कस्य whose, च and, अजानताम्  do not know, नः us, सर्वेषाम् for all of us, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि you ought to.
explanation: 'By whose prowess are these golden trees yielding sacred fragrant flowers and fruits?  How are these golden lotuses created in the clear water? How is it that here are golden fishes and tortoises? Whose fruit of penance is this? Is it by your power? We do not know. You should tell all of us everything'.

shloka_text: पुष्पिताः फलवन्तश्च पुण्यास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।4.51.6।। इमे जाम्बूनदमयाः पादपाः कस्य तेजसा। काञ्चनानि च पद्मानि जातानि विमले जले।।4.51.7।। कथं मत्स्याश्च सौवर्णा दृश्यन्ते सह कच्छपैः। आत्मानमनुभावं च कस्य चैतत्तपोबलम्।।4.51.8।। अजानतां न स्सर्वेषां सर्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
translation: पुष्पिताः blossomed, फलवन्तश्च full of fruits, पुण्याः sacred, सुरभिगन्धिनः filled with fragrance, इमे these, जाम्बूनदमयाः full of gold, पादपाः trees, विमले in pure, जले in water, काञ्चनानि of gold, पद्मानि च and lotuses, कस्य whose, तेजसा by lustre, जातानि created, कच्छपैः सह along with tortoises, सौवर्णाः golden, मत्स्याश्च fishes too, कथम् how, आत्मानम् yourself, अनुभावाम् च your power, एतत् all this, तपोबलम् ascetic power, कस्य whose, च and, अजानताम्  do not know, नः us, सर्वेषाम् for all of us, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि you ought to.
explanation: 'By whose prowess are these golden trees yielding sacred fragrant flowers and fruits?  How are these golden lotuses created in the clear water? How is it that here are golden fishes and tortoises? Whose fruit of penance is this? Is it by your power? We do not know. You should tell all of us everything'.

shloka_text: पुष्पिताः फलवन्तश्च पुण्यास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।4.51.6।। इमे जाम्बूनदमयाः पादपाः कस्य तेजसा। काञ्चनानि च पद्मानि जातानि विमले जले।।4.51.7।। कथं मत्स्याश्च सौवर्णा दृश्यन्ते सह कच्छपैः। आत्मानमनुभावं च कस्य चैतत्तपोबलम्।।4.51.8।। अजानतां न स्सर्वेषां सर्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
translation: पुष्पिताः blossomed, फलवन्तश्च full of fruits, पुण्याः sacred, सुरभिगन्धिनः filled with fragrance, इमे these, जाम्बूनदमयाः full of gold, पादपाः trees, विमले in pure, जले in water, काञ्चनानि of gold, पद्मानि च and lotuses, कस्य whose, तेजसा by lustre, जातानि created, कच्छपैः सह along with tortoises, सौवर्णाः golden, मत्स्याश्च fishes too, कथम् how, आत्मानम् yourself, अनुभावाम् च your power, एतत् all this, तपोबलम् ascetic power, कस्य whose, च and, अजानताम्  do not know, नः us, सर्वेषाम् for all of us, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि you ought to.
explanation: 'By whose prowess are these golden trees yielding sacred fragrant flowers and fruits?  How are these golden lotuses created in the clear water? How is it that here are golden fishes and tortoises? Whose fruit of penance is this? Is it by your power? We do not know. You should tell all of us everything'.

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी धर्मचारिणी।।4.51.9।। प्रत्युवाच हनूमन्तं सर्वभूतहिते रता।
translation: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता spoken, सर्वभूतहिते in the interest of all beings, रता committed, धर्मचारिणी noble woman, तापसी female ascetic, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: The noble ascetic committed to the welfare of all beings replied to Hanuman's enquiry:

shloka_text: मयो नाम महातेजा मायावी वानरर्षभः।।4.51.10।। तेनेदं निर्मितं सर्वं मायया काञ्चनं वनम्।
translation: वानरर्षभः O bull among monkeys, महातेजाः brilliant, मायावी a deceitful, मयो नाम called Maya, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, काञ्चनं वनम् golden forest, तेन by his, मायया magical power, निर्मितम् created.
explanation: 'O bull among monkeys this golden forest was created by the magical power of a deceitful demon called Maya.

shloka_text: पुरा दानवमुख्यानां विश्वकर्मा बभूव ह।।4.51.11।। येनेदं काञ्चनं दिव्यं निर्मितं भवनोत्तमम्।
translation: येन by whomsoever, काञ्चनम् golden, दिव्यम् wonderful, इदम् this, भवनोत्तमम् best of mansions, निर्मितम् constructed, पुरा earlier, दानवमुख्यानाम्  chiefs of demons, विश्वकर्मा Visvakarma, बभूव existed.
explanation: This best of wonderful mansions has been constructed earlier by Visvakarma, the chief (architect) of the demons.

shloka_text: स तु वर्षसहस्राणि तपस्तप्त्वा महावने।।4.51.12।। पितामहाद्वरं लेभे सर्वमौशनसं धनम्।
translation: सः that, वने in the forest, वर्षसहस्राणि for thousands of years, महावने dense forest, तपः penance, तप्त्वा having performed, पितामहात् from the creator Brahma, वरम् boon, औशनसम् of Usanas, सर्वम् all, धनम् wealth, लेभे inherited.
explanation: 'He (Maya) performed rigorous penance in the dense forest for thousands of years seeking the favour of Brahma, the creator and obtained a boon that he should inherit all the wealth of Usanas (Shukra).

shloka_text: वनं विधाय बलवान्सर्वकामेश्वरस्तदा।।4.51.13।। उवास सुखितः कालं कञ्चिदस्मिन्महावने।
translation: तदा then, बलवान् powerful one, सर्वकामेश्वरः master of all desires, सुखितः happily, अस्मिन् in this, महावने in this dense forest, कञ्चित्कालम् for some time, उवास lived, वनं the forest, विधाय after creating.
explanation: Then the mighty Maya who received the power of (executing) desires created this mansion and lived here happily for some time in this dense forest.

shloka_text: तमप्सरसि हेमायां सक्तं दानवपुङ्गवम्।।4.51.14।। विक्रम्यैवाशनिं गृह्य जघानेत्रः पुरन्दरः।
translation: हेमायाम् Hema, अप्सरसि an apsarasa or angel, सक्तम् infatuated, तम् him, दानवपुङ्गवम् great demon, ईशः lord, पुरन्दरः Indra, अशनिम् thunderbolt, गृह्य after taking, विक्रम्यैव with all his might, जघान attacked.
explanation: 'Seeing this great demon in love with a heavenly apsara (nymph) called Hema, Lord Indra with all his might attacked him with his thunderbolt.

shloka_text: इदं च ब्रह्मणा दत्तं हेमायै वनमुत्तमम्।।4.51.15।। शाश्वता: कामभोगश्च गृहं चेदं हिरण्मयम्।
translation: इदम् thus, उत्तमम् wonderful, वनम् forest, शाश्वता: permanently, कामभोगश्च luxurious life, हिरण्मयम् golden, इदम् this, गृहम् house, ब्रह्मणा creator Brahma, हेमायै to Hema, दत्तम् was given.
explanation: 'Thus this wonderful forest and the golden house with all luxury were given away permanently to Hema by the creator Brahma.

shloka_text: दुहिता मेरुसावर्णेरहं तस्यास्स्वयंप्रभा।।4.51.16।। इदं रक्षामि भवनं हेमाया वानरोत्तम।
translation: वानरोत्तम best of monkeys, मेरुसावर्णेः of Meru Sauvarni, दुहिता daughter, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprabha, अहम् me, तस्याः her, हेमायाः Hema's, इदम् this, भवनम् house, रक्षामिI protect.
explanation: 'O best of monkeys daughter of Meru Sauvarni, I am Svayamprabha (selfilluminator), caretaker of this house of Hema. (Meru Sauvarni is the eleventh  Manu).

shloka_text: मम प्रियसखी हेमा नृत्तगीतविशारदा।।4.51.17।। तया दत्तवरा चास्मि रक्षामि भवनोत्तमम्।
translation: नृत्तगीतविशारदा wellversed in dance and music, हेमा Hema, मम to me, प्रियसखी dear friend, तया as such, दत्तवरा granted a boon, अस्मि I am, उत्तमम् supreme, भवनम् house, रक्षामि I watch this house.
explanation: 'Hema, wellversed in dance and music is a fast friend to me. She granted a boon (that none can resist me) and gave this house of which I am the caretaker.

shloka_text: किं कार्यं कस्य वा हेतोः कान्ताराणि प्रपश्यथ।।4.51.18।। कथं चेदं वनं दुर्गं युष्माभिरुपलक्षितम्।
translation: कार्यम् mission, किम् what, कस्य वा for what, हेतोः for purpose, कान्ताराणि these forests, प्रपश्यथ you are looking for, दुर्गम् inaccessible, इदम् वनम् this forest, युष्माभिः by all of you, कथम् how, उपलक्षितम् was found?
explanation: 'What is your mission? For what purpose have you come to this inaccessible forest? What are you looking for?How did you find this?

shloka_text: इमान्यभ्यवहार्याणि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.51.19।। भुक्त्वा पीत्वा च पानीयं सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हथ।
translation: इमान् these, अभ्यवहार्याणि wonderful eatables, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, भुक्त्वा after eating, पानीयम् drink, पीत्वा च taking, मे to me, सर्वम् every thing, वक्तुम् you may tell, अर्हथ you may do so.
explanation: 'Eat these wonderful roots and fruits and have these drinks and then tell me all about you. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकपञ्चशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends of the fiftyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: अथ तानब्रवीत्सर्वान्विश्रान्तान्हरियूथपान्। इदं वचनमेकाग्रा तापसी धर्मचारिणी।।4.52.1।।
translation: अथ thereafter, धर्मचारिणी righteous woman, एकाग्रा with concentration, तापसी ascetic woman, विश्रान्तान्  had rested, तान् those, सर्वान् all, हरियूथपान् monkey leaders, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: After the monkey leaders had taken rest, the noble ascetic with undiverted attention said these words:
comments: Hanuman narrates to Svayamprabha the purpose of the monkey mission and the reasons for entering the cave.

shloka_text: वानरा यदि वः खेदः प्रनष्टः फलभक्षणात्। यदि चैतन्मया श्राव्यं श्रोतुमिच्छामि कथ्यताम्।।4.52.2।।
translation: वानराः O monkey, फलभक्षणात् by eating fruits, वः your, खेदः sorrow, प्रनष्टः यदि is relieved, एतत् thus, मया by me, श्राव्यं च यदि if it can be heard, कथ्यताम् it may be narrated, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish.
explanation: 'O monkeys if you have been relieved of your fatigue after eating fruits, now tell me about yourself, if you think it can be told. I want to hear.

shloka_text: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः। आर्जवेन यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।।4.52.3।।
translation: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनूमान् Hanuman, तस्याः her, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, आर्जवेन frankly, यथातत्त्वम् faithfully, आख्यातुम् to narrate, उपचक्रमे started.
explanation: When Hanuman, son of the Windgod, heard her, he started narrating frankly and truthfully.

shloka_text: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः। रामो दाशरथिश्शीमान्प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।4.52.4।। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया। तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात्।।4.52.5।।
translation: सर्वस्य for the entire, लोकस्य world's, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Indra and Varuna, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् prosperous, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered, तस्य his, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, बलात् forcibly, हृता she was abducted.
explanation: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.

shloka_text: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः। रामो दाशरथिश्शीमान्प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।4.52.4।। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया। तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात्।।4.52.5।।
translation: सर्वस्य for the entire, लोकस्य world's, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः comparable to Indra and Varuna, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, श्रीमान् prosperous, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered, तस्य his, भार्या wife, रावणेन by Ravana, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, बलात् forcibly, हृता she was abducted.
explanation: 'Rama, son of Dasaratha, a prosperous king of all the worlds, comparable to Indra and Varuna came to the Dandaka forest along with his brother Laksmana and wife Vaidehi. Ravana abducted his wife from Janasthana.

shloka_text: अगस्त्यचरितामाशां दक्षिणां यमरक्षिताम्। सहैभिर्वानरैर्घोरैरङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वयम्।।4.52.7।। रावणं सहितास्सर्वे राक्षसं कामरूपिणम्। सीतया सह वैदेह्या मार्गध्वमिति चोदिताः।।4.52.8।।
translation: सर्वे all, सहिताः together, वैदेह्या Videha, सीतया सह with Sita, कामरूपिणम् he who changes his form at his will, राक्षसम् demon, रावणम् Ravana, मार्गध्वम् direction, इति thus, वयम् we, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः with Angada as chief, एभिः these also, मुख्यैः with leaders, वानरैः सह along with the monkeys, अगस्त्यचरिताम् where sage Agasthya lived, यमरक्षिताम् protected by Yama, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, आशाम् intent on, चोदिताः to search.
explanation: 'We along with the dreadful monkeys are sent with Angada as our chief to the southern direction, guarded by Yama and inhabited by sage Agasti. We are commanded to search Sita, princess of Videha and also the abode of the demon Ravana who assumes any form at his free will.

shloka_text: अगस्त्यचरितामाशां दक्षिणां यमरक्षिताम्। सहैभिर्वानरैर्घोरैरङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वयम्।।4.52.7।। रावणं सहितास्सर्वे राक्षसं कामरूपिणम्। सीतया सह वैदेह्या मार्गध्वमिति चोदिताः।।4.52.8।।
translation: सर्वे all, सहिताः together, वैदेह्या Videha, सीतया सह with Sita, कामरूपिणम् he who changes his form at his will, राक्षसम् demon, रावणम् Ravana, मार्गध्वम् direction, इति thus, वयम् we, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः with Angada as chief, एभिः these also, मुख्यैः with leaders, वानरैः सह along with the monkeys, अगस्त्यचरिताम् where sage Agasthya lived, यमरक्षिताम् protected by Yama, दक्षिणाम् southern direction, आशाम् intent on, चोदिताः to search.
explanation: 'We along with the dreadful monkeys are sent with Angada as our chief to the southern direction, guarded by Yama and inhabited by sage Agasti. We are commanded to search Sita, princess of Videha and also the abode of the demon Ravana who assumes any form at his free will.

shloka_text: विवर्णवदनास्सर्वे सर्वे ध्यानपरायणाः। नाधिगच्छामहे पारं मग्नाश्चिन्तामहार्णवे।।4.52.10।।
translation: सर्वे all of us, विवर्णवदनाः palefaced, सर्वे all, ध्यानपरायणाः lost in thought, चिन्तामहार्णवे in the deep ocean of worry, मग्नाः immersed, पारम् the shore, नाधिगच्छामहे we were unable to find.
explanation: 'We were all exhausted, lost in thought and worried, unable to cross this deep ocean of sorrow. We did not know how to proceed.

shloka_text: चारयन्तस्ततश्चक्षुर्दृष्टवन्तो वयं बिलम्। लतापादपसञ्च्छन्नं तिमिरेण समावृतम्।।4.52.11।।
translation: ततः then, चक्षुः eyes, चारयन्तः while we were looking around, लतापादपसञ्च्छन्नम् concealed by vines and trees, तिमिरेण with darkness, समावृतम् spread all over, वयम् we, बिलम् cave, दृष्टवन्तः we saw.
explanation: 'Then while we were looking around we saw this cave concealed by trees and vines, with darkness spread all over.

shloka_text: अस्माद्धंसा जलक्लिन्नाः पक्षैस्सलिलविस्रवैः। कुररास्सारसाश्चैव निष्पतन्ति पतत्रिणः।।4.52.12।।
translation: अस्मात् this, सलिलविस्रवैः by those with water dripping, पक्षैः with wings, जलक्लिन्नाः drenched in water, हंसाः swans, कुरराः kuraras, सारसाश्चैव sarasas also, पतत्रिणः birds, निष्पतन्ति flying out.
explanation: 'Drenched in water the swans, kuraras, and sarasas were seen emerging with water dripping from thier wings.

shloka_text: साध्वत्र प्रविशामेति मया तूक्ताः प्लवङ्गमाः। तेषामपि हि सर्वेषामनुमानमुपागतम्।।4.52.13।।
translation: अत्र here, साधु it is proper, प्रविशाम let us enter, इति thus, मया by me, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, उक्ताः have been told, तेषाम् for them, सर्वेषामपि for all of them, अनुमानम् inferring, उपागतम् came in.
explanation: 'I suggested to the fellowmonkeys to enter this cave, inferring that there would be water and all of them came to the same conclusion.

shloka_text: गच्छाम प्रविशामेति भर्तृकार्यत्वरान्विताः। ततो गाढं निपतिता गृह्य हस्तौ परस्परम्।।4.52.14।।
translation: भर्तृकार्यत्वरान्विताः in haste to carry out the orders of our king, प्रविशामः let us enter, गच्छाम let us go, निपतिताः we jumped in, ततः then, परस्परम् each one holding the other, हस्तौ by hands, गाढम् firmly, गृह्य holding.
explanation: 'We said, 'let us enter', since we were in a hurry to carry out our king's orders.Then we jumped in, holding one another's hand.

shloka_text: इदं प्रविष्टास्सहसा बिलं तिमिरसंवृतम्। एतन्नः कार्यमेतेन कृत्येन वयमागताः।।4.52.15।। त्वां चैवोपगतास्सर्वे परिद्यूना बुभुक्षिताः।
translation: तिमिरसंवृतम् shrouded in darkness, इदं बिलम् this grotto, सहसा at once, प्रविष्टाः we entered, एतत् this, नः our, कार्यम् task, एतेन by this, कृत्येन by the task, वयम् we, आगताः we came, बुभुक्षिताः hungry ones, परिद्यूनाः vexed, सर्वे all of us, त्वाम् your, उपगताश्चैव we reached.
explanation: 'Vexed and starved, we entered this grotto shrouded in darkness.This is our task and we reached here (in the process).

shloka_text: आतिथ्यधर्मदत्तानि मूलानि च फलानि च।।4.52.16।। अस्माभिरुपभुक्तानि बुभुक्षापरिपीडितैः।
translation: बुभुक्षापरिपीडितैः tormented by hunger and thirst, अस्माभिः us, आतिथ्यधर्मदत्तानि  given out of hospitality, मूलानि च roots and, फलानि च and fruits, उपभुक्तानि have eaten.
explanation: 'You have given us roots and fruits out of hospitality and we have been taken them driven by hunger and thirst.

shloka_text: यत्त्वया रक्षितास्सर्वे म्रियमाणा बुभुक्षया।।4.52.17।। ब्रूहि प्रत्युपकारार्थं किं ते कुर्वन्तु वानराः।
translation: बुभुक्षया by starvation, म्रियमाणाः dying, सर्वे all, यत् as such, त्वया by you, रक्षिताः saved, वानराः monkeys, ते to you, प्रत्युपकारार्थम् to repay you in turn, किं कुर्वन्तु what can they do, ब्रूहि  tell.
explanation: 'We were dying from hunger when you saved us. Tell us what the monkeys can do to repay your debt?'.

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता तु धर्मज्ञैर्वानरैस्तैस्स्वयंप्रभा।।4.52.18।। प्रत्युवाच ततस्सर्वानिदं वानरपुङ्गवान्।
translation: तैः वानरैः by the monkeys, एवम् thus, उक्ताः addressed, धर्मज्ञौः by the knowers of dharma, स्वयंप्रभा Svayamprapbha, ततः then, सर्वान् all, वानरपुङ्गवान् leaders among the monkeys, इदम्  this, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: To the leaders among the monkeys, knowers of dharma, who said this Svayamprabha replied:

shloka_text: सर्वेषां परितुष्टाऽस्मि वानराणां तरस्विनाम्।।4.52.19।। चरन्त्या मम धर्मेण न कार्यमिह केनचित्।
translation: तरस्विनाम् of those quick and energetic ones, सर्वेषाम् about all of you, वानराणाम् of  monkeys, परितुष्टा pleased, अस्मि I am, धर्मेण in rghteousness, चरन्त्याः while practising, मम to me, इह now, केनचित् any, कार्यम् service,  न no need.
explanation: 'I am very much pleased with all of you, smart monkeys. As I am engaged in the practice of righteousness, I do not need your services. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तश्शुभं वाक्यं तापस्या धर्मसंहितम्। उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं तामनिन्दितचेष्टिताम्।।4.53.1।।
translation: तापस्या by the hermitess, एवम् that way, धर्मसंहितम् coupled with righteousness, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः expressed, हनुमान् Hanuman, अनिन्दितचेष्टिताम् blameless in actions, ताम् her, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
explanation: To the auspicious words of the righteous, blameless hermitess Hanuman replied:
comments: Svayamprabha helps the monkeys to reach out of the cave -- Angada regrets for exceeding the time limit -- proposes fasting unto death fearing punishment -- the monkeys decide to end their life rather than return without Sita.

shloka_text: शरणं त्वां प्रपन्ना स्म सर्वे वै धर्मचारिणीं। यः कृतस्समयोऽस्माकं सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।।4.53.2।। स च कालो ह्यतिक्रान्तो बिले च परिवर्तताम्।
translation: धर्मचारिणीम् to the righteous lady, त्वाम् you, सर्वे all, शरणं प्रसन्नाः स्मः have taken refuge, महात्मना by the great self, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, अस्माकं to us, यः such, समयः condition, कृतः having given, सः that, बिले in the cave, परिवर्तताम् while we were moving about, ह्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.
explanation: 'You are a righteous lady. You have given us refuge. Now in moving about the cave we have exceeded the time limit given by Sugriva.'

shloka_text: त्रातुमर्हसि नस्सर्वान्सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान्।।4.53.4।। महच्चकार्यमस्माभिः कर्तव्यं धर्मचारिणि। तच्चापि न कृतं कार्यमस्माभिरिह वासिभिः।।4.53.5।।
translation: धर्मचारिणि a woman of righteous practices, सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान् who are afraid of Sugriva, नः us, सर्वान् all, त्रातुम् to save, अर्हसि should, अस्माभिः by us, महत् great, कार्यं च task also, कर्तव्यम् should be done, इह now, वासिभिः staying here, अस्माभिः by us, तत् that, कार्यं चापि the objective, न कृतम् not accomplished.
explanation: 'O righteous lady we have a great task waiting. We are afraid of Sugriva as we could not accomplish our objective by staying here. Save us.'

shloka_text: त्रातुमर्हसि नस्सर्वान्सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान्।।4.53.4।। महच्चकार्यमस्माभिः कर्तव्यं धर्मचारिणि। तच्चापि न कृतं कार्यमस्माभिरिह वासिभिः।।4.53.5।।
translation: धर्मचारिणि a woman of righteous practices, सुग्रीवभयकर्शितान् who are afraid of Sugriva, नः us, सर्वान् all, त्रातुम् to save, अर्हसि should, अस्माभिः by us, महत् great, कार्यं च task also, कर्तव्यम् should be done, इह now, वासिभिः staying here, अस्माभिः by us, तत् that, कार्यं चापि the objective, न कृतम् not accomplished.
explanation: 'O righteous lady we have a great task waiting. We are afraid of Sugriva as we could not accomplish our objective by staying here. Save us.'

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता हनुमता तापसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्। जीवता दुष्करं मन्ये प्रविष्टेन निवर्तितुम्।।4.53.6।।
translation: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that manner, उक्ता being told, तापसी ascetic, वाक्यम्  these words, अब्रवीत् said, प्रविष्टेन by one who entered, जीवता with life, निवर्तितुम् to go back, दुष्करम् it is difficult, मन्ये I think.
explanation: To the words of Hanuman the ascetic replied, 'I consider it difficult for any one who enters here to go back alive.'

shloka_text: तपसस्तु प्रभावेन नियमोपार्जितेन च। सर्वानेव बिलादस्मादुद्धरिष्यामि वानरान्।।4.53.7।।
translation: नियमोपार्जितेन earned by practising, तपसः by asceticism, तु प्रभावेन by virtue of it, सर्वानेव all of you, वानरान् monkeys, अस्मात् बिलात् from this cave, उद्धरियिष्यामि I will help you out.
explanation: 'I will help all monkeys out of this cave by virtue of my power of asceticism duly practised.

shloka_text: ततस्सम्मीलितास्सर्वे सुकुमाराङ्गुलैः करैः। सहसाऽपिदधुर्दृष्टिं हृष्टा गमनकाङ्क्षया।।4.53.9।।
translation: ततः then, गमनकाङ्क्षया with a desire to get out, हृष्टाः joyful ones, सर्वे all, सम्मीलिताः closed their eye lids, सहसा at once, सुकुमाराङ्गुलैः with delicate fingers, करैः with hands, दृष्टिम् eyes, पिदधुः closed.
explanation: Happy at the prospect of getting out (of the cave) they all not only closed their eyes but also covered them with their delicate fingers.

shloka_text: वानरास्तु महात्मानो हस्तरुद्धमुखास्तदा। निमेषान्तरमात्रेण बिलादुत्तारितास्तया।।4.53.10।।
translation: तदा then, हस्तरुद्धमुखाः faces covered with hands, महात्मानः great souls, वानराः monkeys, तया with her help, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a moment, बिलात् from the cave, उत्तारिताः came out.
explanation: Then the great monkeys, faces covered with their hands, emerged from the cave in a moment.

shloka_text: ततस्तान्वानरान्सर्वांस्तापसी धर्मचारिणी। निस्सृतान्विषमात्तस्मात्समाश्वास्येदमब्रवीत्।।4.53.11।।
translation: धर्मचारिणी righteous, तापसी ascetic, तत्र there, तान् सर्वान् all of them, विषमात् from the difficult situation, तस्मात् from that, निस्सृतान् those who were released, समाश्वास्य after consoling them all, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: The righteous hermitess released all the monkeys out of that difficult situation and said these words of consolation:

shloka_text: एष विन्ध्यो गिरिश्श्रीमान्नानाद्रुमलताकुलः। एष प्रस्रवणश्शैलस्सागरोऽयं महोदधिः।।4.53.12।। स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि भवनं वानरर्षभाः। इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं श्रीमत्प्रविवेश स्वयम्प्रभा।।4.53.13।।
translation: एषः this, श्रीमान् rich, नानाद्रुमलताकुलः filled with different kinds of trees and vines, विन्ध्यः Vindhya, गिरिः mountain, एषः this, प्रस्रवणः Prasravana, शैलः hill, अयम् this, सागरः sea, महोदधिः great ocean, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys वः you, स्वस्ति be happy, अस्तु so be it, भवनम् to my house, गमिष्यामि I will go, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, स्वयम्प्रभा Svayamprabha, श्रीमत् splendid, तत् बिलम् that cave, प्रविवेश entered.
explanation: 'This Vindhya mountain has a rich collection of trees and bushes. This is Prasravana hill and this is the great ocean.O monkeys. Good luck to you. (Now) I am going back home'. Having said so, Svayamprabha entered the splendid cave.

shloka_text: एष विन्ध्यो गिरिश्श्रीमान्नानाद्रुमलताकुलः। एष प्रस्रवणश्शैलस्सागरोऽयं महोदधिः।।4.53.12।। स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि भवनं वानरर्षभाः। इत्युक्त्वा तद्बिलं श्रीमत्प्रविवेश स्वयम्प्रभा।।4.53.13।।
translation: एषः this, श्रीमान् rich, नानाद्रुमलताकुलः filled with different kinds of trees and vines, विन्ध्यः Vindhya, गिरिः mountain, एषः this, प्रस्रवणः Prasravana, शैलः hill, अयम् this, सागरः sea, महोदधिः great ocean, वानरर्षभाः bulls among monkeys वः you, स्वस्ति be happy, अस्तु so be it, भवनम् to my house, गमिष्यामि I will go, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, स्वयम्प्रभा Svayamprabha, श्रीमत् splendid, तत् बिलम् that cave, प्रविवेश entered.
explanation: 'This Vindhya mountain has a rich collection of trees and bushes. This is Prasravana hill and this is the great ocean.O monkeys. Good luck to you. (Now) I am going back home'. Having said so, Svayamprabha entered the splendid cave.

shloka_text: ततस्ते ददृशुर्घोरं सागरं वरुणालयम्। अपारमभिगर्जन्तं घोरैरूर्मिभिरावृतम्।।4.53.14।।
translation: ततः then, ते they, घोरम् dreadful, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, अपारम् endless, अभिगर्जन्तम्  roaring wildly, घोरै: with terrific, ऊर्मिभिः with waves, आवृतम् spread over, सागरम् ocean, ददृशुः saw.
explanation: Then the monkeys saw the boundless, dreary ocean roaring wild with its terrific waves spread all over.

shloka_text: मयस्य मायाविहितं गिरिदुर्गं विचिन्वताम्। तेषां मासो व्यतिक्रान्तो यो राज्ञा समयः कृतः।।4.53.15।।
translation: तेषाम् for them, मयस्य Maya's, मायाविहितम् created by his Maya, गिरिदुर्गम् impassable mountain, विचिन्वताम् while searching, यः such, राज्ञा by the king, समयः time set, कृतः was fixed, मासः month, व्यतिक्रान्तः exceeded.
explanation: While they were ransacking the impassable mountain created with the magical powers of Maya, the time limit of one month set by the king was over.

shloka_text: विन्ध्यस्य तु गिरेः पादे सम्प्रपुष्पितपादपे। उपविश्य महाभागाश्चिन्तामापेदिरे तदा।।4.53.16।।
translation: तदा then, महाभागा: great souls, सम्प्रपुष्पितपादपे in a location where trees are in full bloom, विन्ध्यस्य तु of Vindhya, गिरेः of that mountain, पादे adjacent, उपविश्य sat, चिन्ताम् thinking, आपेदिरे did.
explanation: Then the highsoul monkeys reached the hill adjacent to Vindhya mountain on which trees were in full bloom.They sat there, lost in thought.

shloka_text: ततः पुष्पातिभाराग्रान् लताशतसमावृतान्। द्रुमान्वासन्तिकान्दृष्टवा बभूवुर्भयशङ्किताः।।4.53.17।।
translation: ततः then, पुष्पातिभाराग्रान्  heavily loaded with flowers on top, लताशतसमावृतान् entwined by hundreds of creepers, वासन्तिकान् spring, द्रुमान् trees, दृष्ट्वा saw, भयशङ्किताः frightened, बभूवुः became.
explanation: Alarmed at the thought (of transgression of time limit), the monkeys kept looking at the tree tops entwined with a hundred oreepers heavily loaded with the flowers of spring.

shloka_text: ते वसन्तमनुप्राप्तं प्रतिबुद्ध्वा परस्परम्। नष्टसन्देशकालार्था निपेतुर्धरणीतले।।4.53.18।।
translation: ते they, वसन्तम् spring, अनुप्राप्तम् set in, परस्परम् with one onather, प्रतिबुद्ध्वा after realising, नष्टसन्देशकालार्थाः having exceeded the time set, धरणीतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell down.
explanation: Having realised (looking at the flowers) that spring has set in and they have exceeded the time limit, they all fell down on the ground.

shloka_text: ततस्तान्कपिवृद्धांस्तु शिष्टांश्चैव वनौकसः। वाचा मधुरयाऽभाष्य यथावदनुमान्य च।।4.53.19।। स तु सिंहवृषस्कन्धः पीनायतभुजः कपिः। युवराजो महाप्राज्ञः अङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।4.53.20।।
translation: ततः then, सिंहवृषस्कन्धः one who has shoulders like a lion or bull, पीनायतभुजः of sturdy and long arms, युवराजः heir apparent, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, कपिः monkey, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् them, कपिवृद्धांस्तु to the elderly monkeys, शिष्टान् respectable, वनैकसश्चैव forestdwellers (monkeys), मधुरया with a sweet, वाचा tone, आभाष्य spoke, यथावत् properly, अनुमान्य च after coming to a decision, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Coming to a conclusion after due deliberation Angada, heir apparent, profoundly wise, endowed with sturdy and broad shoulders like those of a lion or a bull, spoke in a sweet voice to the elderly, respectable monkeys, dwellers of the forest:

shloka_text: ततस्तान्कपिवृद्धांस्तु शिष्टांश्चैव वनौकसः। वाचा मधुरयाऽभाष्य यथावदनुमान्य च।।4.53.19।। स तु सिंहवृषस्कन्धः पीनायतभुजः कपिः। युवराजो महाप्राज्ञः अङ्गदो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।4.53.20।।
translation: ततः then, सिंहवृषस्कन्धः one who has shoulders like a lion or bull, पीनायतभुजः of sturdy and long arms, युवराजः heir apparent, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, कपिः monkey, अङ्गदः Angada, तान् them, कपिवृद्धांस्तु to the elderly monkeys, शिष्टान् respectable, वनैकसश्चैव forestdwellers (monkeys), मधुरया with a sweet, वाचा tone, आभाष्य spoke, यथावत् properly, अनुमान्य च after coming to a decision, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Coming to a conclusion after due deliberation Angada, heir apparent, profoundly wise, endowed with sturdy and broad shoulders like those of a lion or a bull, spoke in a sweet voice to the elderly, respectable monkeys, dwellers of the forest:

shloka_text: शासनात्कपिराजस्य वयं सर्वे विनिर्गताः। मासः पूर्णो बिलस्थानां हरयः किं न बुद्ध्यते।।4.53.21।।
translation: हरयः O monkeys, वयं सर्वे all of us, कपिराजस्य monkey king's, शासनात् by his command,  विनिर्गताः came here, बिलस्थानाम् for us staying in the cave, मासः a month, पूर्णः is completed, किम् what, न बुद्ध्यते do you not know?
explanation: 'O monkeys don't you realize that all of us have come here at the command of the monkey king, and while we were in the cave a whole month has gone by?

shloka_text: वयमाश्वयुजे मासि कालसङ्ख्याव्यवस्थिताः। प्रस्थितास्सोऽपि चातीतः किमतः कार्यमुत्तरम्।।4.53.22।।
translation: वयम् we, कालसङ्ख्याव्यवस्थिताः with time limit, आश्वयुजे मासि the month of Ashvayuja, प्रस्थिताः we started our journey, सोऽपि even that has, अतीतः exceeded, अतः therefore, उत्तरं later, कार्यम् task, किम् what?
explanation: 'We started our journey in the month of Ashvayuja with a certain time limit. That has exceeded. What is the future course of action?

shloka_text: कर्मस्वप्रतिमास्सर्वे दिक्षु विश्रुतपौरुषाः। मां पुरस्कृत्य निर्याताः पिङ्गाक्षप्रतिचोदिताः।।4.53.24।।
translation: सर्वे all, कर्मसु in actions, अप्रतिमाः incomparable, दिक्षु in all quarters, विश्रुतपौरुषाः very famous for bravery, पिङ्गाक्षप्रतिचोदिताः sent by tawnyeyed Sugriva, माम् me, पुरस्कृत्य obeying the orders, निर्याताः you have followed me.
explanation: 'You are all celebrated for bravery and incomparable in your activities. You have followed me in obedience to the orders of the tawnyeyed Sugriva.

shloka_text: इदानीमकृतार्थानां मर्तव्यं नात्र संशयः। हरिराजस्य सन्देशमकृत्वा कस्सुखी भवेत्।।4.53.25।।
translation: इदानीम् at this time, अकृतार्थानाम् not having achieved the objective (of finding Sita), मर्तव्यम् we should die, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न not, हरिराजस्य the king's, सन्देशम् orders, अकृत्वा not executing, कः who, सुखी happy, भवेत् will be
explanation: 'We should be killed since we have failed to achieve the objective (of finding Sita). There is no doubt about it. Who can live in peace without executing the orders of the king?

shloka_text: तस्मिन्नतीते काले तु सुग्रीवेण कृते स्वयम्। प्रायोपवेशनं युक्तं सर्वेषां च वनौकसाम्।।4.53.26।।
translation: सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, कृते fixed, तस्मिन् काले at this time, अतीते when exceeded, सर्वेषाम् for all of us,वनौकसाम् for the forest dwellers (monkeys) स्वयम् personally, प्रायोपवेशनम् fasting unto death, युक्तम् is right.
explanation: 'Now that the time limit fixed by Sugriva has expired, the right thing to do for the monkeys is to fast unto death.

shloka_text: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवस्स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः। न क्षमिष्यति नस्सर्वानपराधकृतो गतान्।।4.53.27।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, स्वामिभावे as a king, व्यवस्थितः consecrated, गतान् when we reach, अपराधकृतः  us who are real offenders, नः not, सर्वान् to all, न क्षमिष्यति will not forgive us.
explanation: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh, and being a king now, he will not forgive us who are real offenders and have not done the task assigned.

shloka_text: धृवं नो हिंसिता राजा सर्वान्प्रतिगतानितः।।4.53.29।। वधेनाप्रतिरूपेण श्रेयान्मृत्युरिहैव नः।
translation: राजा king, इतः here, प्रतिगतान् when we return, नः us, सर्वान् all, अप्रतिरूपेण in an incomparable manner, वधेन with death sentence, ध्रुवम् surely, हिंसिता will torture us, नः us, इहैव here itself, मृत्यु: death, श्रेयान् it is better.
explanation: 'Surely the king will torture us by awarding death sentence in a singular manner when we go back. It is better for us to meet death here itself.

shloka_text: न चाहं यौवराज्येन सुग्रीवेणाभिषेचितः।।4.53.30।। नरेन्द्रेणाभिषिक्तोऽस्मि रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।
translation: अहम् I, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, यौवराज्येन as heir apparent, न अभिषेचितः not installed, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा who never harms others, नरेन्द्रेण by the king of the people, रामेण by Rama, अभिषिक्तः crowned prince, अस्मि I was.
explanation: 'I was not installed as heir apparent by Sugriva. I was made crowned prince by king Rama, the king of the people who never hurts others.

shloka_text: स पूर्वं बद्धवैरो मां राजा दृष्ट्वा व्यतिक्रमम्।।4.53.31।। घातयिष्यति दण्डेन तीक्ष्णेन कृतनिश्चयः।
translation: पूर्वम् earlier, बद्धवैरः nursed bitter enmity, सः राजा that king, व्यतिक्रमम् lapse, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कृतनिश्चयः decidedly, माम् me, तीक्ष्णेन with a severe, दण्डेन with punishment, घातयिष्यति he will inflict.
explanation: 'The Monkeyking nursed bitter enmity against me even earlier. Now seeing my lapse, he will decidedly inflict severe punishment on me.

shloka_text: किं मे सुहृदभिर्व्यसनं पश्यद्भिर्जीवितान्तरे।।4.53.32।। इहैव प्रायमासिष्ये पुण्ये सागररोधसि।
translation: जीवितान्तरे at the end of life, मे व्यसनम् my calamity, पश्यद्भिः by seeing, सुहृदभि: by my friends, किम् what, इहैव here itself, पुण्ये in a sacred, सागररोधसि on the shores of the ocean, प्रायमासिष्ये I shall sit down and await my death.
explanation: 'I do not want my friends to see my calamity, my death. I shall sit here on the sacred shores of this ocean and await my death'.

shloka_text: एतच्छ्रुत्वा कुमारेण युवराजेन भाषितम्।।4.53.33।। सर्वे ते वानरश्रेष्ठाः करुणं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।
translation: युवराजेन by heir apparent, कुमारेण by the young prince, भाषितम् talk, एतत् this, श्रुत्वा heard, सर्वे all, ते they, वानरश्रेष्ठाः  best of the monkeys करुणम् kindly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रुवन् said.
explanation: Hearing the young heir apparent thus speaking, the best of the monkeys kindly responded:

shloka_text: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवः प्रियासक्तश्च राघवः।।4.53.34।। अदृष्टायां तु वैदेह्यां दृष्ट्वाऽस्मांश्त समागतान्। राघवप्रियकामार्थं घातयिष्यत्यसंशयम्।।4.53.35।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, राघव: Rama, प्रियासक्तः devoted to his wife, वैदेह्याम् princess of Videha, अदृष्टायाम् when she is not found, अस्मान् us, तु indeed, समागतान् reaching, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, राघवप्रियकामार्थम् in order to please Rama, असंशयम् without any doubt, घातयिष्यति he will punish us to death.
explanation: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh. Rama is devoted to his wife. Therefore, if Sugriva sees that we have not found Vaidehi and have returned (without fulfilling the mission) he will award death sentence to us in order to please Rama.There is no doubt.

shloka_text: तीक्ष्णः प्रकृत्या सुग्रीवः प्रियासक्तश्च राघवः।।4.53.34।। अदृष्टायां तु वैदेह्यां दृष्ट्वाऽस्मांश्त समागतान्। राघवप्रियकामार्थं घातयिष्यत्यसंशयम्।।4.53.35।।
translation: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, प्रकृत्या by nature, तीक्ष्णः harsh, राघव: Rama, प्रियासक्तः devoted to his wife, वैदेह्याम् princess of Videha, अदृष्टायाम् when she is not found, अस्मान् us, तु indeed, समागतान् reaching, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, राघवप्रियकामार्थम् in order to please Rama, असंशयम् without any doubt, घातयिष्यति he will punish us to death.
explanation: 'By nature Sugriva is harsh. Rama is devoted to his wife. Therefore, if Sugriva sees that we have not found Vaidehi and have returned (without fulfilling the mission) he will award death sentence to us in order to please Rama.There is no doubt.

shloka_text: न क्षमं चापराद्धानां गमनं स्वामिपार्श्वतः। इहैव सीतामन्विष्य प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य वा।।4.53.36।। नो चेद्गच्छाम तं वीरं गमिष्यामो यमक्षयम्।
translation: अपराद्धानाम् for offenders, स्वामिपार्श्वतः to the king's presence, गमनम् going, नक्षमम् is not proper, इहैव here itself, सीताम् Sita, अन्विष्य after searching, प्रवृत्तिम् whereabouts, उपलभ्य वा or after finding out, तं वीरम् to that hero, नो गच्छाम चेत् if we cannot go, यमक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, गमिष्यामः we will go.
explanation: 'Those who have failed in their mission, being offenders should not go to meet the king. Offenders are not forgiven. Here itself we will search for Sita and if we are able to know her whereabouts we will go back. Or else we will go to the abode of Yama'.

shloka_text: प्लवङ्गमानां तु भयार्दितानां श्रुत्वा वचस्तार इदं बभाषे। अलं विषादेन बिलं प्रविश्य वसाम सर्वे यदि रोचते वः।।4.53.37।।
